name: B Impact Assessment
description: This management tool, used by over 50,000 businesses worldwide, including over 3,000 Certified B Corporations, helps companies assess their impact on various stakeholders, including their workers, community, customers, and the environment.

questions.guidance: This question will be used for scored calculation questions later in the assessment.  Please complete for accurate scoring. If your company has not yet completed its first fiscal year, please put $0
questions.documentationText: Please provide a document to verify the company's total revenue from the last fiscal year. For example, a copy of the company's Income Statement (Profit & Loss) or some other accounting report showing company income.

questions.guidance: If your company has not yet completed its first fiscal year, please put $0

questions.label: From the fiscal year before last
Do all Board members and officers complete an annual conflict of interest questionnaire?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide your company’s conflict of interest questionnaire for Board Members and either 1) an excerpt from the Board Charter (or similar document) that states that the survey is filled out annually or 2) copies of the survey from the past two years. 

Reminders
To qualify for this question, the conflict of interest questionnaire must be answered by all Board Members.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to the Audit Committee of your company's Board of Directors?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the characteristics of the Audit Committee of your Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Minutes or agendas from all of the Audit Committee’s meetings last fiscal year.
Checkbox 2: List of Audit Committee members and whether the individual has a relationship with the company outside of the Board (e.g. employee, investor, etc).
Checkbox 3: Employee handbook or policy that clearly explains how to contact the Audit Committee in the event of concern by internal auditors.
Checkbox 4: Audit report that includes auditor fees.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your company's Board of Directors?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the practices and authority of your company’s Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: At least four dated meeting minutes or agendas from your company’s Board meetings last year.
Checkbox 2: Board bylaws, Board charter, etc. that state the expected minimum attendance rate.
Checkbox 3: Board bylaws, Board charter, etc. that gives the Board access to funds to hire independent consultants without management approval.
Checkbox 4: Two recent Board self-assessments.
Checkbox 5: Two recent independent Board assessments. 

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.label: Does your company maintain any of the following financial controls?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what financial protection systems are in place at your company to help ensure good governance. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: List of employees that are responsible for Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable duties, company policy.
Checkbox 2: List of employees that are responsible for payment authorization, execution, and/or record keeping, company policy.
Checkbox 3: List of employees that have access to accounting software systems and the employee’s title, company policy.
Checkbox 4: List of employees that have access to credit or ATM cards and the employee’s title, company policy.
Checkbox 5: IT password and access policies, emails reminding employees to change passwords and a list of employees or an org chart that states the access level of each individual/department.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your company's Board of Directors?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the practices and composition of your company’s Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Meeting minutes with all Board Members listed, link to Board Member biographies on the company’s website, etc. with the independent members identified.
Checkbox 2: List of Board Members and how many other Boards each individual currently serves on.
Checkbox 3: Board bylaws that include term limits. 
Checkbox 4: Board bylaws or Board Charter document that states that the Board Chair cannot be the company’s CEO.
Checkbox 5: Governing documents showing required Board composition, list of Board Members stating how long each has been a cooperative member.

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.label: What is the company's highest level of corporate oversight?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a relevant section of the company’s governing documents which state the highest level of corporate accountability and list the individuals who make up that group.

More Details 
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of the individuals who make up the company’s highest level of corporate oversight.
2) Title (i.e. owner, manager, employee, advisor, member of Board of Directors). 

Governing documents may include article of incorporation, LLC operating agreement, etc.

questions.summary: Breached Code of Ethics Breachment Policy
questions.label: In cases where there are material breaches to your company's Code of Ethics, what actions are formally outlined for your company?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what happens if there is a violation of the company’s Code of Ethics policy. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documentation may include the company’s Code of Ethics or other relevant procedural documents with the breach protocol codified in a distributed written policy.

Reminders
A Code of Ethics is a document that establishes behavioral expectations for the organization and people who work there. It is sometimes called a Code of Conduct or Code of Business Standards.

questions.label: Which of the following stakeholder groups are required to participate in regular training on your company's Code of Ethics?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide 1) your company’s Code of Ethics training materials and 2) a calendar that shows scheduled trainings and/or invitations to trainings. If not clearly indicated, please also describe the audience for each training. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your company's Board of Directors?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the practices and composition of your company’s Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1-2: All meeting minutes or agendas from your company’s Board meetings last year.
Checkbox 3-4: Meeting minutes with all Board Members listed, link to Board Member biographies on the company’s website, etc. with the independent members identified.
Checkbox 5: Meeting minutes that show a discussion of executive compensation, Board Charter document stating the responsibilities of the Board.
Checkbox 6: Meeting minutes from the Board’s Audit Committee that includes attendees. Please also identify the independent member. 
Checkbox 7: Meeting minutes from the Board’s Compensation Committee that includes attendees. Please also identify the independent member. 
Checkbox 8: Governing documents showing required Board composition, list of Board Members stating how long each has been a cooperative member.

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.label: Does your company maintain any of the following financial controls?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what financial protection systems are in place at your company to help ensure good governance. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Fraud risk assessments from the past two years and, if applicable, minutes from either a Board Meeting or a senior management meeting discussing deficiencies.
Checkbox 2: Org chart showing internal audit department and instructions given to that group on how to contact the Board of Directors and Board Audit Committee.
Checkbox 3: Job descriptions for both managers and applicable employees that include responsibilities for financial reporting and limits around disbursements.
Checkbox 4: Documented financial control activities, including cash disbursement, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and inventory management. 
Checkbox 5: Screengrabs of automated financial controls with detailed captions, receipt for the purchase of a software and a description of how the company uses it, employee training on automated financial controls (e.g. slide decks, videos, handouts, etc).

questions.label: Does your company maintain any of the following financial controls?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what financial protection systems are in place at your company to help ensure good governance. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: IT password and access policies, emails reminding employees to change passwords and a list of employees or an org chart that states the access level of each individual/department.
Checkbox 2: Fraud risk assessments from the past two years and, if applicable, minutes from either a Board Meeting or a senior management meeting discussing deficiencies.
Checkbox 3: Policies on financial controls.
Checkbox 4: Documented financial control activities, including cash disbursement, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and inventory management.

questions.label: Does the institution have any of the following practices related to growth rate?
questions.documentationText:
Please provide documentation to support selected answer(s). If more than one option was selected, please provide documentation to support two answer options:
1. Copy of the last assessment evaluating the market conditions at the branches looking at client well-being and institutional sustainability 
2. Copy of report detailing the set growth rates for a period of 3-5 years considering internal factors like workload and staff skill sets
3. Copy of guideline detailing the sustainable growth rates 
4. Copy of report detailing any corrective measures undertaken

questions.label: What is required by your company's Code of Ethics?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide your company's Code of Ethics policy.

More Details
Please use the comment feature to state the page number where each selected answer option can be found. 

Reminders
Simply engaging in a behavior does not count for this question. There must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

questions.label: How does your company instruct employees regarding your Code of Ethics on behavioral expectations, bribery, and corruption?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate company training on expected workplace ethics. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Minutes or an agenda from two years of Board meetings in which the Code of Ethics was discussed.
Checkbox 2: Presentation or information packet given to new hires that includes the details of the Code of Ethics.
Checkbox 3: Agenda or notes from a management meeting that includes instruction on the Code of Ethics.
Checkbox 4: All-staff presentation or meeting agenda that includes instruction on the Code of Ethics.
Checkbox 5: Emails sent to workers communicating changes to the company’s Code of Ethics.
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company instructs employees regarding your Code of Ethics on behavioral expectations, bribery, and corruption.

Reminders
A Code of Ethics is a document that establishes behavioral expectations for the organization and people who work there. It is sometimes called a Code of Conduct or Code of Business Standards. The answer options refer to instruction based on a written policy, not whether the company informs employees of behavioral expectations, bribery, and corruption in general terms.

questions.label: Does your company's formal, written corporate mission statement include any of the following?
questions.guidance: A formal written corporate mission statement is one that is either publicly facing or formally shared with the employees of the company.  Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a document that includes your corporate mission statement (e.g. in your employee handbook, annual report, etc.) or a link to a relevant webpage.

Reminders
The mission statement is a concise message that expresses how your company generates financial, social, and/or environmental value through its business activities.

questions.label: Please share the text of your formal mission statement here.
questions.documentationText: Please provide a copy or link to the online official corporate mission statement.

questions.label: Which of the following anti-corruption reporting and prevention systems are in place?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how the company supports efforts to prevent corruption in its organization. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Whistle-blowing policy.
Checkbox 2: Emails sent to employees and business partners with whistle-blowing policy details.
Checkbox 3: Anti-corruption presentation or agenda from an annual meeting that includes this topic. Please also describe the audience for the materials.
Checkbox 4: Anti-corruption training materials (e.g. slide decks, handouts, videos, etc) and invitation to annual training.
Checkbox 5: Anti-corruption support tools (e.g. extra resources provided to high risk departments).
Checkbox 6: Relevant section of the employee handbook or picture of a posted sign that states anonymous mechanisms available to report anti-corruption concerns (e.g. phone line, email, etc).
Checkbox 7: Instructions to employees on how to report an anti-corruption matter to the Board of Directors.
Checkbox 8: Link to partnership webpage that includes your company, email welcoming your company to the anti-corruption coalition.
Checkbox 9: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding the anti-corruption reporting and prevention systems in place at your company.

questions.label: Has your company done any of the following to engage stakeholders about your social and environmental performance?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company solicits inputs from stakeholders on the company’s social and environmental performance. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: List of Advisory Board Members, including which are stakeholders and what constituency that individual represents.
Checkbox 2: Stakeholder engagement plan/policy that identifies stakeholder groups.
Checkbox 3: Stakeholder engagement plan that includes strategies for including traditionally underrepresented stakeholder populations. 
Checkbox 4: Stakeholder engagement plan/policy that states how information will be routinely collected from stakeholders and how frequently, as well as verification of information collection (e.g. notes from focus groups, surveys, community meetings, etc.).
Checkbox 5: Stakeholder engagement plan/policy that describes the formal mechanism for addressing information gathered from stakeholder engagement initiatives and designation of the individuals/groups responsibility for follow ups.
Checkbox 6: Minutes from a Board of Directors meeting that includes discussion of stakeholder feedback.
Checkbox 7: Link to website that shows stakeholder feedback and your company’s response.
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company engages stakeholders on its social and environmental performance.

Reminders
Stakeholder feedback must be on the topic of the company’s social and environmental impacts (not product quality, customer service, etc) to qualify for this question. 

Examples of stakeholder include representatives from civil society, customers, environmental groups, other workers and their trade unions, local communities, and suppliers.

questions.label: How are social or environmental performance principles and practices incorporated into employee training programs?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the training materials used to teach employees what social or environmental values and activities should be a part of their work.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Orientation training materials (e.g. slide decks, videos, handouts, etc) that include social or environmental performance principles and practices.
Checkbox 3: Training material provided to current staff and managers (e.g. slide decks, videos, handouts, etc) that include social or environmental performance principles and practices.
Checkbox 4: Performance reviews with individual social and environmental goals outlined. 
Checkbox 5: Supervisor/manager specific training (e.g. slide decks, videos, handouts, etc) on setting goals and ensuring accountability for the company’s desired social and environmental impacts.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time managers had a formal written performance evaluation in the last year that included social or environmental goals?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the number of full-time managers who are evaluated on social or environmental criteria in their performance reviews.

More Details
Spreadsheet or a modified employee roster should include:

1) Manager name or indicator (Manager 1, 2, etc).
2) Manager's Title.
3) Description of social or environmental targets in performance review.
4) Total number of managers at the company.

In addition, please provide a written performance review for a manager -- either completed or a blank template -- that includes social and environmental expectations.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Does your company's Board of Directors have voting seats representing:
questions.guidance: Select all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of the company’s Board of Directors that includes what interest the individual represents (if applicable), their qualifications related to the topic, and if the individual is a voting member.

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.summary: Social or Environmental Performance Related Executive Job Descriptions
questions.label: What social or environmental issues appear in performance-related responsibilities or expectations outlined in the job descriptions of the CEO and the CEO’s direct reports?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide job descriptions, bonus plans, and/or performance reviews that show what aspects of the company’s social and environmental performance are the responsibility of the CEO and the CEO’s direct reports. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

Reminders
Issues related to the company’s social and environmental impacts must extend beyond the sale of a product, even if the product itself has a positive social or environmental attribute.

Your answer options should reference what is expected of the CEO and all of the CEO’s direct reports, not just a few members of that group.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your company's Board of Directors or equivalent governing body?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the practices and composition of your company’s Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Meeting minutes from at least two Board meetings last year.
Checkbox 2: Meeting minutes with all Board Members listed, link to Board Member biographies on the company’s website, etc. with the independent members identified.
Checkbox 3: Meeting minutes that show a discussion of executive compensation, Board Charter document stating the responsibilities of the Board.
Checkbox 4: Governing documents showing required Board composition, list of Board Members stating how long each has been a cooperative member.

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.summary: Board Review of Social or Environmental Performance
questions.label: Does the Board of Directors or equivalent governing body review your company's social or environmental performance on at least an annual basis?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide dated minutes or an agenda from a Board of Directors meeting to show what aspects of the company’s social and environmental performance are reviewed by the company’s Board of Directors.

Reminders
The company’s explanation of its social and environmental impacts must extend beyond the sale of a product, even if the product itself has a positive social or environmental attribute. Therefore, a solar installation company that only presents its revenue generated or kWH installed would not qualify for this question. The Board of Directors must review, for example, the total carbon offset by the company’s solar projects that year.

questions.label: Does your company's Board of Directors have written responsibility for:
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the Board Charter or similar governing document that includes the selected answer/s as an expectation for the company’s Board of Directors. 

Reminders
Simply engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. There must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced. 

A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time managers have social or environmental mission-related responsibilities or expectations in their job descriptions?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of managers with social or environmental performance related responsibilities and either a job description or performance review for each individual that includes those expectations.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Manager name or indicator (Manager 1, 2, etc).
2) Manager’s Title.
3) Social or environmental job responsibilities.
4) Total Number of Managers at the Company.

Reminders
Issues related to the company’s social and environmental impacts must extend beyond the sale of a product, even if the product itself has a positive social or environmental attribute.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your shareholder engagement practices?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company engages with its shareholders. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Proxy voting instructions provided to shareholders.
Checkbox 2: Screengrab of web platforms, training for employees, and/or descriptions of mechanisms to allow shareholders to cast confidential votes.
Checkbox 3-5: Company governing documents that describe shareholder authority, including how many votes per share, what items shareholders can vote on, and whether shareholders can nominate Board Members.
Checkbox 6: Emails or letters sent to shareholders that include both the company’s financial and ESG performance.

questions.label: Which of your executives have their compensation tied to achieving specific social and environmental metrics or objectives?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate which executive or senior level employees have their compensation tied to social and environmental performance targets. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or a modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee's name or indicator (Executive 1, Senior Manager 2, etc).
2) Employee's Title.
3) Description of social and environmental metrics that impact compensation.

In addition, please include a sample offer letter, performance review, or Board Meeting minutes to show that compensation awarded was, in part, based on meeting social and environmental goals. 

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.summary: Management of Material Social and Environmental Issues
questions.label: How does your company identify, measure, and manage the most material social and environmental issues relevant to your operations and business model?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks metrics and sets targets around your material social and environmental impacts. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Sustainability report that includes social and environmental impact metrics and rationale for selection.
Checkbox 2: Materiality assessment, including methodology.
Checkbox 3: Materiality assessment that includes social and environmental impact metric recommendations.
Checkbox 4: Materiality assessment that includes performance targets for all identified social and environmental issues. 
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report that includes analysis of social and environmental performance over time and what outcomes were the result.

Reminders
Research and goals must be on the topic of the company’s social and environmental impacts (not product quality, customer service, etc) to qualify for this question.

questions.label: Does your company have a written statement or policy to publicly disclose executive compensation?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the written statement/policy in which your company has committed to publicly disclosing executive compensation and a link to where compensation information can be found.

Reminders
Public is defined as available to any interested party within the general public.

Disclosure should include annual total compensation, which includes salary, bonus, stock awards, option awards, non-equity incentive plan compensation, change in pension value and nonqualified deferred compensation earnings and all other compensation.

questions.label: Current Total Full-Time Workers
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.label: Describe your company's approach to creating positive impact.
questions.guidance: This is an unweighted question that will not impact your score and is asked only for research/benchmarking purposes.

questions.summary: # of Full Time Workers Last Year
questions.label: Total full-time workers twelve months ago
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.label: What type of individual or entity conducted the review of your company's financials?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the most recent dated review or audit letter of the company’s financials that includes 1) the name of firm who completed the work and 2) their accreditation.

questions.label: Current Total Part-Time Workers
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.summary: # of Part Time Workers Last Year
questions.label: Total part-time workers twelve months ago
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.label: Which financial reporting standards did your company comply with in the last fiscal year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the letter from your company’s accountant that describes what standard was used to assess your financial information from the last fiscal year.

questions.label: Current Total Temporary Workers
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.label: Does your company share receipts of all crop sales, price, and quantity?
questions.guidance: If the company does not have any land under cultivation, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate who is given access to receipts of crop sales, price, and quantity. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include email communications (if not clear, please indicate what audience the email was sent to, i.e. managers, employees, growers/members, etc), posted flyers, a webpage, etc.

questions.label: Total temporary workers twelve months ago
questions.guidance: Please click "Learn More" to understand how to answer this question.

questions.label: Does the company produce financials that are verified annually by an independent source through an Audit or Review?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the most recent dated review or audit letter of the company’s financials. The document should describe the scope of the work and clearly indicate the name of the independent auditing/reviewing firm.

questions.label: Are the majority (greater than 50%) of your employees paid on a fixed salary or a daily or hourly wage?
questions.guidance: This is a REQUIRED question that determines the set of additional questions your company will respond to regarding your employee impact.

questions.label: Does the company produce financials that are reviewed or audited by the Board, other formal governing body, or independent third party?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the most recent letter from an independent third party that describes the scope of the review/audit that was performed on the company’s financials. If not applicable, please upload meeting minutes from either the Board of Directors or another governing body in which the company’s financials were reviewed/audited.

questions.summary: Total Permanent FT and PT Workers
questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "Current Total Full-Time Workers" plus "Current Total Part-Time Workers"

questions.summary: Total Permanent FT and PT Workers Last Year
questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "Total full-time workers twelve months ago" plus "Total part-time workers twelve months ago"
How does your company formally share financial information with full-time employees?
questions.guidance: Exclude compensation data.  Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the level and frequency of exposure and/or education a full-time employee receives on the company's finances. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2-3: Two dated presentations to employees with financial information, two dated emails that include financial information (please include attachment), or a screenshot of the contents of a folder available to all employees on a shared drive, etc.
Checkbox 4: Educational materials given to employees to help their understanding of the financial information and concepts (e.g. presentations, handouts, training videos, etc).
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage with company’s financial information.

Reminders
This question asks that all financial information (except for salaries) be shared with full-time employees. If only top-level details are made available to workers, it would not fulfill the intent of this question.

questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "Current Total Temporary Workers" plus "Total FT and PT Workers in the last reporting period"
This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "Total FT and PT Workers twelve months ago" plus "Total temporary workers twelve months ago"

questions.summary: Amount of Training for New Hires
questions.label: What was the average amount of training that a newly hired worker received in the past twelve months?
questions.guidance: Use average of both full-time and part-time employees.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the on-the-job training experience of a newly hired employee.

More Details
Sample documents may include a screengrab of the calender of recent hire that includes their scheduled training for the relevant time period and/or an outline of required training provided to employees that shows the content and expected timeframe to complete the material.

Reminders
Uploaded items must reflect practices that have occurred within the past 12 months.

questions.label: What percentage of employees has been internally promoted within the last 12 months?
questions.guidance: Exclude material owners in your calculation.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of the non-entry level positions filled within the last 12 months and the former title of the employee who now has that role but previously worked for the company in a different capacity.

questions.label: How many paid days of professional development do the majority of full time workers receive in a single year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show the annual number of paid professional development days given to the majority of workers.

More Details
Sample documents include the relevant section of the employee handbook, the company's professional development policy or an offer letter for a non-management employee.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What information does your company make transparent regarding your Board of Directors?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a link to a webpage or other public platform that has the details of the composition, attendance, and/or renumeration of your company’s Board of Directors. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible for the governance of a corporation and responsible to the company’s shareholders (and sometimes stakeholders as well). Generally, a Board of Directors is characterised by formality of process, i.e. the Board has regular meetings in which minutes are taken.

questions.label: What management training and coaching do new and existing managers regularly receive?
questions.guidance: Check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the training and coaching options available to managers to improve their management skills. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Documents may include a screengrab of training calendar, an email or other communication to the management team with course listings, relevant section of the employee handbook, etc. Please also upload the syllabus or agenda of the class if the selected topic is not referenced in the title of the training.

If those items are not available, please provide a list of all managers and a description of the trainings each participated in over the course of the past three years.

questions.label: How has the institution incorporated complaints and feedback?
questions.documentationText: Please provide documentation demonstrating how the company has incorporated client feedback to inform product development, in staff evaluation and/or improve operations to meet client needs.

questions.label: Does the company produce financials that are audited annually by an internationally accredited Certified Public Accountant (CPA)?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the most recent audit or review letter from the company’s auditor that includes the level of analysis completed.

questions.label: How does your company manage the hiring and treatment of interns?
questions.guidance: Check all that apply.  If there is no third party living wage calculated for your country of operations, please do not select "payment of a living wage."
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the internship experience at your company. Evidence must be provided for all answer options selected. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Agenda and/or presentations given during an intern’s orientation, packet of information given to interns at the beginning of their tenure that includes internship objectives.
Checkbox 2: Contracts signed or emails exchanged with educational institutions that include details of internship or work-study partnerships.
Checkbox 3: Intern hourly wage and link to the living wage data used for comparison.
Checkbox 4: Example of intern performance review.
Checkbox 5: Example of questionnaire that interns were given to provide their feedback, notes from meeting with interns to learn about their experiences.
Checkbox 6: List of current employees who were previously interns at the company, the date of their hire as a full-time employee, and the date their internship began. 
Checkbox 7: Excerpt from employee handbook that states that internships will not exceed one year, unless the intern is enrolled in an academic program.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture consistent and deliberate practices, not occasional activities with certain individuals. 

If an activity is not written into a company policy, it must have at least two years of history.

questions.label: Does the company produce a public-facing annual report detailing its social and environmental performance that includes any of the following?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide your most recent annual report that includes the details of the company’s social and environmental performance and a link to show where it is made available to the public. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
If the content of your report was informed by input from relevant stakeholder groups, please also include notes from focus groups, emails exchanged, etc. to illustrate that checkbox.

questions.label: What kind of Employee Retirement Plan is available for all tenured workers at your company?
questions.guidance: Retirement plans may include Pensions, Profit sharing, 401(k), etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the relevant section of the employee handbook, a benefits package, an offer letter for an entry-level worker, etc. that includes the details of the company’s retirement plan. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

questions.label: What additional benefits are offered to all full-time tenured workers?
questions.guidance: Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what benefits your company offers to all full-time tenured employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, an offer letter for a full-time entry-level employee, a benefits information packet or plan summaries from the insurance company/contracts with service providers that include who is eligible for the described benefits.

Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.

questions.label: Does your company publicly share information on your social or environmental performance on an annual basis?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a link to a webpage or other public platform that has the details of the company’s social and environmental performance. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

Reminders
Information must be updated at least annually to qualify for this question.

questions.label: What supplementary benefits are provided to a majority of non-managerial workers?
questions.guidance: Including full time and part time employees.  Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation on the benefits your company provides to the majority of its non-managerial employees, above and beyond what is required by law. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents include an employee handbook, receipts of payment for services provided, and/or pictures of onsite services provided with detailed captions.

Reminders
Items selected must be available to at least 80% of non-managerial employees. In general terms, non-managerial employees are responsible for their own workload but not the overall direction of the company or the management of other individuals. 

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its employees and their families, not a legal obligation.

questions.label: What benefits does your company provide to all full-time tenured workers to supplement government programs?
questions.guidance: Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what benefits your company offers to its full-time employees above and beyond what is required by law. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, plan summaries from the insurance company, contracts with service providers, and/or a benefits information packet given to employees.

Reminders
Items selected must be made available to all full-time tenured employees, not provided on an ad hoc basis.

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its full-time employees, not a legal obligation.

Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.

questions.label: What supplementary benefits are provided to a majority of non-managerial workers?
questions.guidance: Including full time and part time employees.  Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation on the benefits your company provides to the majority of its non-managerial employees, above and beyond what is required by law. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents include an employee handbook, receipts of payment for services provided, and/or pictures of onsite services provided with detailed captions.

Reminders
Items selected must be available to at least 80% of non-managerial employees. In general terms, non-managerial employees are responsible for their own workload but not the overall direction of the company or the management of other individuals. 

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its employees and their families, not a legal obligation.

questions.label: Your company's healthcare plan available to all full-time workers includes:
questions.guidance: Select all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the specifics of the company's health insurance plan. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, plan summaries from the insurance company, and/or a benefits information packet for new employees.

If your country has a national healthcare plan and those benefits meet the criteria of the answer option, please provide a link/document that highlights the relevant details of the government plan. Your company is eligible for credit regardless of whether your company or government pays for the coverage.

Reminders
Please only pick one health insurance plan to validate your answer options, even if multiple plans are offered to your employees. Benefits selected must reflect the experience of an employee who has selected a specific health insurance plan.

questions.label: On an FTE basis, what percentage of your employees is enrolled in the healthcare coverage previously identified?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if workers only receive health care through a national plan.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all individuals currently working for the company, their employment status (i.e. full-time, part-time, etc), and whether the employee is currently utilizing the company’s health insurance benefits.

More Details
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. Either should include:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, Employee 2, etc).
2) Employment status (If the employee is not a full-time employee, please indicate how many hours per week are worked).
3) Whether the employee is currently utilizing your company's health insurance coverage.

Reminders
You may redact employee names.

questions.label: What benefits are offered to all seasonal-only workers on your farm?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if you are a cooperative.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what benefits your company offers to its seasonal employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, plan summaries from the insurance company/contracts with service providers that include who is eligible for the described benefit or a benefits information packet given to seasonal employees.

Reminders
Items selected must be made available to all seasonal employees, not provided on an ad hoc basis.

questions.label: What benefits are offered to all seasonal-only workers on your farm?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if you are a cooperative.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what benefits your company offers to its seasonal employees above and beyond what is required by law. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, plan summaries from the insurance company, contracts with service providers, and/or a benefits information packet given to seasonal employees.

Reminders
Items selected must be made available to all seasonal employees, not provided on an ad hoc basis.

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its seasonal employees, not a legal obligation.

questions.label: What percentage of workers receive healthcare coverage either through a government plan or paid by the company?
questions.guidance: If healthcare is covered through the company, only consider workers for which the company pays the majority of healthcare costs.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all individuals currently working for the company and indicate whether the employee is eligible for the company's health insurance benefits (if the company pays the majority of the costs) or receives health insurance through a national healthcare program. 

More Details
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. Either should include:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, Employee 2, etc).
2) Employment location (city/state/country).
3) Whether the employee is eligible for your company's health insurance coverage when the majority of costs are paid by the company (if applicable). If so, please provide the contract with the health insurance provider. 
4) Whether the employee receives health insurance through a national healthcare plan (if applicable). If so, please also provide a link to a government webpage that describes the benefits available to workers.
5) Total number of employees working for the company.
6) Demonstration of calculation steps to arrive at the correct answer.

Reminders
You may redact employee names.

questions.summary: Initiatives To Increase Wages and Benefits
questions.label: If it is not possible to verify a living wage in your country, has your company participated in any leadership initiatives/agreements to increase wages or benefits to workers provided in your country or industry?
questions.guidance: Examples include commissioning a living wage calculation.  Select N/A if living wage already exists.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company has sought to increase wages or benefits to workers in your country or industry through public leadership or advocacy.

More Details
Documents may include press releases, links to webpages, event flyers, petitions signed, etc.

Reminders
This question is only applicable if your country does not already have a calculated living wage.

questions.label: What secondary parental leave policies are available to your workers, either through your company or a government program?
questions.guidance: Select all that apply, but only select one answer indicating the total amount of paid time equivalent (answers 2-4). See "Learn" for further instructions.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence to verify the number of days of secondary parental leave available to all tenured full-time employees and whether that time is paid or unpaid. 

More Details
Documents may include the relevant section of your employee handbook, a parental leave policy, or an offer letter to an entry-level recent hire.

Reminders
Please include time made available through your company’s policies and any secondary parental leave required by the government. This question is seeking to capture the overall amount of time that an employee has available to bond with their child, regardless of the source.

questions.label: How is healthcare provided in the country where the majority of employees reside?
On average, approximately how much time did each worker spend on dedicated, job-related training or education in the past twelve months?
questions.guidance: Please do not include on-the-job training as a part of this particular question.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who took part in job-related training or education in the last 12 months (not including new employee orientation) and the average number of hours each individual spent on those activities. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Number of hours spent on training/education.
5) Total number of FTE (full-time equivalent) employees.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert), external workshops, conferences, courses, etc. but should not include new employee orientation.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Do employees have access to any of the following savings programs for retirement?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what retirement savings programs are available to your employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents include the relevant section of your employee handbook, the retirement plan section of your employee benefits guide, and/or pamphlets from retirement plan providers given to employees.

Reminders
Answer options must represent programs that are available to at least 80% of your workforce.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time workers has participated in external professional development or lifelong learning opportunities in the past fiscal year?
questions.guidance: Professional development should be paid for in advance, reimbursed or subsidized by the company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of full-time employees who have taken advantage of external professional development opportunities that were paid for or subsidized by the company in the past fiscal year.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training, including the name of the educational institution/training provider.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of full-time employees.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What multiple is the highest compensated individual paid, inclusive of bonus, as compared to the lowest paid full-time worker?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the total amount paid to the highest paid employee at the company (including bonuses, if given) and the total amount paid to the lowest paid employee at the company (including bonuses, if given). Please also provide evidence of those totals.

More Details
The total amounts paid can be reported in a table or spreadsheet. 

Examples of evidence to validate the data:

1) Paystubs for the highest and lowest paid employee.
2) Relevant excerpt from the employee contracts for the highest and lowest paid employee.

Reminders
You may redact employee names or sensitive identity information on any document provided. 

If you have a mix of full and part-time employees, please keep in mind that your lowest paid employee might be one of your part-time staff. If that is the case, please include the number of hours the part-time employee works.

Please note that total compensation amount should include bonuses but not sales commissions. Sales commission structures can result in extreme pay variations and the purpose of this question is to capture a snapshot of predictable pay that employees can use to plan their financial future.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time and part-time employees, excluding founders and executives, received a monetary bonus in the last fiscal year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload a list of all non-executive full and part time employees and indicate which employees received a bonus (excluding sales commissions) in the last fiscal year and the employee’s role/title at the company.

More Details 
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. A spreadsheet should include:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, Employee 2, etc). 
2) Employee title (i.e. Marketing Associate).
3) Description of bonus received, if applicable.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided. 

This question is only intended to capture whether non-executive employees received a bonus last fiscal year. In general terms, non-executive employees are those responsible for their own workload but not the overall direction of the company or the management of other individuals. Please remember to include all non-executive employees in the list, not just those that received a bonus.

Sales commissions do not count as bonuses for this question.

questions.label: Skills-based training to advance core job responsibilities
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received training to improve proficiency in their core job responsibilities in the past 12 months, not including content covered during new employee orientation. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert), not external workshops, conferences, or courses.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Skills-based training on cross-job functions beyond regular responsibilities (e.g. public speaking training, management training for non-managers)
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received training on skills outside of their core job responsibilities in the past 12 months, not including content covered during new employee orientation. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee title.
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture either formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert) or external workshops, conferences, and courses.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Training on life skills for personal development (e.g. literacy, personal financial planning, languages)
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received non-job related life skills training in the past 12 months.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
The intent of this question is to capture educational opportunities that support an employee’s personal development such as personal financial planning, conflict resolution, stress management, English as a second language, etc. Either formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert) or external workshops, conferences, and courses would qualify. 

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time workers received advancement or reimbursement for continuing education opportunities in the last fiscal year?
questions.guidance: Continuing education opportunities include GED, college credits, industry-recognized accreditation, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of full-time employees who participated in an educational opportunity that will be a material addition to the employee’s permanent record and was paid for or subsidized by the company in the past fiscal year.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of continuing education program.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of full-time employees.

Reminders
Continuing education refers to training that contributes to the permanent record of the individual’s educational history (e.g. a college degree). Programs that meet this threshold are generally longer than 3 months and cost your company more than $1,500.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.summary: % of Employees Paid Individual Living Wage
questions.label: What percentage of employees on an FTE (Full Time Equivalent) basis are paid at least the equivalent of a living wage for an individual?
questions.guidance: Please exclude students and interns in this calculation.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
If applicable, provide evidence of the third-party living wage accreditation. If you do not have this, then provide an overview of your chosen benchmark and the prevailing wage calculations.

More Details
1) Accreditation - Evidence of third-party accreditation can be in the form of an email confirmation from the accreditation provider or public mention on the provider’s website. Check that B Lab accepts your particular accreditation.

2) Living wage benchmark - share the benchmark data and, if applicable, indicate which data subset you have chosen (e.g. individual or family). Where information is publicly available, add a link to the source. Where data was purchased and is not publicly available, send the original data set. Note, WageIndicator and Fair Wage Network have informed B Lab that companies may share datasets for verification purposes. Use colors and notes to highlight which data is relevant for B Lab’s verification. 

3) Prevailing wages - share list of workers or roles and their wage components. If the base wage already meets the living wage benchmark, then you only need to provide the base wage. If you add extra wage components, such as benefits and bonuses, then include notes to explain what they are for and how they are earned. All wage data should be disaggregated, meaning all extra wage components should be listed separately. If you include extra wage components beyond the ones mentioned as examples in B Lab's guidance, include notes to justify how the components meet B Lab's principles for inclusion (as described in the Knowledge Base Article about living wage). Please clearly demonstrate in the document the rationale/calculation that justifies the % selected as the answer option.

4) All data should be harmonized, meaning they are based on the same rate (e.g. USD per month) and calculated pro rata (e.g. for those working part-time). Data should also be harmonized across locations, though they should remain in the local currency. The data and calculations you share should clearly show how you came to your answer (e.g. spreadsheet formulas should be visible).

Knowledge Base Article link: https://kb.bimpactassessment.net/en/support/solutions/articles/43000671646-answering-living-wage-questions-in-the-b-impact-assessment#5.-External-resources

Reminders
The living wage is not the minimum wage. A living wage usually goes beyond the minimum wage required by law and ensures that workers are able to meet a decent standard of living for them and their family.

Accepted living wage benchmarks can be found in the Knowledge Base Article. B Lab accepts benchmarks that cover most countries in the world, though the data is not always free.

If your company answered this question using prevailing wages calculations, you should be able to demonstrate how you followed the principles and steps prescribed in the Knowledge Base Article. 

You may redact employee names on documents.

questions.label: What percentage of full-time workers has participated in external professional development or lifelong learning opportunities in the past fiscal year?
questions.guidance: Professional development should be paid for in advance, reimbursed or subsidized by the company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of full-time employees who have taken advantage of external professional development opportunities that were paid for or subsidized by the company in the past fiscal year.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training, including the name of the educational institution/training provider.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of full-time employees.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What is the company's lowest wage as calculated on an hourly basis?
questions.guidance: Please exclude students and interns in this calculation.

questions.label: Skills-based training to advance core job responsibilities
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received training to improve proficiency in their core job responsibilities in the past 12 months, not including content covered during new employee orientation. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert), not external workshops, conferences, or courses.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Skills-based training on cross-job functions beyond regular responsibilities (e.g. public speaking training, management training for non-managers)
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received training on skills outside of their core job responsibilities in the past 12 months, not including content covered during new employee orientation. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee title.
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture either formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert) or external workshops, conferences, and courses.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Training on life skills for personal development (e.g. literacy, personal financial planning)
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of employees who have received non-job related life skills training in the past 12 months.

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified employee roster should include:

1) Employee name or indicator (Employee 1, 2).
2) Description of training.
3) Date of training (month and year).
4) Total number of employees, excluding newly hired workers.

Reminders
The intent of this question is to capture educational opportunities that support an employee’s personal development such as personal financial planning, conflict resolution, stress management, English as a second language, etc. Either formal in-house training (i.e. given by your own staff or a hired expert) or external workshops, conferences, and courses would qualify. 

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What is the annual minimum number of paid days off (including holidays) for full-time employees?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the minimum number of paid days off a tenured full-time employee would receive in a year. Vacation days, sick days, personal days, and holidays can all be counted toward the total. 

More Details 
Documents may include the relevant section of an employee handbook, an offer letter for a recent non-management hire, an excerpt from a benefits packet, etc.

questions.summary: Paid Primary Caregiver Leave for Hourly Workers
questions.label: What primary parental leave policies apply to your hourly workers, either through your company or a government program?
questions.guidance: If applicable, please select one answer indicating total time off (answers 1-3), and one answer indicating fully paid time off (answers 4-7).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence to verify the number of weeks of primary parental leave available to all tenured salaried employees and whether that time is paid or unpaid. 

More Details
Documents may include the relevant section of your employee handbook, a parental leave policy, or an offer letter to an entry-level recent hire.

Reminders
Please include time made available through your company’s policies and any parental leave required by the government. This question is seeking to capture the overall amount of time that an employee has available with their child, regardless of the source.

questions.label: What financial products, programs, or services does your company provide that help to meet financial health needs of hourly employees?
questions.guidance: Please answer this question ONLY taking into account hourly workers. If you do not have hourly workers, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company protects the financial security and well-being of its hourly employees (who are often at a greater risk of financial instability). Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include an employee handbook, an offer letter to an hourly employee with benefits listed or an onboarding presentation given to new hourly employees describing the additional support available to them.

Reminders
Occasionally engaging in the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. These benefits must be clearly communicated and available to at least 80% of your hourly workers.

questions.summary: Paid Primary Caregiver Leave for Salary Workers
questions.label: Which of the following describe the primary parental leave policies for salaried workers, either through the company or government program?
questions.guidance: If applicable, please select one answer indicating total time off (answers 1-3), and one answer indicating fully paid time off (answers 4-7).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence to verify the number of weeks of primary parental leave available to all tenured salaried employees and whether that time is paid or unpaid. 

More Details
Documents may include the relevant section of your employee handbook, a parental leave policy, or an offer letter to an entry-level recent hire.

Reminders
Please include time made available through your company’s policies and any parental leave required by the government. This question is seeking to capture the overall amount of time that an employee has available with their child, regardless of the source.

questions.label: What is the annual minimum number of paid days off (including holidays) for full-time employees?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the minimum number of paid days off tenured full-time employees receive in a year. Vacation days, sick days, personal days, and holidays can all be counted toward the total. 

More Details 
Documents may include the relevant section of an employee handbook, an offer letter for a recent non-management hire or a written and distributed paid time off policy.

questions.label: What safety processes are in place at all of your company worksites?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the actions that your company takes to ensure a safe environment at all worksites. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Manager job description that includes conducting a briefing for front-line workers at the beginning of every shift, front-line worker schedule which includes attendance at a briefing.
Checkbox 2: Most recent hazard or routine activity analysis.
Checkbox 3: Hazard analysis completed in response to the company’s most recent new purchase or an updated process.
Checkbox 4: Employee handbook, training materials, etc. which include a written statement that workers can shut down unsafe processes.

questions.label: When eliminating and tracking hazards, your company:
questions.guidance: Select those that apply to all company worksites.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company protects its workers from the dangers that may result from your company’s operations. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Hazard analysis that includes use of the hierarchy of hazard control.
Checkbox 2: Results of most recent Personal Protective Equipment assessment.
Checkbox 3: Hazard analysis report and a completed follow-up study related to that report.
Checkbox 4: Policies and written procedures that include hazard management.

questions.label: What percentage above the legal minimum wage does your lowest-paid hourly employee earn?
questions.guidance: Please answer this question ONLY taking into account hourly workers. If you do not have hourly workers, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the name and/or position of the lowest-paid hourly employee currently working for your company, their pay rate, and the address at which they work.

More Details
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. Either should include:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, etc) and/or position title. 
2) Employee's hourly pay.
3) Address of employment.
3) Minimum wage for the area where the individual is employed.

questions.label: What health and wellness initiatives or policies does your company offer beyond insurer-provided programs?
questions.guidance: Check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to support worker health and wellness. Please do not include programs sponsored by your insurance provider. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Email communications, flyers, screengrab from an employee portal, etc. describing health and wellness programs available during the work week.
Checkbox 2: Relevant section of employee handbook, benefits packet, etc. that shows incentives for workers who proactively engage in health and wellness activities.
Checkbox 3-4: Relevant section of employee handbook, screengrabs of resources available to employees. Please also include evidence of who is eligible for these programs.
Checkbox 5: Ergonomic policies, information given to employees about ergonomic programs available.
Checkbox 6: Spreadsheet, screengrab of tracking platform, etc. that shows what percentage of workers have completed a health risk assessment in the last 12 months.
Checkbox 7: Most recent report on worker participation in wellness programs given to management. 

Reminders
Programs must be available to at least 80% of your workforce to qualify for this question.

questions.label: What percent of your employees are "Satisfied" or "Engaged"?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if satisfaction or engagement is not formally surveyed.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a dated copy of your company’s most recent employee satisfaction survey and the results.

More Details
If your company’s employee satisfaction survey data is not broken down into a percentage response, please also provide the number of employees who answered in the affirmative for the satisfied/engaged question and the total number of employees. 

Reminders
To qualify for this question, a company must both send out employee surveys and also ask specifically whether employees are satisfied or engaged at work.

questions.label: Which of the following is included or applies to your company's formal process for providing performance feedback to employees?
questions.guidance: Check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a sample employee performance review form, any instructions provided to managers on how to complete the document, and the section of the company’s employee handbook that discusses performance feedback (preferably including who is eligible for reviews and how often the reviews should occur).

Reminders
Items selected must be made available to at least 80% of employees.

The feedback should be given as a part of a structured program, not provided on an ad hoc basis.

questions.summary: % of Company Owned by Non-Executive Employees
questions.label: What percentage of the company is owned by workers who are not executives or founders?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of non-executive employee owners, including the amount owned and their position at the company. 

More Details
Spreadsheet or modified capitalization table should include:

1) Owner’s name or identifier (e.g. Owner 1, 2, etc).
2) Employee’s title (e.g. Associate).
3) Type of ownership held (i.e. stock, stock options, stock equivalents).
4) The number of shares owned by that individual.
5) The total number of company shares.

Reminders
You may redact owner names on any document.

In general terms, any workers that are not a part of the top level of management at the company (i.e. are not "C-suite" workers) should be considered non-executive workers

questions.label: Has your company identified one of the following designated agents to mediate complaints or issues between workers or workers and management?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the relevant section of employee handbook, posted flyer, etc. that shares the name, title, responsibilities, and contact details of the individual who has been designated to address issues between workers and management. 

More Details
If not clear, please also provide a description of of the individual’s affiliation and/or how that person was selected.

Reminders
