questions.label: Waste Disposed: Recycled/Reused (metric tonnes) during the last 12 months
Waste Disposed (metric tonnes) during the last 12 months
If your company uses any hazardous materials on site, check all of the procedures that your company follows.
questions.guidance: Hazardous materials include chemicals, pesticides, and fertilizer.  Select N/A if you use no hazardous materials and chemicals.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company protects its employees and the environmental from exposure to hazardous waste at its place of operations. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Policies, posted flyers, handbooks or training resources that describe the safe storage, use, and disposal of each hazardous material.
Checkbox 2: Policy or relevant section of training materials that state protocols for how to seal and store hazardous materials and photographs of the area set aside for these containers.
Checkbox 3: Policy or relevant section of training materials that include labeling requirements for hazardous materials and photographs of a label on a container.

questions.label: Has your company purchased any of the following types of carbon credits during the last fiscal year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide receipts or certificates of purchase for carbon credits purchased by the company.

More Details
If the document does not clearly state whether the carbon credit is voluntary or certified, please include additional evidence to validate that claim (e.g. product fact sheet, vendor webpage describing the particular type of credit purchased, etc).

Reminders
A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. They are separate from Renewable Energy credits, which are captured in other questions.

questions.label: What is your current Carbon Intensity for Scopes 1 and 2 (measured in metric tons of CO2/$million of revenue), not including the use of carbon credits or offsets?
questions.guidance: Please use USD to allow for standardized comparisons.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions generated by your company last fiscal year (not including any purchased credits or offsets) and the total revenue from the same period.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Scope 1 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
2) Scope 2 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
3) Total revenues (in millions) last fiscal year.

Alternatively, you may upload a sustainability report or greenhouse gas audit with a carbon intensity value, so long as it includes the raw data that makes up the calculation. 

Reminders
Scope 1 carbon emissions include those generated directly by the company, including fuel combustion from heating, manufacturing, and company vehicles.

Scope 2 carbon emissions include those generated indirectly from purchased energy.

A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. They are separate from Renewable Energy credits, which are captured in other questions.

questions.label: What is your current Carbon Intensity for Scopes 1 and 2, not including the use of carbon credits or offsets?
questions.guidance: Please measure intensity in metric tons of CO2/$million of revenue. Please use USD to accurately evaluate the answer option.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions generated by your company last fiscal year (not including any purchased credits or offsets) and the total revenue from the same period.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Scope 1 carbon emissions last fiscal year.
2) Scope 2 carbon emissions last fiscal year.
3) Total revenues last fiscal year.

Alternatively, you may upload a sustainability report or greenhouse gas audit with a carbon intensity value, so long as it includes the raw data that makes up the calculation. 

Reminders
Scope 1 carbon emissions include those generated directly by the company, including fuel combustion from heating, manufacturing, and company vehicles.

Scope 2 carbon emissions include those generated indirectly from purchased energy.

A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. They are separate from Renewable Energy credits, which are captured in other questions.

questions.label: How does your company dispose of non-hazardous wastewater?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview 
Please provide documentation to illustrate what happens to the non-hazardous wastewater that the company produces through its operations. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2-3: Sewage treatment bill. If the disposal source is not referenced in the bill, please also provide a link to the website of the institution that processes the wastewater.
Checkbox 4: Photographs of on-site reclamation systems with detailed captions, blueprints or schematics for installed items.
Checkbox 5: Training materials for employees that explain protocols for water reuse or recycling, blueprints or schematics for technologies used.
Checkbox 6: Photographs of on-site watershed management practices with detailed captions, Watershed Management Plan.   
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence regarding the claim made regarding the disposal of the company’s non-hazardous wastewater.

Reminders
Answer options selected must be applicable to at least 80% of the company’s land or facilities.

questions.label: Does your company have a formal program to evaluate how to reduce its generation of hazardous, universal, and/or non-hazardous waste?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate a consistent and structured waste management program currently in place at the company.

More Details
Documents may include waste assessments and recommendations, waste generation reports for all categories of waste produced, or written policies on measuring and setting targets for waste reduction. 

Reminders
Zero Waste is when your company reuses or recycles more than 90% of waste produced (so that only about 10% of total waste is sent to a landfill) as a part of explicitly created waste management program.

questions.label: How does your company dispose of a majority of non-hazardous waste or garbage?
questions.documentationText: Please provide documentation to verify answers selected in EN4.1a. If you have selected more than one answer please provide documentation for at least two answers. Please match the answer order to the text below: 1. Photograph or receipt describing municipal garbage collection 2. Photograph or receipt describing composting garbage 3. Photograph or receipt describing how waste is separated and recycled; reusable waste is donated/provided to facilities that can reuse 4. Copy of certification or receipt of private 3rd party disposal 5. Copy of review or receipt of on-site disposal that is compliant with internationally-accepted methods 6. Other (describe)

questions.label: Which of the following methods is used to dispose of organic waste from crop cultivation?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify what happens to the organic waste generated through crop cultivation. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Pictures of compost receptacles and compost pile on-site, contract with a third-party compost disposal service.
Checkbox 3: Pictures of waste reuse method with a detailed caption, written and distributed farm policy regarding waste.
Checkbox 4: Contract between your company and a third-party waste disposal provider. Please also provide a copy of the waste disposal provider’s certification of responsible disposal methods.
Checkbox 5: Picture of biogas system at your farm with a detailed caption, schematics or receipts for the purchase of a biogas production equipment. 
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding disposal methods for organic waste from crop cultivation.

Reminders
Your answer should reflect the disposal method for the majority of organic waste produced during crop cultivation.

questions.summary: % Water Returned to Table with Same Quality
questions.label: What % of the water used by your company is returned to the watershed at the same or better quality than when it was withdrawn?
questions.guidance: i.e. % of water treated
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the amount and quality of the water that leaves your company.

More Details
Sample documents include water quality reports, internal or external analysis, tracking spreadsheets, etc. and must have a comparision to the quality of the water originally withdrawn. 

Also, documentation must indicate not only the water quality but also the number of gallons that are released at a specific standard and the number of gallons released overall.

questions.label: Does your company do the following with wastewater from irrigation?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide schematics, design plans, receipts from purchased products, and/or pictures of wastewater systems that include detailed captions of the water treatment process. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

Reminders
The scope of the selected practice should cover at least 80% of your facilities and/or land to qualify for this question.

questions.label: Can your company verify that your hazardous waste is always disposed of responsibly?
questions.guidance: This includes batteries, paint, electronic equipment, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that proves that any hazardous waste generated by your company is discarded in the most environmentally-responsible manner.

More Details
Documents may include a policy in the company’s employee handbook that states the expectation for hazardous waste disposal, a contract with a third-party waste disposal company, or receipts for the responsible recycling/disposal of products.

Reminders
This question is intended to capture any type of hazardous waste, including batteries, printer cartridges, electronic equipment, paint, etc.

questions.label: How does your company monitor and manage your significant air emissions?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for significant air emissions. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Significant air emissions report.
Checkbox 3: Significant air emissions report that includes emissions reduction goals.
Checkbox 4: Report with significant air emissions reduction goals and emissions data showing that the stated goal has been met during the reporting period.
Checkbox 5: Significant air emissions report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year. 

Reminders
Air emissions may include NOx, SOx, persistent organic pollutants (POP), VOCs, hazardous air pollutants, stack emissions, particulate matter, and other regulated categories.

questions.label: How does your company manage its greenhouse gas emissions for at least Scope 1 and 2?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate its greenhouse gas emissions. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 2: Two recent greenhouse gas emission inventories.
Checkbox 3: Two recent greenhouse gas emission inventories that include reduction goals based on previous performance.
Checkbox 4: Two recent greenhouse gas emission inventories that include reduction goals and the rationale for their selection. 
Checkbox 5: Report of greenhouse gas emissions that demonstrates a reduction during the current reporting period and an explanation of the desired target met.
Checkbox 6: Recent inventory of greenhouse gas emissions and receipts or confirmation emails of carbon offset purchases that include the total amount offset. 

Reminders
To qualify for this question, your company must take Scope 1 & 2 greenhouse gas emissions under consideration.

questions.label: How does your company monitor and manage your hazardous waste production?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for the hazardous waste it generates. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Hazardous waste report.
Checkbox 3-4: Hazardous waste report and sustainability report that includes hazardous waste reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with hazardous waste reduction targets and, if not included in the sustainability report, hazardous waste data showing the stated goal being met.
Checkbox 6: Hazardous waste report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year.

Reminders
Universal waste (i.e. batteries, pesticides, mercury-containing equipment, and lamps) is also classified as hazardous waste in context of this question.

questions.label: If your company purchased certified carbon credits in the reporting period, what % of Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions were offset?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the company's most recent total carbon emissions inventory and the amount offset with purchased carbon credits in the same period.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Total carbon emissions (in metric tons) during the reporting period.
2) Total certified carbon credits purchased (in metric tons) during the reporting period. 

Alternatively, you may upload a sustainability report that includes both of these data points.

Please also provide a receipt, certificate, etc. that shows how much carbon was offset through your purchase of credits.

Reminders
A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. They are separate from Renewable Energy credits, which are captured in other questions.

If not clear, please also clarify the details of the reporting period (i.e. last fiscal year, last five years, etc).

questions.label: How does your company monitor and manage your waste production?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for the waste it generates. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Waste report.
Checkbox 3-4: Waste report and sustainability report that includes waste reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with waste reduction targets and waste use data showing that the stated goal has been met.
Checkbox 6: Waste report from the most recent reporting period that includes a detailed description of the final destination of all waste.

questions.label: What percentage of Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions has been saved due to efficiency improvements implemented by your company?
questions.documentationText:
Overview 
Please upload documentation that shows the total Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gases emitted by your company in the last fiscal year and the amount emitted in either your baseline year or the year prior (e.g. a carbon inventory, sustainability report, etc.). 

More Details
If not included in your reporting document, please also provide a description of energy efficiency improvements that impacted your company's GHG emissions in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
Scope 1 emissions are greenhouse gas emissions from sources that are owned or controlled by the company. Scope 2 emissions are indirect emissions from the consumption of purchased electricity, heat or steam. 

This question is referring to deliberate steps taken to reduce the company's greenhouse gas footprint through its own actions, not the purchase of offsets.

questions.label: Which of the following describes how the company monitors hazardous and toxic wastewater?
questions.guidance: Monitoring hazardous and toxic wastewater may involve either monitoring the volume and/or the level of contamination.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for hazardous and toxic wastewater. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report.
Checkbox 3: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report and sustainability report that includes a description of emission reduction targets.
Checkbox 4: Sustainability report with hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions reduction targets and emissions reports from the past two years that show the stated goal being met. 
Checkbox 5: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year.

questions.summary: Controlling Worker Exposure to Hazardous Material
questions.label: How has your company assessed and managed worker exposure to hazardous materials?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a hazardous materials assessment that includes whether any worker exposure has occurred and, if applicable, a report summarizing your company’s mitigation and control strategies.

Reminders
The scope of the assessment should cover at least 80% of your facilities and/or land to qualify for this question.

questions.label: If your company uses any hazardous materials on site, check all of the procedures that your company follows.
questions.guidance: Hazardous materials include chemicals, pesticides, and fertilizer.  Select N/A if you use no hazardous materials and chemicals.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company protects its employees and the environmental from exposure to hazardous waste at its place of operations. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Policies, posted flyers, handbooks or training resources that describe the safe storage, use, and disposal of each hazardous material.
Checkbox 2: Policy or relevant section of training materials that state protocols for how to seal and store hazardous materials and photographs of the area set aside for these containers.
Checkbox 3: Policy or relevant section of training materials that include labeling requirements for hazardous materials and photographs of a label on a container.

questions.label: Has your company conducted an assessment of local communities' exposure to hazardous emissions from your manufacturing facilities and taken appropriate steps to mitigate?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a hazardous emissions assessment that includes whether any community exposure has occurred as a result of your company's manufacturing operations and, if applicable, a report summarizing your company’s mitigation and control strategies.

questions.summary: Programs to Reduce End of Life Waste
questions.label: Does the company have in place an active end-of-life product/component reclamation program to increase the useful life of parts and components?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the product/component reclamation program that your company has established to reduce the environmental footprint of a product once it has been used by a consumer.

More Details
Documents may include a link to webpage that includes information on what products your company will take back for disassembly/reprocessing/reuse and instructions for consumers on how to take advantage of the program, a contract that outlines the parameters of a third party product reclamation program paid for by your company, etc.

questions.label: Scope 1:
Scope 2:
Scope 3:
How does your company monitor, record and report your hazardous waste production?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for the hazardous waste it generates. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Hazardous waste report.
Checkbox 3-4: Hazardous waste report and sustainability report that includes hazardous waste reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes hazardous waste data and reduction targets.
Checkbox 6: Sustainability report with hazardous waste reduction targets and hazardous waste reports from the past two years that show the stated goal being met. 
Checkbox 7: Hazardous waste report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year.

Reminders
Universal waste (i.e. batteries, pesticides, mercury-containing equipment, and lamps) is also classified as hazardous waste in context of this question.

questions.label: What is your company's non-hazardous waste generation measured against revenue (i.e. metric tons per $million of revenue) in the last fiscal year?
questions.guidance: i.e. metric tons per million dollars of revenue.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide 1) the total amount of non-hazardous waste generated by the company last fiscal year and 2) the company’s total revenue last fiscal year.

More Details
Please convert the non-hazardous waste value to metric tons and convert your revenues to USD.

Data may be provided in a spreadsheet but, if available, please also upload the company’s waste audit or other annual report used by the company to measure and manage waste last fiscal year.

questions.label: What is your current Carbon Intensity for Scopes 1 and 2, measured in tons of CO2/$million of revenue, including the use of carbon credits or offsets?
questions.guidance: Please use USD to accurately evaluate the answer option.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions generated by your company last fiscal year, the amount of carbon credits or offsets purchased last fiscal year, and the total revenue from the same period.

More Details
Spreadsheet, sustainability report or greenhouse gas audit should include:

1) Scope 1 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
2) Scope 2 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
3) Total carbon emissions (in metric tons) offset last fiscal year. 
4) Total revenues (in millions) last fiscal year.

Please also provide proof of purchased carbon credits (e.g. receipts, confirmation emails) that includes that amount offset.

Reminders
Scope 1 carbon emissions include those generated directly by the company, including fuel combustion from heating, manufacturing, and company vehicles.

Scope 2 carbon emissions include those generated indirectly from purchased energy.

A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. Renewable Energy credits are different from carbon credits and their impact is captured in other questions.

questions.label: Waste Produced: Hazardous Waste (metric tonnes) during the last 12 months
What is your current Carbon Intensity for Scopes 1 and 2, measured in tons of CO2/$million of revenue, including the use of carbon credits or offsets?
questions.guidance: Please use USD to accurately evaluate the answer option.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions generated by your company last fiscal year, the amount of carbon credits or offsets purchased last fiscal year, and the total revenue from the same period.

More Details
Spreadsheet, sustainability report or greenhouse gas audit should include:

1) Scope 1 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
2) Scope 2 carbon emissions (in metric tons) last fiscal year.
3) Total carbon emissions (in metric tons) offset last fiscal year. 
4) Total revenues (in millions) last fiscal year.

Please also provide proof of purchased carbon credits (e.g. receipts, confirmation emails) that includes that amount offset.

Reminders
Scope 1 carbon emissions include those generated directly by the company, including fuel combustion from heating, manufacturing, and company vehicles.

Scope 2 carbon emissions include those generated indirectly from purchased energy.

A carbon offset is a unit of carbon dioxide-equivalent that is reduced, avoided, or sequestered to compensate for emissions occurring elsewhere. Renewable Energy credits are different from carbon credits and their impact is captured in other questions.

questions.label: Waste Produced: Non-Hazardous Waste (metric tonnes) during the last 12 months
The past two years
How does your company monitor, record and report significant non-GHG harmful air emissions?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for harmful air emissions (not including greenhouse gas emissions). Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Air emissions report.
Checkbox 3: Air emissions report and sustainability report that includes a description of emission reduction targets.
Checkbox 4: Link to webpage that includes air emissions data and reduction targets.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with air emissions reduction targets and air emissions reports from the past two years that show the stated goal has been met. 
Checkbox 6: Air emissions report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year.

Reminders
Harmful air emissions include NOx, SOx, Persistent Organic pollutants (POP), VOCs, Hazardous air pollutants, stack emissions, Particulate matter, and other regulated categories of air emissions.

questions.label: Have any of your products been source reduced in the last fiscal year?
questions.guidance: This includes reducing the volume of material needed for a product through material selection, production process, product design, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide 1) an analysis of materials used in a product in the past, 2) a follow up analysis that took place last fiscal year which shows that fewer materials went into the product or that less waste was produced as a result of its creation, and 3) a description of how that goal was achieved (i.e. design change, manufacturing technique, purchase of a different material, etc).

questions.label: How does your company monitor, record and report your waste production?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for the waste it generates. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Waste report.
Checkbox 3-4: Waste report and sustainability report that includes waste reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes waste data and reduction targets.
Checkbox 6: Sustainability report with waste reduction targets and waste data showing that the stated goal has been met.
Checkbox 7: Waste report from the most recent reporting period that includes a detailed description of the final destination of all waste.

questions.label: What type of seed does your company use?
questions.guidance: If your company is a cooperative or does not have any land-under-cultivation, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide policies, employee manuals, etc. that specify expectations around seed selection, a relevant third-party agricultural certification (please also upload the relevant criteria for the certification) or a list of all types of seeds used in the past two fiscal years.

questions.label: How does your company monitor hazardous and toxic wastewater?
questions.guidance: Monitoring hazardous and toxic wastewater may involve either monitoring the volume and/or the level of contamination.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for hazardous and toxic wastewater. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report.
Checkbox 3: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report and sustainability report that includes a description of emission reduction targets.
Checkbox 4: Link to webpage that includes hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report data and reduction targets.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions reduction targets and emissions reports from the past two years that show the stated goal has been met. 
Checkbox 6: Hazardous and toxic wastewater emissions report from the most recent reporting period and from your baseline year.

questions.label: Total energy used (Gigajoules) during the last 12 months:
questions.documentationText: Please provide documentation showing the company's total energy usage for all company activities in the past 12 months. You may provide copies of utility statements or other energy reports showing the total amount of energy used.

questions.label: Total water use (liters) during the last 12 months
Does your company publicly disclose any use of chemicals of concern in products or processes in any of the following ways?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a link to the webpage/s where the public can find information regarding chemicals of concern in the company’s products or processes. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

questions.label: Total energy used from renewable resources (Gigajoules) during the last 12 months:
questions.documentationText: Please provide documentation showing the company's total energy usage from renewable energy sources for all company activities in the past 12 months. You may provide copies of utility statements, RECs, or other renewable energy usage reports showing the total amount of energy used.

questions.label: Does your farm have policies and safeguards in place to ensure that none of these prohibited pesticides are used?
questions.guidance: See explain this for list.  If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide 1) a list of pesticides and/or herbicides used at your farm and 2) policies or descriptions of safeguards in place to prevent the use of prohibited pesticides. 

Reminders
Commonly prohibited pesticides include but are not limited to: Aldicarb, Phorate, Terbufos, Disulfoton, Methyl Parathion, Oxamyl, Ethyl Parathion, Carbofuran, Methyl Bromide, Fenamiphos, Azinphos-Methyl or Metilitriazotion, Metomil and Mesomile, Ethoprop, and Strychnine.

questions.label: From what sources does your company get its electricity?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what environmentally-preferred electricity sources power your company. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 3: Electric bill that includes the name of the utility provider and a breakdown of their energy mix. If not included on the bill, please provide a link to energy mix on the company’s website.
Checkbox 4: Pictures of on-site clean/renewable-powered generators that include detailed captions describing the technology and the fuel source.
Checkbox 5: Pictures of on-site solar panels or wind turbines, etc., Electric bill that includes the name of the utility provider and a breakdown of their energy mix. If not included on the bill, please provide a link to energy mix on the company’s website. 

Reminders
To qualify as renewable energy in the B Impact Assessment, the power source must be low impact. As such, large-scale hydroelectric energy from dams should not be considered due to its impact on local biodiversity and displacement of people. Green-e Certified hydropower may be included.

questions.label: Regarding water use, does your company practice the following within the facilities you owned or leased?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company takes responsibility for the environmental impact of its water use. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Water report that includes an analysis of microbial, chemical and mineral content as well as the company’s water management strategies.
Checkbox 2: Water use and release policy, Sustainability Report that includes a section on water and wastewater.
Checkbox 3: Blueprints or schematics for installed water conservation systems, protocols for employees regarding water minimization.  

Reminders
Answer options selected must be applicable to at least 80% of the company’s land or facilities. 

Water conservation does not include an overall reduction in water consumption from reduced activities (e.g. partial outsourcing of production). To qualify for this question, the conservation effort must be a specific organizational or technological innovation that allows a defined process or task to use water more efficiently.

questions.label: What water conservation methods have been implemented at the majority of your corporate offices or plant facilities:
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show what water conservation/efficiency measures are in place for the majority of square footage owned or leased by the company. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Documents may include a receipt or photograph that includes at least one example of each type of conservation/efficiency measure referenced. Please also include a description of the scope of the installation and the product number for any purchased products.

questions.label: What type of pesticides does your farm apply?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of pesticides used on your land-under-cultivation and their category. If you do not use any applied pesticides or agrochemicals, please upload either 1) a relevant certification and its criteria to validate your claim or 2) pictures of products used/methods employed and a detailed description of your practices. 

Reminders
Pesticide classifications can be found in the WHO’s “Recommended Classification of Pesticides by Hazard” at the following link: https://www.who.int/ipcs/publications/pesticides_hazard/en/

questions.label: What percentage of energy use is produced from low-impact renewable sources?
questions.guidance: Include electricity and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc.  Please include both purchased and onsite-generated renewable energy.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a spreadsheet that shows the type and quantity of all renewable energy sources used by your company during the last 12 months and how much energy was used overall during that same period. In addition, please provide proof of the purchase or use of a renewable energy source.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Description of the type of renewable energy (wind power purchased from a utility company, electricity from on-site solar panels, biomass, etc)
2) Total kilowatt hours used by each type of renewable energy during the last 12 months
3) Total kilowatt hours used by all energy sources during the last 12 months

Proof of purchase or use could include an electric bill with the percent of renewable energy purchased highlighted, certificate for renewable energy credits, pictures of on-site solar panels, etc.

Reminders
Both heating and electric use should be included to answer this question accurately. The energy from your heating fuel source will likely be in a unit that will need to be converted into kilowatt hours. 

Please also note that large-scale hydro energy from dams is not considered low-impact renewable energy due to the dams impact on local biodiversity and displacement of people. Green-e certified hydropower may be included.

questions.label: Does your farm follow these practices regarding the application of pesticides and herbicides?
questions.guidance: If your company is a farmer cooperative, or does not apply any pesticides or other agrochemicals, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your farm seeks to minimize the negative environmental impact of the pesticides and herbicides used in your fields. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Toxicity reports that include data on applied pesticides and herbicides as well as goals for future reduction.
Checkbox 2: Policies, employee manuals, etc. that recommend reduced pesticide and herbicide dosage strategies, photographs with detailed captions of those activities taking place on the farm.
Checkbox 3: Two recent dated equipment calibration reports, receipt and/or product number of purchased equipment that has continuous calibration mechanism.
Checkbox 4: Policies, employee manuals, etc. that specify a precision application method of pesticides and herbicides to vary rates by field or block based on multiple samplings per field.
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding other pesticides and herbicides application practices employed at your farm.

questions.label: Have conservation and efficiency improvements led to energy savings for your facilities? If so, by how much?
questions.guidance: Please calculate based on changes from last year or annualized from a base year, referring to electricity use and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide utility bills that show how much energy was used last year and the year prior in kWh.

More Details
If energy use has been tracked from a baseline year, that data may be used as your point of comparison.

questions.label: What water use conservation practices has your farm implemented for land-under-cultivation?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what water conservation methods are in place on your land-under-cultivation. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include photographs with detailed captions describing the techniques, purchase receipts, an annual farm plan, written policies, or a third-party agricultural certification that requires the selected activity (please upload the criteria required by the certification, as well as the certificate).

questions.summary: Water Harvested On-Site or From Recycled Sources
questions.label: What % of water used by the company is harvested on site or is from recycled sources?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much of your company’s water use is from non-municipal sources.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Volume of water harvested at your company’s facility (e.g. through a rainwater tank) in the last fiscal year.
2) Volume of recycled water used in the last fiscal year.
3) Total volume of water consumed by the company in the last fiscal year.

In addition, please provide pictures and detailed captions of any onsite water harvesting or recycling systems.

questions.label: What type of seed does your company use?
questions.guidance: If your company is a cooperative or does not have any land-under-cultivation, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide policies, employee manuals, etc. that specify expectations around seed selection, a relevant third-party agricultural certification (please also upload the relevant criteria for the certification) or a list of all types of seeds used in the past two fiscal years.

questions.label: What % of fertilizer applied to land-under-cultivation is organic?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a photograph of the ingredients in the fertilizer used on the majority of land-under-cultivation on your farm. Alternatively, you may upload a receipt that shows the purchase of the fertilizer and a link to a webpage that shows the fertilizer composition.

questions.label: For what systems has your company used energy conservation or efficiency measures for a majority of your corporate facilities (by square feet) in the past year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show what energy conservation/efficiency measures are in place for the majority of square footage owned or leased by the company. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Documents may include a receipt or photograph that includes at least one example of each type of conservation/efficiency measure referenced. Please also include a description of the scope of the installation and the product number for any purchased products.

questions.label: Does your company monitor, record, or report its energy usage?
questions.guidance: Include electricity and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc. Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for energy use. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Energy use report.
Checkbox 3-4: Energy use report and/or sustainability report that includes energy reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with energy reduction targets and, if not included in the sustainability report, energy use data showing the stated goal being met.

questions.label: During the last fiscal year, what percentage of your products sold had a product certification that assesses the environmental impacts of the product or its production process?
questions.guidance: Select N/A only if there is no physical product being sold.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload 1) a document which breaks down all revenue generating products with an environmental impact certification from the last fiscal year and 2) provide a copy of each certification.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Description of product/s sold.
2) Product's Environmental Certification (e.g. Organic, Rainforest Alliance, Cradle-to-Cradle, etc).
3) Amount of revenue generated by each product/s in the last fiscal year.
4) Total revenue from the last fiscal year.

questions.label: Has your company incorporated environmental considerations into product design by conducting any of the following during the last 24 months with regard to a majority of the products you manufacture or sell?
questions.guidance: A majority of products represent at least 50% of revenues.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company has reduced the environmental footprint of the majority of your products through sustainable design choices made within the last 24 months. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Dated life cycle assessment.
Checkbox 2: Dated Cradle-to-Cradle certification.
Checkbox 3: Dated detailed summary of the source reduction exercise, including before and after data.
Checkbox 4: Dated detailed summary of the toxicity reduction exercise, including before and after data.
Checkbox 5: Dated report that includes a review of product materials, design, reuse, or recyclability opportunities. 
Checkbox 6: Link to webpage that includes information on what products your company will take back for disassembly/reprocessing.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company has incorporated environmental considerations into product design in the last 24 months with regard to a majority of the products you manufacture or sell. 

Reminders
The scope of the selected practice must encompass the majority of products sold (in currency terms).

questions.label: Does your company monitor and manage your water usage?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company tracks and/or sets targets for water use. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Water use report.
Checkbox 3-4: Water use report and sustainability report that includes water reduction targets and your methodology for generating those goals.
Checkbox 5: Sustainability report with water reduction targets and water use data showing that the stated goal has been met.

questions.label: Does your company have an environmental management system (EMS) covering waste generation, energy usage, water usage, and carbon emissions that includes any of the following?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to measure and manage its environmental footprint. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Policy that states your company’s commitment to the environment.
Checkbox 2: Dated assessment of the company’s environmental footprint that includes each of the following: waste generation, energy use, water consumption, and carbon emissions.
Checkbox 3: Quantitative goals and targets based on the data referenced in Checkbox 2. 
Checkbox 4: Action plans, approved budget for project execution, sustainability report, etc. that state the details of programs designed to achieve the environmental reduction targets referenced in Checkbox 3.
Checkbox 5: Dated reports of the two most recent compliance reviews or audits of your environmental impact reduction programs.
Checkbox 6: Contract with a third-party to audit and certify company’s Environmental Management System, copy of the most recent third-party audit or review.

Reminders
The environmental assessment of the company's business activities must include all inputs and outputs. Engaging in an energy audit alone, for example, would not meet the criteria for this question (though you will receive credit for that action elsewhere). Checkboxes 3-6 require an affirmative answer to Checkbox 2.

questions.label: Does your farm comply with sustainable land-use practices?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your farm practices sustainable land-use. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Policies, employee manuals, etc. that specify sustainable land use practices including crop rotation and sustainable techniques, photographs with detailed captions of those activities taking place on the farm.
Checkbox 3: Certification for the sustainable management of agricultural ecosystems and a list of the requirements for acceptance.
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding other sustainable land-use practices.

questions.label: Does your farm comply with any of the following soil management policies?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what beneficial soil management activities occur on your farm. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Most recent soil quality report and analysis of areas at risk for soil erosion (e.g. maps, farm plans, instructions given to employees regarding certain areas, etc.). 
Checkbox 2: Soil management plan.
Checkbox 3: Map of the farm that identifies areas at high risk of erosion. 
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding soil management policies at your farm.

questions.label: Which of the following practices are in place to integrate environmental considerations (DFE) into the design of products and services?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the systematic approaches that your company takes to reduce the overall negative environmental impacts of your product from cradle to grave. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option:

Checkbox 1: Analysis of materials used in products in the past and follow up analysis that shows that fewer materials are required to make products now.
Checkbox 2: Product design plans that show the use of standardized product components/parts, including a caption if the rationale is not stated in the design plan.
Checkbox 3: Picture of label on product/s that show the resource content of the material (e.g. recycling logo with resin identification number).
Checkbox 4: Internal organization documents that reflect what the responsibilities and expectations of each department, including a product maintenance/servicing/reassembly team.
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes information on what products your company will take back for disassembly/reprocessing.
Checkbox 6: Contract that outlines the parameters of your third party product reclamation program.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding integrating environmental considerations into the design of products and services (i.e. company policies, photos with detailed captions, contracts, etc.)

Reminders
The selected answer options should reflect practices that apply to the majority of your product lines.

questions.label: Does your company have a program in place to identify and eliminate potential chemicals and materials of concern in your product and/or process and identify and phase-in safer alternatives (e.g. chemical/material options with reduced toxicity)?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company monitors and reduces chemicals and materials of concern in your product. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Dated analysis of all materials and chemicals to the 1000ppm level for your product/s.
Checkbox 2: Dated analysis of all materials and chemicals to the 100ppm level for your product/s.
Checkbox 3: Internal or third party evaluation of products and processes that identifies any potential for toxic contaminant during production. 
Checkbox 4: Policies, training materials or section of employee handbook that identifies specific classes of chemicals of concern.
Checkbox 5: Policies, training materials or section of employee handbook with a Restricted Substances List and the decision-matrix for chemical selection.
Checkbox 6: Sustainability Report that includes metrics and goals for the reduction or elimination of chemicals of concern, Board or senior management meeting notes in which metrics and goals were established.
Checkbox 7: Link to a company webpage that states all chemicals and/or materials your products, picture of a label with those details, screengrab of portal used by customer support hotline employees to provide chemical and/or material information to callers.

questions.label: Does your company have an environmental management system (EMS) covering waste generation, energy usage, water usage, and carbon emissions that includes any of the following?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to measure and manage its environmental footprint. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Policy that states your company’s commitment to the environment.
Checkbox 2: Dated assessment of the company’s environmental footprint that includes each of the following: waste generation, energy use, water consumption, and carbon emissions.
Checkbox 3: Quantitative goals and targets based on the data referenced in Checkbox 2. 
Checkbox 4: Action plans, approved budget for project execution, sustainability report, etc. that state the details of programs designed to achieve the environmental reduction targets referenced in Checkbox 3.
Checkbox 5: Dated reports of the two most recent compliance reviews or audits of your environmental impact reduction programs.

Reminders
The environmental assessment of the company's business activities must be include all inputs and outputs. Engaging in an energy audit alone, for example, would not meet the criteria for this question (though you will receive credit for that action elsewhere). Checkboxes 3-5 require an affirmative answer to Checkbox 2.

questions.label: Does the company have a written and circulated environmentally preferable purchasing (EPP) policy that includes any of the following?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the relevant section of the company’s purchasing policy or a circulated, written commitment to give preference to a specific environmentally-friendly product or service. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

Reminders
The environmental consideration and the relevant type of purchase should be mentioned explicitly. 

In addition, simply engaging in the behavior does not count for this question. There must be a written component.

questions.label: Does your company have any of the following recycle/reduce/reuse programs in 80% of the facilities?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the recycling/reduction/reuse activities that take place in at least 80% of its facilities.

More Details
List or spreadsheet should include all company locations, their square footage, and what materials are recycled, reduced, or reused at each location based on consistent practice or policy. Additionally, please upload evidence regarding all selected answer options:

Checkbox 1: Pictures of recycling and reuse bins at each location.
Checkbox 2: Pictures of recycling and reuse bins and the posted written policy describing expectations for recycling, reduction, or reuse. If the policy is not readable in the photograph, please also upload a copy of policy itself.
Checkbox 3: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding recycle/reduce/reuse programs in 80% of your facilities.

questions.label: What is included in your company's annual indoor air quality audit of all company facilities?
questions.guidance: Select all options that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide details for each answer option selected. It is recommended to verify the answers with the building manager/company in charge of ventilation.

Sample documentation:
Checkbox 1: A policy or extract from the company confirming that smoking is prohibited within 25 feet / 8 meters of the building OR photos of non-smoking signs near the building.
Checkbox 2: An indoor air quality report with the cfm and liters per person OR a report with CO2 measurements for the building(s).
Checkbox 3: Written confirmation from the building manager or company/person in charge of building ventilation about what the air intake minimum separation distance is on average.
Checkbox 4: Operations and Maintenance (O&M) Manual.
Checkbox 5: HVAC filter specifications.
Checkbox 6: Indoor air quality report specifying the PMV and PPD levels of the buildings.
Checkbox 7: The company’s Indoor Air Quality complaint policy.

Reminders
The answer options should apply to 80%+ of a company’s facilities based on square footage/meters.

questions.label: What % of new equipment purchased (by total cost) during the last 24 months was energy efficient or otherwise environmentally-preferred?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if no capital expenditures were made during the last 24 months.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of new energy efficient or environmentally-beneficial equipment purchased during the last 24 months, how much it cost, and the cost of all new equipment purchased during that timeframe.

More Details
List or spreadsheet should include:

1) Type of equipment and, if available, the product number.
2) Environmentally-beneficial attribute.
3) Date of each purchase.
4) Amount spent on each.
5) Total amount spent on all new equipment in the last 24 months.

questions.label: What % of your farm (by hectares) has received certification for sustainable management of agricultural ecosystems?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide any current sustainable agricultural management certifications held by your farm and the criteria required to obtain the certification. In addition, please include how many hectares of land-under-cultivation are certified and the total hectares of land-under-cultivation. 

Reminders
Certifications must be from a third-party, have transparent standards around which the certification is based, and have an assurance process carried out by a recognized body.

questions.label: Does your farm comply with any of the following soil management policies?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what beneficial soil management activities occur on your farm. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Soil management plan.
Checkbox 2: Map of the farm that identifies areas at high risk of erosion. 
Checkbox 3: Most recent soil quality report and analysis of areas at risk for soil erosion (e.g. maps, farm plans, instructions given to employees regarding certain areas, etc.). 
Checkbox 4: Soil quality records from at least two seasons.
Checkbox 5: Dated soil quality data that shows improvement over time.
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding soil management policies at your farm.

questions.label: What percentage of company facilities (by area, both owned by company or leased) is certified to meet the requirements of an accredited green building program?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all company facilities, the approximate square footage rented and/or owned in each, and a description of any relevant green building certifications.

More Details
In addition to the above mentioned list, please also provide 1) either the building's certificate or a picture of the displayed seal of certification and 2) a link to a website that includes the methodology and scope of the certification.

Reminders
Qualifying comprehensive green building certifications include LEED and LEED equivalents (e.g. the Living Building Challenge, BREEAM, VERDE, etc). If a building is certified according to only one aspect of its environmental impact (i.e. an Energy Star Certified building), it would not be applicable to this question.

questions.label: What soil productivity or protection practices does your farm apply?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your farm takes to maintain soil health. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include photographs with a detailed caption describing the practice, an annual farm plan, written policies, or a third-party agricultural certification requiring the selected activity (please also upload the criteria for the certification, as well as the certificate).

questions.label: Which of the following environmentally preferred products have been purchased for the majority of your corporate facilities?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company’s seeks to minimize the footprint of your office or facility operations through the purchase of environmentally-preferred products. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Please provide photographs of the product/s selected and, if available, receipts and product numbers for purchased items.

Reminders
Items selected must be used across the majority of your company’s rented or leased building space (by square footage), not just a satillete office.

questions.label: Does your farm monitor any of the following biodiversity issues as they pertain to land-under-cultivation?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the data that your farm has collected regarding biodiversity issues on its land-under-cultivation. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include reports on endangered species and/or endangered species diversity at the farm, job descriptions or instructions for employees who are expected to monitor biodiversity, etc.

questions.label: Does the company have a company-wide recovery and recycling program that includes the following?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all company facilities, their square footage, what materials can be recycled or composted at each location and pictures of the receptacles in each building.

More Details
If your company pays for a third party to collect its recycled or compostable materials, you may include a receipt that itemizes each material instead of photographs.

questions.label: Does your farm use any of the following pest management techniques on land-under-cultivation?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your farm manages pests on its land-under-cultivation. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include photographs with detailed captions describing the techniques, an annual farm plan, written policies, or a third-party agricultural certification that requires the selected activity (please upload the criteria required by the certification, as well as the certificate).

questions.label: Does the company monitor indoor environmental quality to ensure a healthy and comfortable work space and avoid "Sick Building Syndrome"?
questions.guidance: Select N/A if you have no facilities.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide your building’s most recent indoor air quality report.

Reminders
Regardless of whether your company or your landlord commissioned the report, the affirmative answer is applicable so long as your company receives and reviews the information.

questions.label: What water quality practices does your farm follow for land-under-cultivation to ensure that local water sources and quality are not impacted?
questions.guidance: If your company does not control any land-under-cultivation or if your company is a farmer cooperative, select N/A.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your farm protects local water quality. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include a certification that has specific requirements for agrochemical application relative to a permanent water body (please upload both the certificate and a link to the certification criteria), plans detailing completed riparian buffer planting, written and distributed farm policies and/or relevant land use maps.

questions.label: Does your company have any programs or policies in place to reduce the environmental footprint caused by travel/commuting?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company seeks to minimize the environmental footprint of employee travel both to and from work and more broadly.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Commuting incentives section of employee handbook, flyer or other materials shared with employees describing programs, offer letter to a non-management hire that includes transit benefits.
Checkbox 2: Pictures that show how company locations encourage the use of environmentally-friendly transportation options with detailed captions, building plans/blueprints.
Checkbox 3: Section of employee handbook, written and distributed policy, etc. that includes a section on the use of virtual meetings.
Checkbox 4: Section of employee handbook, written and distributed policy, etc. that limits corporate travel.

questions.label: If you lease your facilities, have you worked with your landlord to implement or maintain any of the following?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what building sustainability measures have been put into placed as a result of a collaboration between your company and your landlord. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include meeting minutes, memos stating the approved changes, email communications, etc. Please only upload items that speak to activities from the past two years.

Reminders
A list of your building’s sustainability features is captured elsewhere. This question is asking what has occurred due to active coordination between your company and your landlord.

questions.label: What environmental efficiency practices are in place in a majority of your company's offices and plant facilities?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company’s seeks to minimize the environmental footprint of your office and/or plant facilities. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Pictures and product numbers of energy efficient appliances and lighting, screengrab of energy monitoring tool.
Checkbox 2: Pictures and product numbers of water efficient technology.
Checkbox 3: Pictures and product numbers of systems used to monitor and improve air quality.
Checkbox 4: Pictures with detailed captions describing the sustainable materials used in the building’s construction and in daily operations.
Checkbox 5: Checklist used when selecting a new building that includes sustainability criteria. 
Checkbox 6: LEED or equivilent green building certificate.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding the environmental efficiency practices in place in a majority of your company's offices and plant facilities.

Reminders
Items selected must be in place for the majority of your company’s rented or leased building space (by square footage).

questions.label: What environmental efficiency practices are in place at your offices and plant facilities?
questions.guidance: This is also known as "green building practices."
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company’s seeks to minimize the environmental footprint of your office and/or plant facilities. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Pictures and product numbers of energy efficient appliances and lighting, screengrab of an energy monitoring tool.
Checkbox 2: Pictures and product numbers of water efficient technology.
Checkbox 3: Pictures and product numbers of systems used to monitor and improve air quality.
Checkbox 4: Pictures with detailed captions describing the sustainable materials used in the building’s construction and in daily operations.
Checkbox 5: Checklist used when selecting a new building that includes sustainability criteria.  
Checkbox 6: LEED or equivilent green building certificate.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding the environmental efficiency practices in place at a majority of your company's offices and plant facilities.

Reminders
Items selected must impact the majority of your company’s rented or leased building space (by square footage).

questions.label: Does your company have demonstrable procedures in place to reduce or mitigate impacts to natural habitats? If yes, which of the following statements apply to these procedures?
questions.guidance: Procedures include a Conservation Strategic Plan.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the guiding documents that instruct employees on how to reduce or mitigate the company’s impact on natural habitats.

More Details
Documentation may include a Conservation Strategic Plan, a company policy, a research report completed in conjunction with a partner, etc.

questions.label: Does the majority of your facilities on a square foot basis have a facility wide recycling program that has ongoing collection of at least all standard materials in your area?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all company facilities, their square footage, what materials can be recycled at each location and pictures of the recycling receptacles in each building.

More Details
If your company pays for a third party to collect its recycled materials, you may include a receipt that itemizes each material instead of photographs.

questions.label: What % of your facilities on a square foot basis have a facility-wide recycling program that has ongoing collection of at least all standard materials in your area?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all company facilities, their square footage, what materials can be recycled at each location and pictures of the recycling receptacles in each building.

More Details
If your company pays for a third party to collect its recycled materials, you may include a receipt that itemizes each material instead of photographs.

questions.label: How does your company encourage good environmental stewardship in how employees manage their virtual offices?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company ensures that employees engage in environmentally-beneficial practices while working remotely. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Policy distributed to virtual employees that sets expectations regarding the use of environmentally-preferred products and best practices (e.g. energy use, recycling, e-waste disposal, etc.) in the employee’s workspace.
Checkbox 2: Resource packet given to virtual employees to facilitate positive environmental stewardship (e.g. energy saving tips, local e-waste disposal options, etc).
Checkbox 3: E-waste/hazardous material disposal policy for virtual employees.
Checkbox 4: Instructions for virtual employees on which vendors to purchase their office supplies from and the positive environmental criteria to use.

Reminders
The items selected should reflect a deliberate and consistent program to encourage a specific pattern of behavior in all virtual employees.

This question is intended to capture the expectations your company has for all employees who work remotely, even if the employee does not work virtually full-time.

questions.label: Payday, short-term, or high-interest lending

questions.label: Chemicals, including those reliant on chemicals that meet the Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) criteria under REACH
questions.guidance: REACH is the European Union's chemical regulation, currently the world's most stringent chemical regulation. See help text for list of industries.

questions.label: Operation in conflict zones
Microenterprises
Micro-entrepreneur Individuals
Are any of the following true regarding your charitable giving structure?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company seeks to significantly and consistently support charitable organizations over time. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Capitalization table, governing document, etc. that shows how much of the company is owned by a non-profit.
Checkbox 2-4: Link to company webpage, employee handbook, governing document, etc. that states your company’s annual charitable giving commitment as a ratio to either profits, revenues, or time.
Checkbox 5: Two sets of documents: a) Initial filings from a foundation that include your organization as the founding party, "About Us" section of foundation website, etc. and b) an employee handbook, webpage, governing document, etc. that states that your company will annually donate 10% of its profits or 2% of sales to support that foundation.

Reminders
The act of donating a certain amount of money or time is captured in a different question. The intent of Checkboxes 2-4 is to reward a written commitment. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced over time, regardless of the circumstances of a particular year.

questions.label: What % of total revenue in the last fiscal year was generated through microfranchises?
questions.documentationText: Please provide documentation that details what % of revenue is generated through microfranchising (versus through other distribution model or direct company sales). Also please provide evidence of all the policies or attributes of your microfranchising you selected in SE15.1 (you can view your answers by returning to the Assessment and clicking on the section labelled Socially and Environmental Focused Business Models) Match the number below to your answer option order, and please note in the comment box what answer each document supports: 1. Copies of training materials, training calendar or photographs of ongoing training on products & operations provided by company to microfranchisees 2. Copies of training materials that detail how training includes advanced topics (beyond basic operational/financial skills needed to operate the franchise) 3. List of all microfranchisees and each’s location, demarking those located in low-income areas. If no list is available, please provide examples of microfranchisees located in low-income areas. 4. Copy of a franchisee agreement or other policy detailing cost-sharing or inventory structure of branded product offerings 5. Evidence that franchisees are small and independently-owned businesses (fewer than 50 workers or smaller, including sole proprietors) and how the company has determined & verified franchisee size 6. Evidence of franchisee's income level (low income, poor or very poor.) 7. Copy of a franchisee agreement or other policy detailing that franchisee must have at least a 50% ownership stake in their business.

questions.label: Describe in the text box the methodology your company uses to calculate producer price premium.

questions.summary: Verification of Fair Wages and Working Conditions
questions.label: Are working conditions and wages of suppliers verified to meet credible standards to ensure dignity and equitable economic empowerment for employees? If so, what methodology is used to determine standards?
questions.guidance: Your answer to this unscored question is combined with other answers to automatically calculate your score in this section of the assessment.

questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "Does the company provide or participate in support services for underserved suppliers?" and "What % of your total cost of materials (excluding labor) comes from suppliers that have received the previous capacity building support?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate 1) what resources your company has provided to suppliers to improve their business operations and/or impact and 2) the total cost of materials purchased from suppliers who have benefited from that support in the last fiscal year. 

More Details
Two sets of documentation are required.

First, please upload training materials from classes given to suppliers, a supplier resource packet, contracts with third-party training vendors that includes a description of the training, photographs of classes with detailed captions which explain the material covered, etc. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

Second, please upload a spreadsheet (or similar) that lists the following:

1) Supplier Name
2) Description of capacity building/support/training provided to each last fiscal year. 
3) Amount spent on materials from that supplier last fiscal year.
4) Total spent on all materials last fiscal year.

Reminders
Each capacity building/support/training referenced in the second set of documents must have collaborating evidence uploaded as a part of the first set of documents.
