Documentation relates to questions IBM13.13 and IBM13.14, focusing on small-scale suppliers.

First, please provide documentation to verify all answers you selected for IBM13.13 and verify which claim you are documenting in the comment field. Match answer order to numbers below:

1. Documentation demonstrating a quantifiable increase in productivity/efficiency of small-scale suppliers
2. Copy of training materials or photograph depicting training provided to suppliers
3. Copy of contract or agreement demonstrating that the contract price was partially or fully paid in advance to significant suppliers (including loans through a partner org) 
4. Copy of contract or agreement demonstrating contracts for input materials are signed and executed in advance for the next year with significant suppliers 
5. Evidence of fair-trade certification of suppliers, such as a copy of supplier fair trade certification(s) or photographs of Fair Trade Certified logo on products from suppliers 

Additionally, please provide documentation detailing the percent of total Cost of Goods Sold spent on products that are sourced through small-scale suppliers (suppliers or cooperatives with supplier members that have fewer than 50 employees) and indicate which of the above is relevant to each. questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to 1) validate that your company is a producer cooperative and 2) show what training or other benefits are available to members of the cooperative.

More Details
Two sets of documents are required. 

First, please upload the company’s governing documents (i.e. Articles of Incorporation, By-Laws, Operating Agreement, etc.) to illustrate the structure of your producer cooperative.

Second, please provide evidence of the training or benefits package included with membership in your producer cooperative. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. Sample documents suggested below:

Checkbox 1: Dated training materials (e.g. slide decks, handouts, videos, agendas etc) from the past two years intended to help a producer increase its productivity.
Checkbox 2: New member welcome packet that includes a detailed list of benefits, contract with a benefits broker that describes the benefits available and who has access to each.
Checkbox 3: Dated training materials (e.g. slide decks, handouts, videos, agendas etc) for employees of cooperative members that focus on life skills.
Checkbox 4: Dated training materials (e.g. slide decks, handouts, videos, agendas etc) on how to improve a producer’s social or environmental performance.

questions.label: Are any of the following true regarding your charitable giving structure?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company seeks to significantly and consistently support charitable organizations over time. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Capitalization table, governing document, etc. that shows how much of the company is owned by a non-profit.
Checkbox 2-4: Link to company webpage, employee handbook, governing document, etc. that states your company’s annual charitable giving commitment as a ratio to either profits, revenues, or time.
Checkbox 5: Two sets of documents: a) Initial filings from a foundation that include your organization as the founding party, "About Us" section of foundation website, etc. and b) an employee handbook, webpage, governing document, etc. that states that your company will annually donate 10% of its profits or 2% of sales to support that foundation.

Reminders
The act of donating a certain amount of money or time is captured in a different question. The intent of Checkboxes 2-4 is to reward a written commitment. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced over time, regardless of the circumstances of a particular year.

questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how many beneficiaries of your company’s charitable giving have a verified positive outcome related to your company’s charity work, as compared to overall beneficiaries. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of beneficiaries with a verified positive outcome related to your activities.
2) Description of positive outcome achieved for each.
3) Total number of all beneficiaries (i.e. with or without a verified positive outcome).

Please also provide the methodology used to collect the outcomes data.

Reminders
Outcomes are different from outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate 1) how your company determines that suppliers pay a fair or living wage and/or support work environments that empower employees and 2) the total cost of materials purchased from suppliers who were verified to meet those conditions in the last fiscal year. 

More Details
Two sets of documentation are required.

First, as applicable, please upload either:

a. Third-party certificates and a description of the criteria required to obtain the certification.
b. Detailed analysis of supplier payroll information completed by your company that confirms that all workers receive a wage equivalent or greater to a fair or living wage for the relevant industry/product/market. Alternatively, you may provide contracts that specify wage requirements. Please also include a description and link to the fair or living wage data used to inform your calculations. 

Second, please upload a spreadsheet (or similar) that lists the following:

1) Supplier Name.
2) Method used to determine wages and/or working conditions (e.g. Fair Trade Certified, in-house review).
3) When the information was verified in the last fiscal year.
4) Amount spent on materials from each supplier last fiscal year.
5) Total spent on all materials last fiscal year.

Reminders
Each method referenced in the second set of documents must have collaborating evidence uploaded as a part of the first set of documents.

questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the workforce development program your company has developed to specifically help a chronically-underemployed population overcome a barrier to employment. In addition, please share a list of employees in the program and the benefits those individuals receive from your company.

More Details
Two sets of documents are required for this question.

First, documents to contextualize your workforce development program. These may include a company webpage that describes the initiative, governing documents that explain the origin and goals of these efforts, materials provided to the company’s human resources/hiring staff that explain your company's focus on hiring chronically-underemployed populations and the nature of the program, etc.

Second, a modified employee roster or spreadsheet with the following information:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, 2, etc).
2) Individual’s barrier to employment.
3) Employee's hourly pay (If the living wage date used is broken down by month vs. by hour, please calculate your employee's monthly salary instead (i.e. match your employee wage information to the pay period of the living wage data)).
4) Address of employment.
5) Living wage data for your area, including a link to the referenced source.
6) Employment status (i.e. full-time, part-time, temporary). If a temporary employee, please also explain what strategies the company employs to assist these individuals in obtaining a semi-stable income over time.  
7) Description of training provided to employee. If available, please also upload a orientation agenda or training checklist.
8) A yes/no column answering the question: “Is the company’s standard benefits package available to the employee?” Please also upload a relevant offer letter or job posting that describes the company’s benefits.
9) Total number of all employees. 

Reminders
This question is not intended to reward companies for hiring ad hoc individuals with a barrier to employment. There are other questions in the assessment to capture that positive practice. The intent here is to recognize companies who have designed a program to consistently hire and support the chronically-underemployed.    

The living wage is not the minimum wage. A living wage goes beyond meeting the minimum wage required by law and ensures that employees have the money necessary to meet living expenses in your region. It is a market-based approach that draws upon geographically specific expenditure data related to an individual’s likely minimum food, health insurance, housing, transportation, and other basic necessities (e.g. clothing, personal care items, etc.) costs.

Accepted living wage data can be found at the links below:

Canada: http://livingwagecanada.ca/
United Kingdom: livingwage.org.uk/calculation
United States: livingwage.mit.edu
Selected other countries: https://www.globallivingwage.org/

You may redact employee names on any document.

Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company takes to support the economic growth of your country of operations. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: List of suppliers that make up either 80% of your input materials or 80% of your Cost of Goods Sold (including value-add activities) from the last fiscal year that includes: the amount spent with each, the supplier's country of operations, and the total amount spent on either all input materials or total COGS.
Checkbox 2: Paperwork describing the mission of an industry trade group/association that your company created that includes your organization as the founding party, press releases during the group/association launch that explain your connection to the organization.
Checkbox 3: List of all managers that includes: the location at which each works and whether the individual is a national citizens of that country.
Checkbox 4: List of company owners who are a national citizen of the company’s country of operations that includes: the name of the country in which the individual is a national citizen, the number of shares owned, and the total number of all company shares.

Reminders
You may redact manager or owner names on any document by replacing the name with Manager/Owner 1, 2, etc.

questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "What types of training or activities are available to employees from chronically underemployed populations?" and "What % of your employees have barriers to employment and participated in the previously selected training or activities?"
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the training and/or mentorship programs that your company has developed specifically to support its chronically-underemployed workers. In addition, please share a list of employees with a barrier to employment and the resources utilized by the individual.

More Details
Two sets of documents are required for this question.

First, documents that detail your company's training and/or mentorship program for your chronically-underemployed workers. These may include a training calendar with captions explaining the content of the classes, educational materials (e.g. slide decks, videos, handouts, etc), expectations shared with mentors regarding their role, a workforce development program handbook, etc. 

Second, a modified employee roster or spreadsheet with the following information:

1) Employee name or other indicator (Employee 1, 2, etc).
2) Individual’s barrier to employment.
3) As applicable, please use one or more of the following descriptions to identify what programs the employee has benefited from: 
      3a) Technical/professional training in the last year that extends beyond the requirements for the job.
      3b) Life or “soft” skills training.
      3c) Training or structured guidance on the job search or interview process.
      3d) Personal coach or mentorship program.
4) Total number of all employees.

Reminders
Each training and/or support program referenced in the second set of documents must have collaborating evidence uploaded as a part of the first set of documents.

This question is not intended to reward companies for ad hoc activities to support individuals with a barrier to employment. The intent is to recognize companies who have designed a program to consistently educate and mentor the chronically-underemployed. 

You may redact employee names on any document.

questions.label: How does your company measure and manage the results, outcomes, effects, or impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: Select all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the details of your company’s impact measurement activities. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Employee handbook, annual report, company strategy documents, etc. that include desired outcomes for your product/service and your theory of change.
Checkbox 2: Secondary research that informed your impact-driven business model.
Checkbox 3: Notes from focus groups, surveys, etc. with stakeholders regarding product/service.
Checkbox 4: Copy of a social or environmental impact-related certification.
Checkbox 5-6: Survey results, summarized findings from focus groups, etc. that include outcomes questions.
Checkbox 7: Analysis of potential negative impacts of the company’s product/service.
Checkbox 8: Analysis of potential roadblocks to delivering your company’s desired positive outcome. 

Reminders
Outcomes are different from outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

Outcomes are different from outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload 1) a spreadsheet that breaks down your revenue from last fiscal year by the product or service provided and 2) any case studies, certifications, approvals, research papers, or reports that help illustrate how the underserved benefit from your work. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Product(s) and/or service(s) sold in the last fiscal year.
2) Description of each product/service.
3) Revenue generated from each product/service in the last fiscal year.
4) Total company revenue from all products/services in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
Underserved groups include low income, poor, or very poor individuals, as well as demographic populations that have not traditionally had equal access to positive social or economic opportunities because of discrimination or other barriers. This may vary by context and geography. Gender, ethnicity, sexual-orientation, age, disabilities, immigration background, etc. may be considered. Please be prepared to provide data to validate your claim that a group is underserved, if requested.

Overview
Please upload 1) a spreadsheet that breaks down your revenue from last fiscal year by client with a description of the service provided and 2) case studies or other documents that showcase the type of work you do (e.g. sample scope of work, client deliverable, research papers) to help illustrate how your service supports purpose-driven enterprises.

More Details
Spreadsheet should include:

1) Client name.
2) Description of why the client is “purpose-driven” or underserved.
3) Link to the client’s website.
4) Description of the work that your company did for the client.
5) Revenue generated by each client last fiscal year.
6) Total company revenue from last fiscal year.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture revenues generated from 1) clients whose primary purpose is to have a positive impact on society and/or the environment (e.g. a non-profit that helps the homeless, an organic farm, etc) or 2) underserved enterprises. “Underserved” is defined as a company that is majority owned by an underrepresented population or a community-based business that lacks access to traditional business services. Checkbox 3: Surveys, notes from focus groups and/or stakeholder meetings, etc. that include the perspective of underserved beneficiaries on product offerings and design.

Reminders
Underserved groups include low income, poor, or very poor individuals, as well as demographic populations that have not traditionally had equal access to positive social or economic opportunities because of discrimination or other barriers. This may vary by context and geography. Gender, ethnicity, sexual-orientation, age, disabilities, immigration background, etc. may be considered. Please be prepared to provide data to validate your claim that a group is underserved, if requested.

questions.label: Individuals
How does your company measure and manage the results, outcomes, effects, or impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: Select all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the details of your company’s impact measurement activities. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Employee handbook, annual report, company strategy documents, etc. that include desired outcomes for your product/service and your theory of change.
Checkbox 2: Secondary research that informed your impact-driven business model.
Checkbox 3: Notes from focus groups, surveys, etc. with stakeholders regarding product/service.
Checkbox 4: Copy of a social or environmental impact-related certification.
Checkbox 5-6: Survey results, summarized findings from focus groups, etc. that include outcomes questions.
Checkbox 7: Analysis of potential negative impacts of the company’s product/service.
Checkbox 8: Analysis of potential roadblocks to delivering your company’s desired positive outcome. 

Reminders
Outcomes are different from outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

questions.label: Do you track and measure longer-term outcomes for users after they complete your company's product or service to ensure continued success?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company systematically determines that your revenue generating activities resulted in changes over time for your beneficiaries. Evidence must be provided for each answer option.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Survey results, summarized findings from focus groups, etc. conducted by your company.
Checkbox 2: Contract with a third party to collect and/or verify outcomes data.
Checkbox 3: Results of data collection that show positive outcomes and research that reflects the experience of non-users. 

Reminders
Outcomes are not outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

Which of the following apply for repayment capacity analysis?
questions.documentationText:
Please provide supporting documentation for at least two of the answers selected:  
1. Evidence that the institution does repayment capacity analysis for every loan/each loan cycle 
2. Documentation that demonstrates the institution has set a threshold for number of clients per loan officer
3. Evidence that group formation and approval process ensure prudent self-selection of members, with emphasis on solidarity payment 
4. Documentation that demonstrates loan approval does not rely solely on guarantees (whether peer guarantees, co-signers or collateral) as a substitute for good capacity analysis
5. Documentation that demonstrates for clients with informal revenues and/or non-consumption loans the repayment capacity analysis is based on a client visit (performed by a loan officer or delegated to group/village members)
6. Copy of written repayment capacity policy and evidence that it is distributed to staff (eg photograph of policy posted on notice board, screenshot of online platform that is accessible to all staff etc)

Do you provide education to the management of your investments on how to improve their companies' social and/or environmental performance?
If tracked, what was the number of metric tons of carbon (CO2) off-set by your environmental practices?
questions.documentationText:
Please provide 2 of the following requested types of documentation (match the number below to your answer option order in SE27m.2) as they pertain to your GIIRS assessment response in SE27m.2: 
1. Copy of stated objectives and targets exist for environmental aspects of your company operations 
2. Copy of any LEED or other third-party green building certifications achieved or signed letter from executive manager with written description of your company facilities' renovations to include green building standards and/or location in a previously constructed building. 
3. Copy of most recent report detailing the amount (by weight or volume) of sustainable materials (100% naturally sourced and sustainably harvested/collected), non-toxic materials , post-consumer recycled materials and/or recyclable or biodegradable input materials in product (including packaging) and the total amount of all other materials in product or any third-party certifications verifying the percentage of such materials in product 
4. Copy of most recent report detailing the amount of waste recycled, recovered or composted in manufacturing process and total amount of waste generated in manufacturing process 
5. Copy of most recent dated reports detailing energy and water usage, and the amount of waste and emissions produced from manufacturing process. 
6. Copy of corporate policies that have been implemented to reduce energy and water usage, and waste and emissions production 
7. Copy of screening criteria used to screen all significant suppliers for their social and environmental practices and impacts

questions.documentationText: Please provide the following requested types of documentation for only each affirmative response as they pertain to your assessment response in SE27a.1: 1. Written environmental policy, copies of relevant certifications, or employee training materials that depict how environmental conservation is a core component of your land and management and growing process, 2. Photograph, written environmental policy, copies of relevant certifications, or employee training materials that illustrate how company is engaged in best practices (crop rotation & other methods) to minimize damage to soil and and agriculture run-off 3. Photograph illustrating how water conservation growing techniques are used (drip-tech and hydroponic growing.) If specific products or equipment is used, please include manufacturer name and model number. 4. Copy of most recent dated report detailing monitored energy and water usage 5. Photograph, written environmental policy, copies of relevant certifications, or employee training materials illustrating how pesticide use is closely-managed and pest management techniques are integrated into growing process (soil sampling of herbicides; insect phenology used). If specific metrics are used, please provide those.

More Details
Sample documents:

Reminders
Outcomes are different from outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if your company created a nature reserve and there was an increase in the native wildlife population at that site, the number of acres protected from development would be an output and the additional observed animals would be an outcome.

questions.label: What % of your projects completed in the last 24 months were designed to exceed local codes for stormwater management by more than 20%?

Also include the total number of current projects company.

questions.label: Which of the following is true regarding your company’s stakeholder engagement policies and practices?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show how your company engages and considers its stakeholders through its policies and practices. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Stakeholder Engagement Policy including procedures and responsibilities to address results from stakeholder engagement.
Checkbox 2: Section from the Stakeholder Engagement Policy that states that stakeholder feedback on social and environmental performance will be gathered, Stakeholder feedback survey including questions about social and environmental performance and survey methodology.
Checkbox 3: Section from the Stakeholder Engagement Policy that states that stakeholder feedback is gathered when commencing new material projects, stakeholder feedback survey including questions about new material projects and survey methodology.
Checkbox 4: Stakeholder Map, results from stakeholder analysis.
Checkbox 5: Section from the Stakeholder Engagement Policy or other strategy document that states that the company proactively seeks input from traditionally underrepresented stakeholders.
Checkbox 6: Meeting notes of stakeholder meetings, results report of stakeholder surveys and/or focus groups.
Checkbox 7: Screengrab of of the public mechanism available to stakeholders to review and provide feedback on stakeholder engagement plans and results.
Checkbox 8: Notes from meetings with senior executives and/or the Board of Directors, section from the Stakeholder Engagement Policy that states responsibilities and/or accountabilty.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture policies and processes that are formally outlined and applicable to the entirety of your global operations, not activities that occur intermittently and in only a few offices/regions.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Policies regarding routine procedures to protect against human rights violations by the company's operations and supply chain. 
Checkbox 3: Grievance policies and procedures in the languages of company stakeholders.
Checkbox 4: Grievance response protocols.
Checkbox 5: Contracts with third-party mediation entities to address stakeholder grievances.

Reminders
A grievance mechanism is a formal, legal or non-legal (or ‘judicial/non-judicial’) complaint process that can be used by individuals, workers, communities and/or civil society organisations that are being negatively affected by certain business activities and operations.

questions.label: Does your company have any of the following practices to address stakeholder grievances and/or human rights allegations?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to resolve reports of its negative impacts. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Link to publicly-available report of stakeholders grievance and your company's responses. 
Checkbox 2: Reports of the company's response to grievance and/or stakeholder feedback on resolution efforts.
Checkbox 3: Link to publicly-available company response to grievances that includes a description of the change made to company practices.
Checkbox 4: Governing documents that include Board of Directors responsibilities.

Reminders
A grievance mechanism is a formal, legal or non-legal (or ‘judicial/non-judicial’) complaint process that can be used by individuals, workers, communities and/or civil society organisations (i.e. stakeholders) that are being negatively affected by certain business activities and operations.

questions.label: Which of the following methods are used to evaluate the social or environmental impact of your Tier 1 Suppliers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company monitors the social and environmental impacts of its Tier 1 Suppliers. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that includes expectations regarding social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 2: Supplier survey with social and environmental questions highlighted and instructions for its completion (e.g. email sent to supplier).
Checkbox 3: Survey instructions sent to supplier that include a link to a third party survey tool and a report of supplier survey results.
Checkbox 4: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 5: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits by a 3rd Party that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 6: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that states how to voice grievances or provide feedback.
Checkbox 7: Recent report of supplier survey/review/audit and one from the previous year that shows an quantifiable improvement of social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how you evaluate the social or environmental impact of your Tier 1 Suppliers.

Reminders
All supplier evaluation strategies referenced above must include specific social and environmental metrics to qualify for this question. 

Tier 1 Suppliers are the direct suppliers from which your company purchases products or services. This list may include subcontractors but does not include your payroll expenses, rent, utilities, or taxes.

Checkbox 2: Subcontractor survey with social and environmental questions highlighted and instructions for its completion (e.g. email sent to subcontractor).
Checkbox 3: Survey instructions sent to subcontractor that include a link to a third party survey tool and a report of overall survey results.
Checkbox 4: Two dated results of subcontractor reviews/audits that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 5: Two dated results of subcontractor reviews/audits by a 3rd Party that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how you evaluate the social or environmental impact of your subcontracted services.

Reminders
All subcontractor evaluation strategies referenced above must include specific social and environmental metrics to qualify for this question.

Overview

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that includes expectations regarding social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 2: Supplier survey with social and environmental questions highlighted and instructions for its completion (e.g. email sent to supplier).
Checkbox 3: Survey instructions sent to supplier that include a link to a third party survey tool and a report of supplier survey results.
Checkbox 4: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 5: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits by a 3rd Party that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 6: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that states how to voice grievances or provide feedback.
Checkbox 7: Recent report of supplier survey/review/audit and one from the previous year that shows an quantifiable improvement of social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how you evaluate the social or environmental impact of your Tier 2 Suppliers.

Reminders
All supplier evaluation strategies referenced above must include specific social and environmental metrics to qualify for this question. 

Tier 2 Suppliers are the suppliers of your company’s Tier 1 suppliers. For example, if your company purchases shirts from a textile factory (a Tier 1 Supplier), then the company that supplies cotton to the textile factory would be considered a Tier 2 Supplier.
