Checkbox 3: Survey instructions sent to supplier that include a link to a third party survey tool and a report of supplier survey results.
Checkbox 4: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 5: Two dated results of supplier reviews/audits by a 3rd Party that show an evaluation is conducted at least every two years. 
Checkbox 6: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that states how to voice grievances or provide feedback.
Checkbox 7: Recent report of supplier survey/review/audit and one from the previous year that shows an quantifiable improvement of social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how you evaluate the social or environmental impact of the original producers of your raw materials.

Reminders
All supplier evaluation strategies referenced above must include specific social and environmental metrics to qualify for this question.

questions.summary: % of Suppliers Accountable to Code of Conduct
questions.label: What % of your suppliers (on a currency basis) are accountable to the formalized code of conduct or requirements described in the previous question?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much money was spent last fiscal year on suppliers who have agreed to meet a formal set of expectations regarding their social or environmental performance (e.g. in contract, Supplier Code of Conduct).

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of suppliers who are bound to requirements set by your company around their social or environmental impacts.
2) Amount spent with each referenced supplier in the last fiscal year.
3) Total spent on all suppliers in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
A supplier is any business that your company pays to provide a good or service. However, in the B Impact Assessment, suppliers will always exclude 1) your landlord, 2) your utility company, and 3) the entity to which you pay your taxes. Other questions in the assessment speak to these providers.

questions.label: What % of the original producers of your raw materials are evaluated based on the methods selected in the previous question?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much money was spent with the producers of your raw materials who were evaluated on their social and environmental performance. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of raw material producers evaluated on their social and environmental impact.
2) Amount spent with each referenced raw material producer in the last fiscal year.
3) Total spent on all raw material producers in the last fiscal year.

questions.label: Which of the following are true regarding how your company  reports on your supply chain impact?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what information your company shares publicly regarding the social and environmental impact of its supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Answer options selected must be easily accessible on your company’s website. As such, please provide a link to the relevant webpage/s and a description of the content.

Reminders
All items referenced above must both be transparent to the public and include specific social and environmental metrics to qualify for this question.

questions.summary: % of Suppliers with Transparency, Reporting, and Goal Setting
questions.label: For what % of your suppliers (on a currency basis) do the reporting practices selected in the previous question apply?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much money was spent with suppliers whose social and environmental supply chain impacts are publicly available on your company’s website.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of suppliers whose supply chain impact is made transparent on your company’s website.
2) Amount spent with each referenced supplier in the last fiscal year.
3) Total spent on all suppliers in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
A supplier is any business that your company pays to provide a good or service. However, in the B Impact Assessment, suppliers will always exclude 1) your landlord, 2) your utility company, and 3) the entity to which you pay your taxes. Other questions in the assessment speak to these providers.

questions.label: How does your company monitor and improve the progress of its community investments?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company holds itself accountable to its community investment goals.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Minutes from Board of Directors or executive team meetings that show oversight of community investment programs.
Checkbox 2: Link to webpage that shows goals and targets for community investment programs. 
Checkbox 3: Review of community investment programs from the last fiscal year and the fiscal year prior.
Checkbox 4: Link to blog or screengrab of social media platforms that includes an update on the company’s community investment goals and a call for feedback.
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company monitors and seeks to improve the progress of its community investments.

Reminders
A community investment is a long-term involvement in a community partnership chosen or created by the company to address social or environmental issues. Contributions may include cash, employee volunteer time, in-kind product donations, use of services or facilities valued at cost to the company, etc.

questions.label: Does the company have any of the following policies or programs to improve the social and/or environmental impact of suppliers, either in cases of noncompliance or more broadly?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how the company works with its suppliers to improve their social and environmental impacts. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier corrective action/improvement plans that includes continuous improvement goals.
Checkbox 2: Supplier contract that includes time-period suppliers are allowed to remediate breaches of your company’s Code of Conduct and consequences for not doing so.
Checkbox 3: Training materials/resources provided to suppliers (e.g. slides, FAQs, resource guides, agenda for in-person training, conference payment, etc.).
Checkbox 4: Training materials/resources provided to staff on how to manage supplier relationships (e.g. slides, FAQs, resource guides, agenda for in-person training, conference payment, etc.). 
Checkbox 5: Notes from a meeting with industry partners to discuss how to improve the social or environmental impact of the supply chain, Link to webpage that shows your company as a co-sponsor of an initiative.
Checkbox 6: Supplier contract that includes a financial incentive which rewards improvement in social and environmental performance. 
Checkbox 7: Recent report of the social and environmental performance of your supply chain and a report from the previous year. 
Checkbox 8: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding policies or programs to improve the social and/or environmental impact of suppliers, either in cases of noncompliance or more broadly. 

Reminders
All supplier activities referenced above must be focused on the supplier’s social and environmental performance. 

Further, this question is intended to reward companies for consistent and structured policies and/or programs designed to improve the social or environmental impact of its suppliers over time, not occasional practices.

questions.summary: Impactful Capital Management and Shareholder Engagement
questions.label: Has the company done any of the following to utilize its cash reserves, capital, or shareholder engagement activities to support impact-related financial activities?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that confirms that the company has invested in any of the selected social investment options. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Proof of Investment and the results of the ESG screen of those investments.
Checkbox 2: Financial statement and/or annual budget that includes a line item of funds set aside for impact investments.
Checkbox 3: Proof of Investment and a link to the specific social impact bonds that the company invested in.
Checkbox 4: Notes/agendas from shareholder meetings that include social and environmental topics related to the business.

Reminders
An ESG Screen is a set of investment criteria that specifies investments should be made in companies that meet a minimum standard in terms of environmental, social, and governance performance.

questions.summary: % of Suppliers with Programs to Improve Impact
questions.label: For what % of your suppliers (on a currency basis) do the policies and programs selected in the previous question apply?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much money was spent with suppliers who have received access to policies or programs to improve their social and/or environmental impact, either in cases of noncompliance or more broadly

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of suppliers who have benefited from your company’s supply chain improvement policies/programs.
2) Amount spent with each referenced supplier in the last fiscal year.
3) Total spent on all suppliers in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
All supplier policies/programs must include the supplier’s social and environmental performance to qualify for this question.

questions.summary: Assessment Conducted of Environmental Footprint of Value Chain
questions.label: Have you conducted a formal assessment to measure the environmental footprint of your value chain (including supply chain, product usage, and end-of-life) that covers the following topics?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what environmental impact areas your company has evaluated across its value chain in consistent and structured manner. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documentation may include a sustainability report, 3rd party audit, summary of internal analysis, etc.

Reminders
To qualify for this question, the scope of the measured environmental footprint must include the entire value chain, not select parts of it.

questions.summary: Strategic Decision Making for Community Investments
questions.label: How does your company identify and choose community investment to support strategically?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the methods your company employs to ensure that your community investments have the positive impact that you seek.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Section of employee handbook or strategic plan that includes the intended impacts of community investments.
Checkbox 2: Section of employee handbook or strategic plan that explains your company’s community investment philosophy. 
Checkbox 3: Minutes from Board of Directors meetings that show oversight of community investment programs.
Checkbox 4-5: Checklist used to determine whether a community investment should be made.
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding identifying and choosing strategic community investments. 

Reminders
A community investment is a long-term involvement in a community partnership chosen or created by the company to address social or environmental issues. Contributions may include cash, employee volunteer time, in-kind product donations, use of services or facilities valued at cost to the company, etc.

questions.summary: % of Products with an Environmental Footprint Assessment
questions.label: What % of your products have undergone a formal environmental footprint assessment that included the topics selected in the previous question?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of products in which your company has completed a systematic environmental footprint assessment. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of products in which an environmental footprint assessment has been performed.
2) Description of the type and scope of the assessment. (removed words)
3) Revenue generated from each referenced product in the last fiscal year.
4) Total revenue in the last fiscal year.

questions.label: If you use an independent methodology to measure total commitment to community investment, what is the equivalent % of revenue contributed in the form of community investment?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the monetary value of the company’s community investment activities, as compared to total revenue in the last fiscal year.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Description of each type of involvement, including recipient organization name and your company’s relationship with the group.
2) Amount donated and/or monetary value of time, in-kind product donations, etc., of each action referenced in the last fiscal year
3) Total revenue in the last fiscal year.

Please also include the methodology used for measuring your community investments.

Reminders
A community investment is a long-term involvement in a community partnership chosen or created by the company to address social or environmental issues. Contributions may include cash, employee volunteer time, in-kind product donations, use of services or facilities valued at cost to the company, etc.

questions.label: Has the company's footprint assessments included any of the following?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to justify each answer option selected. Please explain, through comments or additional explanatory documents, how the evidence provided meets all the criteria described in the Explanations of the "Learn More" tab. 

More Details 
For any environmental footprint assessment conducted, you need to provide a comprehensive quantitative report with the analysis, including objectives, scope, boundaries, inventory analysis and assessment, interpretation, and methodology at the minimum. 
If secondary data is used, you need to provide the data source. For any exclusion or assumption, you need to provide the rationale.

The validity of life-cycle / environmental footprint assessment is usually no more than 5 years. If it is older than 5 years, it is necessary to provide a technical rationale on why it is still valid, e.g. letter from the consultancy/research institute.

Please provide the certificate if your company has a lifecycle certification or equivalent.

questions.label: How does your company measure the performance or impact of your community investments?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company monitors the impact of your community investment programs. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Job description that includes measuring and evaluating community investment activities.
Checkbox 2-3: Report or presentation detailing philanthropic activities.
Checkbox 4: List of metrics organized by theme.
Checkbox 5: Survey given to beneficiaries and summary of results that includes outcome metrics.
Checkbox 6: Contract with a 3rd Party, including scope of work.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding the measuring the effectiveness of your community investments. 

Reminders
A community investment is a long-term involvement in a community partnership chosen or created by the company to address social or environmental issues. Contributions may include cash, employee volunteer time, in-kind product donations, use of services or facilities valued at cost to the company, etc.

questions.summary: % of Products with Type of Footprint Assessment
questions.label: What % of your products have undergone the specific type(s) of environmental footprint assesesment selected in the previous question?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of products in which your company has completed a systematic environmental footprint assessment. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of products in which an environmental footprint assessment has been performed.
2) Description of type and scope of the assessment.
3) Revenue generated from each referenced product in the last fiscal year.
4) Total revenue in the last fiscal year.

questions.summary: Management of Material Environmental Impact in Value Chain
questions.label: How has your company utilized the results of your environmental footprint assessment to manage and minimize your overall impact?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify how measuring the environmental impacts of your value chain has resulted in positive changes to your overall environmental footprint. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Internal memos or notes from meetings that discuss strategies developed to address material environmental impacts in your company’s value chain.
Checkbox 2: Link to webpage that includes public reduction targets on the environmental footprint of your product’s value chain/negative impacts.
Checkbox 3: Sustainability report, 3rd Party Audit, internal analysis, etc. from the past two years that shows incremental improvement or positive movement on environmental targets in your value chain.

questions.summary: % of Products with Practices to Minimize Impact of Usage
questions.label: For what % of your products do the product usage practices selected in the previous question apply?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the revenue in the last fiscal year from products with practices in place that manage and minimize the negative environmental impact of product use.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of product/s with practices to minimize the environmental impact of usage.
2) Description of practice (as it relates to the previously selected answer options).
3) Revenue generated from each referenced product/s last fiscal year.
4) Total revenue from all products last fiscal year.

questions.label: Which of the following practices are in place to integrate environmental considerations (DFE) into the design of products and services?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the systematic approaches that your company takes to reduce the overall negative environmental impacts of your product from cradle to grave. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option:

Checkbox 1: Analysis of materials used in products in the past and follow up analysis that shows that fewer materials are required to make products now.
Checkbox 2: Product design plans that show the use of standardized product components/parts, including a caption if the rationale is not stated in the design plan.
Checkbox 3: Picture of label on product/s that show the resource content of the material (e.g. recycling logo with resin identification number).
Checkbox 4: Internal organization documents that reflect what the responsibilities and expectations of each department, including a product maintenance/servicing/reassembly team.
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes information on what products your company will take back for disassembly/reprocessing.
Checkbox 6: Contract that outlines the parameters of your third party product reclamation program.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding integrating environmental considerations into the design of products and services (i.e. company policies, photos with detailed captions, contracts, etc.)


Reminders
The selected answer options should reflect practices that apply to the majority of your product lines.

questions.summary: Programs to Reduce End of Life Waste
questions.label: Which of the following practices are in place to reduce waste to landfill after the usage of your product and/or its packaging?

questions.summary: % of Products Designed for the Environment
questions.label: For what % of your products do the DFE practices selected in the previous question apply?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of products in which your company has taken systematic approaches to reduce the overall negative environmental impacts of that product from cradle to grave and the revenue generated from those products.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of DFE (Designed for the Environment) products.
2) Description of DFE practice.
3) Revenue generated from each referenced product in the last fiscal year.
4) Total revenue in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
Design for the Environment (DFE) is a design approach that seeks to reduce the overall environmental impact of a product, process or service across its life cycle.

questions.summary: % of Products with Programs to Reduce End of Life Waste
questions.label: For what % of your products do the end-of-life waste programs selected in the previous question apply?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much revenue was generated from products with an end-of-life waste program in the last fiscal year.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) List of products who have an end-of-life waste program, including a brief description of what happens to the product.
2) Amount of revenue generated from each product last fiscal year.
3) Total revenue last fiscal year.

questions.label: What % of material (by volume) comes from recycled materials, reused components, and/or certified sustainably sourced materials?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a spreadsheet that includes the volume of input materials that have a reduced impact on the environment and the total volume of your product/s. Examples of environmentally preferred materials include recycled/reused content or materials with third-party environmental certifications (e.g. FSC, organic, etc). 

More Details 
Spreadsheet should include:

1) List of materials with an environmentally beneficial attribute.
2) Indication of what makes the material environmentally preferred (e.g. certification, recycled content, etc).
3) Volume of referenced material.
4) Total volume of all products.

Reminders
Please list all environmentally friendly attributes of a material (if relevant) but do not double count.

questions.label: If the company has conducted a study of end of life disposal in the last two years, what % by volume of the company's products/ wastes sold and their packaging materials are reclaimed (i.e. recycled or reused) at the end of their useful life?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much of the company’s product or packaging is recycled or reused at the end of its useful life, based on on study completed in the last two years.

More Details
Documents may include reports from last year or the year prior detailing the cradle to cradle impact of your product/packaging and the data regarding overall product/packaging reclaimed through a take-back program for recycling or re-use. Alternatively, please provide a spreadsheet with the following information:

1) Total volume of products and packaging reclaimed in the last fiscal year or the year prior (total may include all products reclaimed during that period, regardless of whether that product was sold in the last fiscal year).
2) Total volume of product sold in the last fiscal year or the year prior.

Reminders
This question is intended to reward companies who either manage their own take-back program or have partnered with another organization to provide that service to end users of the product.

questions.label: What % of material (by volume) is made of recyclable (and labeled as such) or biodegradable materials in the areas where they are sold (product + packaging)?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the volume of product and packaging input materials that are either recyclable by the end user or biodegradable.

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Product or packaging component material.
2) Description of attribute (i.e. can be recycled by end user or biodegradable).
3) Volume of referenced input material.
4) Total volume of all input materials used by your company to create your product and packaging.

Reminders
Please note that a product that is inherently biodegradable (such as an apple) would not count toward this question. The intent is to capture an input material or packaging that, as compared to other market alternatives, does not typically biodegrade (i.e. a compostable cup vs. a non-compostable cup), thereby reducing landfill waste.

If the product is composed of recycled material but is not recyclable in its final form, it would not count for this question. Credit for using recycled input material is captured elsewhere in the assessment.

questions.summary: Behavior Change as a Result of Programs
questions.label: Based on the above programs to reduce the environmental impact of product usage, has your company been able to verify improvements in consumer behavior or usage?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your product’s environmental impact has been reduced as a result of consumer behavior.

More Details
Please provide a report that summarizes the customer data compiled by your company or a 3rd Party.

Reminders
These answer options are only applicable if your company has conducted or commissioned a formal study of consumer behavior following the implementation of your programs to reduce the negative environmental impact of product usage.

questions.label: Which of the following are true regarding practices in place to manage and minimize the impact of product usage?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company seeks to reduce the negative environmental impact of its product’s footprint. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Study of consumer behavior regarding use and/or disposal of product.
Checkbox 2: Product analysis that includes lifetime and usability data. Please also provide this information for a similar product from a competitor.
Checkbox 3: Link to website or marketing materials that encourage users to minimize the environmental footprint of the product.
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding practices in place to manage and minimize the environmental impact of product usage.

questions.label: Do you use an established third party methodology to manage quality assurance for your products or services?
questions.guidance: Examples include PDSA, Six Sigma, DMAIC, TQM, Zero Defects, etc
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate your quality assurance program, including a description of which third party methodology is used.

More Details
Examples of third party methodology include: PDSA, Six Sigma, DMAIC, TQM, Zero Defects, etc.

Reminders
Quality assurance activities must apply to the products/services that make up 80% of your revenues.

questions.label: What percentage of your products or services are covered by a formal warranty or guarantee?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all your products/services for which there is a formal warranty/guarantee and how much revenue was generated last fiscal year from each product/service. In addition, please provide copies of the warranty/guarantee document that outlines the terms and conditions for those products/services.

More Details
Two sets of documentation should be provided: A spreadsheet and the product/service warranties. 

Spreadsheet (or similar) should contain:
1) Products/services for which there is a formal warranty/guarantee.
2) Earned revenue for each product/service in the last fiscal year.
3) Total revenue earned from all products/services in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
Only include warranties that are formally provided in writing, not informal promises or verbal commitments.

questions.label: What % your products or services have been reviewed and certified by an accreditation body focused on quality?
questions.guidance: This can include process certifications like ISO9000 or industry specific quality accreditations.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all your products/services that have received an accredited certification for quality and how much revenue was generated last fiscal year from each product/service. In addition, please provide copies of the certification(s).

More Details
Two sets of documentation should be provided: A spreadsheet and the quality certification(s).

Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:
1) Products/services that have a quality certification by an accreditation body.
2) Earned revenue for each product/service in the last fiscal year.
3) Total revenue earned from all products/services in the last fiscal year.

Reminders
Quality certifications often have a minimum set of requirements regarding meeting the expections of the consumer regarding their purchase. Other questions capture social or environmental certifications.

questions.label: Are any of the following true regarding mechanisms for customers to provide feedback, ask questions, or file complaints?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show the communication channels that your company has set up to give the public the opportunity to share feedback, ask questions, and file complaints. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Screengrab of customer service contact information on company website, picture of product(s) packaging including customer service contact information.
Checkbox 2: Link to publicly available product/service reviews.
Checkbox 3: Customer Service Policy that includes a written commitment to respond to inquiries within at least one month, dashboard/report showing response time for customer inquiries.
Checkbox 4: Screengrab of the live support function on the company website.
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim regarding transparent and prompt mechanisms to address customer inquiries.

Reminders
These opportunities should all be broadly recognized and promoted by the company so that most/all customers are aware of them.

questions.label: Does the company have any of the following practices with regard to ensuring accurate, ethical, and positive marketing and advertising?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show how the company promotes honest, fair, and responsible advertising. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Examples of external communication (e.g. website/blogs, packaging, marketing materials etc.), including a potential risk/negative impact of the product.
Checkbox 2: Marketing/Communication Policy, Code of Conduct that includes a section on marketing/advertising.
Checkbox 3: Certificate of Compliance, Proof of membership in third party bodies (e.g. International Code Council) and membership requirements.
Checkbox 4: Examples of external communication (e.g. website/blogs, packaging, marketing materials etc.), including social and environmental causes.
Checkbox 5: Description of advertising campaign and proof of activities taken to gather the input of featured communities (e.g. surveys, interviews, meeting notes, etc.).
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding your accurate, ethical and positive marketing/advertising practices.

questions.label: Which of the following are true of your company with regards to customer or client satisfaction and/or retention?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please share the results of your company's customer satisfaction/retention measurement activities, including how the information is shared and used over time (if applicable). Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Results of customer satisfaction survey, Customer survey that includes a question on satisfaction/retention.
Checkbox 2: Presentation on customer survey results, all staff email.
Checkbox 3: Webpage or press release that includes customer survey results.
Checkbox 4: Written documentation stating specific targets (e.g. client satisfaction action plan, annual report, etc).
Checkbox 5: Data from last year and the year prior that reflects the goals met.

Reminders
Responses should reflect actions that apply to at least 80% of your products/services and that occur consistently.

questions.label: Does your company have any of the following to address data usage and privacy issues?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence of the protections your company has put into place to ensure customer data and privacy. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Link to Data and Privacy Policy on company website.
Checkbox 2: Privacy Policy and/or Terms & Conditions of Data Usage, including where users can find this information (description or screengrab).
Checkbox 3: Screengrab of data privacy "options" menu for customers.
Checkbox 4: Verified GDPR compliance checklist, GDPR compliance program.
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding maintaining customer/client data usage and privacy.

Reminders
The data usage and privacy activities referenced above must be consistent and structured procedures, not occasional practices.

questions.label: Does the company have any of the following practices to ensure security of private data?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that shows the steps the company has taken to manage and protect data from unauthorized access. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Data privacy section of Risk Management Policy, including compliance procedures. 
Checkbox 2: Training materials (e.g. presentation slides, videos, links to online trainings, reading materials) that include data privacy policies and a list of departments that are trained on those topics.
Checkbox 3: Data management section of Code of Conduct, including what qualifies as unauthorized use.
Checkbox 4: Written description of internal audit procedures, internal audit report.
Checkbox 5: External audit report, Contract with external auditor.
Checkbox 6: Scenarios and/or results report for simulated hacks.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how the company secures its data.

questions.label: For what percent of your products has your company conducted a formal assessment of the positive and/or potential negative outcomes produced for your customers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload the results of your outcomes research and a spreadsheet that shows the revenues generated by the products that were assessed.

More Details
Documentation of an outcomes assessment should include the summary of the results, a description of the products reviewed, the positive/negative impacts on your customers, and the methodology of the study. 

Spreadsheet (or similar) should contain:

1) List of products for which your company has completed an outcomes assessment.
2) Revenue generated from each relevant product.
3) Total revenue.

Reminders
Assessing the outcomes of your products goes beyond reporting on customer satisfaction. Documentation must reflect outcome measurement that clearly shows long-term or permanent changes to the quality of life of your beneficiaries. If your outcome measurement does not include a time variable, it does not apply to this question.

questions.label: Does the company do any of the following with regards to managing the potential impact their products have on customers / beneficiaries?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide the results of your research on customer well-being and the outcomes created by your product/service. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Customer survey, notes from focus groups, etc. including a description of the methodology and how often the measurement occurs.
Checkbox 2: Consumer-facing call for customer testing and feedback (flyer, webpage, etc.) and description of how that feedback changed a product design.
Checkbox 3: Continuous Improvement Report informed by customers and sample Action Plan.
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding the collection of customer data on product impacts.

Reminders
Outcomes are not outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

questions.label: Are all employees formally eligible to participate in the ownership structure of the company?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.label: Does your company’s business model create a specific positive benefit for stakeholders such as charitable partners, vendors or suppliers in need, or your local community?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Low Income or Chronically Underemployed Micro-Entrepreneurs
questions.label: Are any of the micro-entrepreneurs you work with verified to be from low-income areas or chronically underemployed populations?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.label: Do you have a formal written standing policy to donate to charitable causes each year?
questions.guidance: You may also select "Yes" if you can demonstrate 3+ years of giving matching the thresholds indicated in the Learn text, or if the company is owned by a charitable organization. Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the BIA.

questions.label: Does your company hire workers that can be verified to be from chronically underemployed populations?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Job Quality for Workers from Chronically Underemployed Populations
questions.label: Does your company provide above market wages, benefits, and/or professional development and support to workers hired from chronically underemployed populations?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.label: Will your locally-focused practices be preserved regardless of company growth or scale through a formal commitment or the design of your business model?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.summary: Direct Impact on Land / Wildlife Conservation
questions.label: Is land/wildlife conservation, beyond what is required by law, a direct positive environmental impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.summary: Description of Positive Environmental Product / Service Impact
questions.label: How would you describe the positive outcome for the environment created by your product/service?

questions.summary: Product or Service Focus on Environmental Education
questions.label: Is environmental education a direct and revenue generating product or service?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.label: Is the environmental impact you've described part of your products' or services' impact (excluding packaging), or is it a part of the way that your company operates?
questions.guidance: Companies should earn revenue from the product or service that has an environmental impact. Please do not include pro bono efforts within this section.

questions.summary: Customer Focus of Product or Service
questions.label: Is the social or economic problem addressed by your product/service one that is faced directly by your customers and/or your clients' beneficiaries?
questions.guidance: If you answer “No” here, be sure to revisit the Environment and/or Community sections to ensure your business model impact is appropriately captured.

questions.summary: Direct Impact on Less Toxic or Toxin Remediation
questions.label: Is being less toxic or providing toxin remediation, beyond what is required by law, a direct positive environmental impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.label: Which of the following best describes the type of product or service you provide in relation to human needs?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Direct Impact on Renewable or Cleaner Burning Energy
questions.label: Is providing or being powered by renewable / cleaner burning energy a direct positive environmental impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.summary: Verification of Lack of Prior Access to Basic Needs
questions.label: Are some of your beneficiaries verified to not have had prior access to a product or service that fulfills the basic human need you are addressing through your product / service?
questions.guidance: Only answer follow up questions based on the % that can be verified to not have previous access.

questions.label: Is resource conservation a direct positive environmental impact of your product or service?
Can at least some of the beneficiaries of your product/service be verified to be underserved?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.label: Does the health impact of your product / service also have a significant positive environmental impact?
questions.guidance: Less toxic products, for example, have a positive environmental impact in addition to a human health impact. This impact is captured in the Environment Impact Area instead of this section.

questions.summary: Product or Service Focus on Education
questions.label: Is the support of education or knowledge the direct result of your revenue generating products or services?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Product or Service Focus on Environmental Issues
questions.label: Is your revenue generating educational product or service focused exclusively on environmental issues?
questions.guidance: If your educational product or service is specifically focused on environmental issues, be sure the revisit the Environment section to ensure that your impact is captured.

questions.summary: Direct Focus on Improving Impact of Organizations
questions.label: For your services that are focused on improving the impact of organizations, did you also select another specific outcome in the question "Beneficial Product Type" earlier in this section?
questions.guidance: Only one answer per product/service line should be selected in "Beneficial Product Type". If you selected more than one, either select "Yes" here, or uncheck some of your responses in that question before selecting "No" here.

questions.summary: Direct Impact on Supporting Purpose Driven / Underserved Businesses
questions.label: For your services that are focused on increasing the success of purpose driven or underserved enterprises, did you also select another specific outcome in the question "Beneficial Product Type" earlier in this section?
questions.guidance: Only one answer per product/service line should be selected in "Beneficial Product Type". If you selected more than one, either select "Yes" here, or uncheck some of your responses in that question before selecting "No" here.

questions.label: Does your company pay an established living wage for an individual or higher?
questions.guidance: If no living or fair wage benchmark exists for your country, then does your company pay 10% or more the local minimum wage? Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.label: Which of the following applies to your company's hiring and workforce development program?
questions.guidance: Your answer to this unscored question is combined with other answers to automatically calculate your score in this section of the assessment.

questions.label: Are the basic infrastructure projects you support or develop provided specifically to areas that are verified to have not had previous access to such infrastructure?
questions.guidance: Answering affirmatively will opt you into additional sections of the B Impact Assessment with more specific questions about this Impact Business Model.

questions.label: Which of the following applies to the method in which you target or hire individuals with barriers to employment?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Basic Training for Employees in Program
questions.label: Does your company provide all employees, at minimum, basic training to safely and successfully fulfill all core job functions?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.summary: Materiality Assessment of Social and Environmental Issues
questions.label: In what ways does your company identify the most material social and environmental issues related to its operations and business models (including its value chain) to report on and manage?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation of the methodology that your company uses to identify the most significant social and environmental impact of its operations and business models. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Minutes from stakeholder meetings, recordings of a stakeholder forums, or written communication with stakeholder input.
Checkbox 2: Policies regarding materiality assessments, copies of third-party materiality assessment reports, or contracts with third-parties that outline the services rendered. 
Checkbox 3: Policies regarding materiality assessments, minutes from Board of Directors meetings, or materiality assessment reports.
Checkbox 4: Materiality assessment reports.

Reminders
This question captures deliberate and routine programs to evaluate your company's impact on the economy, the environment, and society, which would inform the creation of KPIs and decision making.

Examples of stakeholder groups include civil society, customers, environmental groups, other workers and their trade unions, local communities, shareholders and providers of capital and suppliers.

questions.summary: Transparency of Material Issues and Processes
questions.label: What does your company make transparent regarding its materiality assessments of social and environmental issues?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that verifies what aspects of your company's materiality assessment are made available to the public. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Documentation may include relevant sections of your company's impact report or impact page on the company's website. 

Reminders
To be considered transparent, information must be publicly-known. As such, most/all stakeholders should be able to access it.

Examples of stakeholder groups include civil society, customers, environmental groups, other workers and their trade unions, local communities, shareholders and providers of capital and suppliers.

questions.label: Which of the following are included in your company's formal written human rights policy?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that verifies your company's established commitments to human rights issues as defined by international human rights organizations and your company. 

More Details
Please provide a copy of your company's Human Rights Policy/s. Policies should be expressed in writing and apply to the entirety of your company's global operations.

Reminders
Simply engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. There must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

This question is meant to capture policies that go beyond what is required by law.

questions.label: Which of the following apply to your company's advisory board or Board of Directors?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence to validate each answer option regarding the Board of Directors composition, purview and meeting structures. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Meeting minutes or a meeting agenda from a recent meeting and a meeting that occured the previous year.
Checkbox 2: Meeting minutes or agenda that includes a discussion of the company’s social and environmental impact.
Checkbox 3: List of advisors/members and a description of what stakeholder group they were recruited to represent.
Checkbox 4: List of all advisors/members that includes their gender and/or whether they are an individual from an underrepresented group.
Checkbox 5: Link to advisors/Board of Directors page on company website.

Reminders
A Board of Directors is a group of people legally responsible to govern a corporation and responsible to the shareholders, and sometimes to stakeholders as well. Boards of Directors are generally marked by formality of process, i.e. they have regular meetings in which board minutes are taken. A Board of Advisors may also count toward this question; however, it must be a deliberate and structured body, similar to a Board of Directors.

questions.summary: Creating and Managing Inclusive Work Environments
questions.label: Which of the following practices does your company have in place around diversity, equity, and inclusion?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company intentionally identifies and removes barriers for traditionally underrepresented individuals to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion at your company. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Job posting for at least two positions at your company.
Checkbox 2: Written policy that explains the company's candidate selection process, a screenshot of the portal that your company uses when reviewing applications.
Checkbox 3: Training materials (e.g. presentation slides, videos, links to online trainings, reading materials) or contracts with third parties that outline what type of training(s) occurred. 
Checkbox 4: Written policy that describes the language that should be used in job descriptions or a dated evaluation of job description language.
Checkbox 5: Pay equity analysis report, including a summary of results and recommended next steps. 
Checkbox 6: Strategic planning document with measurable diversity improvement goals.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture actions that go beyond anti-discrimination or open-hiring policies required by law.

questions.label: Which of the following are true regarding how your company manages your supply chain impact?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company incorporates responsibility for the social and environmental impacts of its supply chain into individual performance expectations and internal reporting.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Job descriptions and performance evaluations for at least two members of the procurement department.
Checkbox 2: Job descriptions for at least two members of the senior management team that include the social and environmental performance of the supply chain. 
Checkbox 3: Analysis of supply chain assessments, including overall trends and breaches.
Checkbox 4: Description of supply chain problem regarding social and environmental performance and evidence of actions taken to address it (e.g. meeting minutes, trainings, etc).

questions.summary: Verification of Positive Outcomes in Supply Chain
questions.label: Has your company verified any of the following outcomes for all aspects of its supply chain in a way that can be publicly and accurately confirmed?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate that your supply chain meets or exceeds local and international standards regarding labor, human rights, and the environment. 

More Details
Answer options should only be selected if your company has directly assessed the practice in question. Therefore, documentation should include a sample survey given to suppliers and a summary of results that includes answers for the entirety of your supply chain. Please also provide a link to where this information is publicly available.

questions.label: Are all of your microfranchises small and independently owned businesses (with less than 50 employees)?
Does your company provide ongoing trainings for all microfrancises?

questions.summary: Low Income, Poor, or Very Poor Microfranchises
questions.label: Are any of your microfranchises low income, poor, or very poor?
Do microfranchises have at least 50% ownership stake in their businesses?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify what percentage of ownership your microfranchises have in their business. 

More Details
Documentation may include your company’s standard microfranchise contract or an information packet provided to prospective microfranchises that explains the ownership breakdown. Evidence provided must be representative of all microfranchise relationships. 

Reminders
Microfranchises must have fewer than 50 employees to qualify for this question.

questions.label: What percent of microfranchises qualify as low income, poor, very poor, or are individuals with barriers to employment?
Are all of your microdistributors small and independently owned businesses (with less than 50 employees)?
Do you provide training to microdistributors to effectly sell your product or service?

questions.summary: Low Income, Poor, or Very Poor Microdistributors
questions.label: Are any of your microdistributors low income, poor, or very poor?
Does income from distribution of your company's product or service comprise at least half of the microdistributors total business income?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how much income your microdistributors generate from the sale of your product/service and the total income of your microdistributors. 

More Details
Documentation may include survey questions or notes from focus groups that ask microdistributors about their business income and how much is from the sale of your company’s products/services. Please also include a summary of results, including the number of individuals who responded and the methodology used. 

Reminders
Microdistributors must have fewer than 50 employees and be independently owned to qualify for this question.

This question is intended to capture the data from a consistent and structured program to track the income of your microdistributors. If your company does not collect this information, this question may not be applicable.

questions.label: What percent of microdistributors qualify as low income, poor, very poor, or are individuals with barriers to employment?
Does your company have an environmental management system (EMS) covering waste generation, energy usage, water usage, and carbon emissions that includes any of the following?
questions.guidance: Please check all that apply.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to comprehensively measure and manage its environmental footprint. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option:

Checkbox 1: A written statement that includes your company’s commitment to the environment (e.g. in an employee handbook, on the company website, etc).
Checkbox 2: A dated assessment of the company’s environmental footprint that includes energy use, water consumption, carbon emissions, and waste metrics.
Checkbox 3: The company’s goals and qualitative targets for one or more of the metrics in the assessment referenced in Checkbox 2. 
Checkbox 4: A document that outlines the parameters of your program to achieve environmental reduction targets referenced in Checkbox 3 (e.g. action plan, approved budget for project execution).
Checkbox 5: A description of how your company holds itself accountable to the environmental goals referenced above and a dated report of the most recent compliance review or audit of your environmental footprint.

Reminders
The environmental assessment of the company's business activities must include all inputs and outputs. Engaging in an energy audit alone, for example, would not meet the criteria for this question (though you will receive credit for that assessment elsewhere).

questions.label: Which of the following practices does your company have in place to manage product longevity in order to reduce overall consumption and waste to landfill?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what steps your company has taken to lengthen the lifespan of your product for the customer, thereby providing the end user the opportunity to consume less and reduce waste sent to landfills. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option:

Checkbox 1: Dated project report that includes the product lifespan at the time (please also describe methodology, if not included in report) and dated re-drafted product designs, which reflect recommendations made in the report.
Checkbox 2: Internal organization documents that reflect the responsibilities and expectations of each department, including product maintenance/servicing/reassembly; Contracts with 3rd parties to provide that service. 
Checkbox 3: Picture of packaging or product label that provides instructions on how to utilize your company’s maintenance/servicing program. 
Checkbox 4: Link to webpage, videos, etc. of an advertising campaign that provides instructions on how to utilize your company’s maintenance/servicing program. 
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding increasing product longevity for your customers (i.e. company policies, photos with detailed captions, contracts, etc.)

Reminders
The selected answer options should reflect practices that apply to the majority of your product lines.

questions.label: What % of your company’s Scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions were offset by certified carbon credits?
questions.documentationText:
Overview 
Please upload documentation to verify the Scope 3 greenhouse gases emitted by your company and how many carbon offsets were purchased in the last fiscal year.

More Details
Documentation should include an inventory of your company's Scope 3 greenhouse emissions and receipts of carbon offset purchases that state the quantity purchased.

Reminders
Scope 3 emissions are indirect emissions due to the extraction and production of purchased materials and fuels, transport-related activities in vehicles not owned or controlled by the company, electricity-related activities not covered in Scope 2, outsourced activities, waste disposal, etc. 

Please only include only third-party certified offsets.

questions.label: What practices has your company implemented for a majority of suppliers (on a cost basis) to reduce the greenhouse gas emissions produced through your supply chain?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to verify the evaluation and support services that your company offers to a majority of its suppliers to mitigate their greenhouse gas emissions. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier greenhouse gas emissions inventories and/or instructions to suppliers on how to collect this data. 
Checkbox 2: Supplier selection policy that includes consideration of greenhouse gas emissions. 
Checkbox 3: Educational resources for suppliers to manage their greenhouse gas emissions (e.g. literature, greenhouse gas emissions management guidelines, online measurement tools, surveys)
Checkbox 4: Supplier greenhouse gas audits completed by your company, including recommendations on corrective actions and what your company will do to assist, or a contract with a third party that includes the scope of work and a sample audit report.

Reminders
Only select practices that your company has implemented for a majority of your suppliers (on a cost basis). A supplier is any business that your company pays to provide a good or service. However, in the B Impact Assessment, suppliers will always exclude 1) your landlord, 2) your utility company, and 3) the entity to which you pay your taxes.

questions.label: What practices has your company implemented for a majority of suppliers (on a cost basis) to reduce the water footprint of your supply chain?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to minimize water use in your supply chain.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier water use report.
Checkbox 2: New supplier information packet or contract that includes expected standards regarding water use.
Checkbox 3: Email sent to supplier including resources that are provided to reduce water use in the supply chain (please make sure links and/or attachments are also available).
Checkbox 4: Supplier water use audit report and improvement plan for supplier.

Reminders
This question is seeking to capture practices that your company engages in broadly and consistently. As such, answer options selected must have occurred with a majority of your suppliers (on a cost basis).

questions.label: What practices has your company implemented for a majority of suppliers (on a cost basis) to reduce waste in your supply chain?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to minimize waste in your supply chain.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier report of waste generated.
Checkbox 2: New supplier information packet or contract that includes expected standards regarding waste generation.
Checkbox 3: Email sent to supplier including resources that are provided to reduce waste in the supply chain (please make sure links and/or attachments are also available).
Checkbox 4: Supplier waste audit report and improvement plan for supplier.

Reminders
This question is seeking to capture practices that your company engages in broadly and consistently. As such, answer options selected must have occurred with a majority of your suppliers (on a cost basis).

questions.label: What practices has your company implemented for a majority of suppliers (on a cost basis) to reduce toxins or hazardous waste in your supply chain?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to minimize the production of toxins or hazardous waste by your suppliers.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier chemical data report.
Checkbox 2: New supplier information packet or contract that includes expected standards regarding toxins or hazardous waste. 
Checkbox 3: Email sent to supplier including resources that are provided to reduce toxins in the supply chain (please make sure links and/or attachments are also available).
Checkbox 4: Supplier toxins/hazardous waste audit report and improvement plan for supplier.

Reminders
This question is seeking to capture practices that your company engages in broadly and consistently. As such, answer options selected must have occurred with a majority of your suppliers (on a cost basis).

questions.label: What practices has your company implemented for a majority of suppliers (on a cost basis) to reduce your supply chain's impact on biodiversity?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what actions your company has taken to minimize the negative biodiversity impact of your suppliers.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier biodiversity impact report.
Checkbox 2: Prospective supplier information packet or Supplier Code of Conduct that includes expected standards regarding positive biodiversity practices. 
Checkbox 3: Email sent to supplier including resources that are provided to encourage biodiversity-friendly operations (please make sure links and/or attachments are also available).
Checkbox 4: Biodiversity audit report and improvement plan for supplier.

Reminders
This question is seeking to capture practices that your company engages in broadly and consistently. As such, answer options selected must have occurred with a majority of your suppliers (on a cost basis).

questions.label: Does your company do any of the following to manage the impact and value created for your customers or consumers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation for the good stewardship practices that have been put in place to benefit the customer's experience with your product/service. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Product/Service Guarantee, Warranty, Customer Protection Policy, Terms & Conditions of product/service sale.
Checkbox 2: Certificate of third party accreditation/certification (e.g. Customer Service Management or other certifications related to customer stewardship).
Checkbox 3: Documentation used for quality control, ISO9001 certificate.
Checkbox 4: Customer Service Policy, Screengrab of dedicated feedback/complaints communication channel.
Checkbox 5: Customer Survey and/or related report of results, Notes from Focus Groups.
Checkbox 6: Customer Survey and/or related report of results or Notes from Focus Groups that includes a question asking about long-term or permanent changes for the beneficiaries of your product/service.
Checkbox 7: Marketing or Advertising Policy, Customer Service Policy that includes a section on ethical customer engagement.
Checkbox 8: Client Privacy Policy, Description of procedures for data management.

questions.label: How does your company monitor, record, or report its energy usage?
questions.guidance: Include electricity and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company evaluates and/or sets targets regarding its energy use.

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 2: Report that summarizes energy used in the last month and last year.
Checkbox 3-4: Recent energy use report and energy reduction targets (e.g. included in annual or sustainability report, notes from senior management meetings, etc.).
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes annual sustainability reports with energy reduction targets. 
Checkbox 6: Energy use reports that show a change which matches the targets your company set (e.g. data from last year and the year prior). 

Reminders
Reduction targets must include specific goals, not just a general commitment to using less energy.

questions.label: How does your company monitor, record, or report its water usage?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what steps your company has taken to measure and/or reduce its water use.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Report that summarizes water use from at least two reporting periods.
Checkbox 3-4: Recent water use report and reduction targets (e.g. included in annual or sustainability report, notes from senior management meetings, etc.).
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes annual sustainability reports with water use reduction targets. 
Checkbox 6: Water use report that shows a change which matches the targets your company set.

Reminders
Reduction targets must include specific goals, not just a general commitment to using less water.

questions.summary: Monitoring and Reporting Greenhouse Gas Emissions
questions.label: How does your company manage its greenhouse gas emissions for at least Scope 1 and 2?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what steps your company has taken to measure and/or reduce its greenhouse gas emissions. 

More Details
Sample documents: 

Checkbox 2: Report that summarizes greenhouse gas emissions generated from at least two reporting periods.
Checkbox 3-4: Recent greenhouse gas emissions report and reduction targets (e.g. included in annual or sustainability report, notes from senior management meetings, etc.).
Checkbox 5: Link to webpage that includes annual sustainability reports with greenhouse gas emission reduction targets. 
Checkbox 6: Greenhouse gas emissions report that shows a change which matches the targets your company set.
Checkbox 7: Receipt for purchase of carbon credits, including amount offset.

Reminders
Reduction targets must include specific goals, not just a general commitment to producing fewer greenhouse gas emissions.

questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "What % of total business is generated through microfranchises" and "What percent of microfranchises qualify as low income, poor, very poor, or are individuals with barriers to employment?"

This is a calculated question based on your previous answers: "What % of total business is generated through microdistributors?" and "What percent of microdistributors qualify as low income, poor, very poor, or are individuals with barriers to employment?"
Are there key performance indicators (KPIs) or metrics that your company tracks at least annually to determine if you are meeting your social or environmental objectives?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that shows your company’s annual social and environmental metrics.

More Details
Documents may include an annual impact report, dated slide deck presented to staff or stakeholders, or a link to relevant webpage.

Reminders
Outcomes are not outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

Data must be updated and reviewed on an annual basis to qualify for this question.

questions.label: Is any of your company’s labor performed by subcontracted organizations or individuals, such as outsourced staffing services or independent contractors?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.label: For the remainder of the Workers section, you should consider independent contractors that work for the company 20+ hours per week over a 6+ month period as "employees" or "workers"

questions.summary: Supplementary Health Benefits Eligibility for Part-Time Workers
questions.label: When do part-time workers become eligible to participate in the supplementary benefits offered by your company?
questions.guidance: If applicable, please select one answer indicating tenure requirements (answers 1-2), and one answer indicating weekly hour requirements (answers 3-4).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate when part-time workers have access to the supplementary benefits offered to full-time employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents include the relevant section of your employee handbook, the part-time benefits section of your employee benefits guide, and/or an offer letter to an entry-level part-time employee that details when the employee is eligible for supplementary benefits.

Reminders
Answer options must apply to all part-time workers, not part-time workers in a particular department.

questions.label: Which of the following environmental metrics does your company track regarding the environmental impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: You will be asked to report each environmental metric selected

questions.label: Which of the following environmental metrics does your company track regarding the environmental impact of your product or service?

questions.guidance: You will be asked to report each environmental metric selected

questions.guidance: You will be asked to report each environmental metric selected
