questions.guidance: You will be asked to report each environmental metric selected

questions.label: Which of the following environmental metrics does your company track regarding the environmental impact of your product or service?
questions.guidance: You will be asked to report each environmental metric selected

questions.label: This is a calculated question based on your answers above: "Which of the following applies to the method in which you target or hire individuals with barriers to employment?" and "Which of the following applies to your company's hiring and workforce development program?"
Other sensitive practices that may cause social or environmental harm, or are subject to stakeholder concern
Has your company taken action to track and manage the greenhouse emissions produced through your supply chain? (absolute reduction)
questions.guidance: Only select practices if you track and manage greenhouse emissions produced for at least 50% of your company suppliers (on a cost basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the greenhouse gas emissions of its supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 2: Inventory of greenhouse emissions in the company's supply chain. 
Checkbox 3: Receipts or confirmation emails of carbon offset purchases.
Checkbox 4: Inventory of greenhouse emissions in the company's supply chain, including measurable goals for reductions.
Checkbox 5: Report of greenhouse emissions in the company's supply chain that demonstrates a reduction in the last twelve months or a recent inventory and an inventory from sometime in the prior 12 months.
Checkbox 6: Inventory of greenhouse emissions in the company's supply chain and receipts or confirmation emails of carbon offset purchases. 

Reminders
To qualify for this question, your company must take Scope 1, 2 & 3 greenhouse gas emissions under consideration.

questions.label: How does your company track and manage the water footprint of your supply chain?
questions.guidance: Only select practices if you track and manage the water footprint for at least 50% of your company suppliers (on a cost basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the impact of water use in its supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Analysis or recent report of material water use in your supply chain.
Checkbox 3: Action plan or supply chain improvement plan that includes reduction targets around material water use.
Checkbox 4: Survey sent to suppliers, summary of third party review that confirms a reduction in your supply chain’s water footprint in the past 12 months.
Checkbox 5: Research (internal or external) that shows that water in your supply chain is used in a science-based and sustainable manner.

Reminders
This question seeks to capture the extent to which your company tracks and manages water use in its supply chain, not whether suppliers independently undertake actions to measure their water footprint.

questions.label: How does your company track and manage waste in your supply chain?
questions.guidance: Only select practices if you track and manage waste for at least 50% of your company suppliers (on a cost basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the impact of waste in its supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Analysis or recent report of waste generated in your supply chain.
Checkbox 3: Action plan or supply chain improvement plan that includes reduction targets around waste.
Checkbox 4: Survey sent to suppliers, summary of third party review that confirms a reduction in your supply chain waste generation in the past 12 months.
Checkbox 5: Certification to reflect a zero waste or closed-loop supply chain, third party or internal report that shows that no waste has been generated throughout the supply chain. 

Reminders
Zero waste and closed-loop supply chains involve the conservation of all resources through the responsible production, consumption, reuse, and recovery of products, packaging, and materials with no discharges to land, water, or air.

questions.label: How does your company track and manage toxins or hazardous waste in your supply chain?
questions.guidance: Only select practices if you track and manage toxins or hazardous waste for at least 50% of your company suppliers (on a cost basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the impact of toxins and hazardous waste in your supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Analysis or recent report of toxins/hazardous waste in your supply chain.
Checkbox 3: Action plan or supply chain improvement plan that includes reduction targets around toxins or hazardous waste.
Checkbox 4: Survey sent to suppliers, summary of third party review of supply chain that confirms that there are no harmful toxins or chemicals used.

Reminders
This question seeks to capture the extent to which your company tracks and manages toxins and/or hazardous waste in its supply chain, not whether suppliers independently undertake actions to measure their toxins and/or hazardous waste production.

questions.label: How does your company track and manage your supply chain's impact on biodiversity?
questions.guidance: Only select practices if you track and manage the impact on biodiversity for at least 50% of your company suppliers (on a cost basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the biodiversity impacts of your supply chain. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 2: Analysis or recent report of material risks to biodiversity caused by your supply chain.
Checkbox 3: Action plan or supply chain improvement plan that includes reduction targets around negative biodiversity impacts.
Checkbox 4: Survey sent to suppliers, summary of third party review of supply chain that confirms a neutral or positive biodiversity impact.

Reminders
This question seeks to capture the extent to which your company tracks and manages negative biodiversity impacts in its supply chain, not whether suppliers independently undertake actions to manage the consequences of their business on biodiversity.

questions.label: Based on the processes you have highlighted, what are the material issues that have been identified?
How does your company support internal management and good governance?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show what good governance management practices the company has set up. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Organizational chart, including management and reporting structure.
Checkbox 2: Job descriptions for all employment types, Screengrab of internal document management system listing all job descriptions.
Checkbox 3: Notes from management team meetings, including agenda points covering strategy or operational decision making.
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding your internal management and good governance practices.

questions.label: Does your company do any of the following with regard to monitoring and reporting on your anti-corruption programme?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show how your company holds itself accountable to its anti-corruption commitments. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Job description that contains monitoring and reporting on anti-corruption as an assigned responsibility.
Checkbox 2: Results of internal employee self-evaluations, screengrab of automated control monitoring, business rules for automated control monitoring.
Checkbox 3: Minutes and/or agenda of Board of Directors meeting, including results and action plans for the anti-corruption program.
Checkbox 4: Report from a third party audit on the company's anti-corruption program.
Checkbox 5: Recent dated newsletter or blog post about the company's anti-corruption program and one from the year prior, Recent slide deck for a workshop about the anti-corruption program and invitation indicating which stakeholder groups were invited (please also provide the same information for the previous year).

questions.label: What information does the company make publicly available and transparent?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what details regarding the governance and performance of the company are made public. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Link to webpage that includes all beneficial owners.
Checkbox 2: Link to company financials on the company’s website or screenshot to show where all employees can freely access this information. 
Checkbox 3: Link to webpage that describes the company’s social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 4: Link to webpage that states who is on the company’s Board of Directors.

Reminders
A beneficial owner is an individual who ultimately owns, controls or benefits from a company or trust fund and the income it generates. The term is used to contrast with the legal or nominee company owners and with trustees, all of whom might be registered as the legal owners of an asset without actually possessing the right to enjoy its benefits.

questions.label: Does your company have a written Code of Ethics policy?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide your company's Code of Ethics policy.

More Details
Please use the comment feature to state the page number where verification of each answer option can be found. 

Reminders
Simply engaging in a behavior does not count for this question. There must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

questions.label: How does your company integrate social and environmental performance into decision-making?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the ways that your company ensures that its social and environmental performance is actively taken under consideration when making decisions.

More Details
Checkbox 1: Employee training materials (e.g. slide decks, agendas, etc.) that includes information about social or environmental issues relevant to the company.
Checkbox 2: Manager job description that includes social and environmental responsibilities and performance.
Checkbox 3: Two performance reviews from different departments that include social and environmental metrics.
Checkbox 4: Executive team member job description and performance review that shows expectations regarding social and environmental performance tied to compensation.
Checkbox 5: Minutes from Board of Directors meetings that include a review of the company’s social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 6: Financial Balance sheet with social and environmental externalities incorporated in monetary terms.
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company integrates social and environmental performance into its decision-making.

Reminders
Engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above intermittently does not count for this question. Items selected should be consistently practiced and codified across the entire company.

questions.label: What practices does your company have in place to promote ethical decision-making and prevent corruption?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show how your company supports and encourages ethical behavior within your organization. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Code of Ethics (e.g. Code of Conduct, Code of Business Standards). 
Checkbox 2: Whistleblower policy.
Checkbox 3: Policy document that describes the mechanisms in place to ensure the integrity of financial and accounting information.
Checkbox 4: Dated report of an ethics-focused risk assessment. 
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding any additional practices that the company has in place to promote ethical decision-making and prevent corruption.

questions.summary: % of Employees Paid Family Living Wage
questions.label: What percentage of employees on an FTE (Full Time Equivalent) basis are paid at least the equivalent of a living wage for a family?
questions.guidance: Please exclude students and interns in this calculation.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
If applicable, provide evidence of the third-party living wage accreditation. If you do not have this, then provide an overview of your chosen benchmark and the prevailing wage calculations.

More Details
1) Accreditation - Evidence of third-party accreditation can be in the form of an email confirmation from the accreditation provider or public mention on the provider’s website. Check that B Lab accepts your particular accreditation.

2) Living wage benchmark - share the benchmark data and, if applicable, indicate which data subset you have chosen (e.g. individual or family). Where information is publicly available, add a link to the source. Where data was purchased and is not publicly available, send the original data set. Note, WageIndicator and Fair Wage Network have informed B Lab that companies may share datasets for verification purposes. Use colors and notes to highlight which data is relevant for B Lab’s verification.

3) Prevailing wages - share list of workers or roles and their wage components. If the base wage already meets the living wage benchmark, then you only need to provide the base wage. If you add extra wage components, such as benefits and bonuses, then include notes to explain what they are for and how they are earned. All wage data should be disaggregated, meaning all extra wage components should be listed separately. If you include extra wage components beyond the ones mentioned as examples in B Lab's guidance, include notes to justify how the components meet B Lab's principles for inclusion (as described in the Knowledge Base Article about living wage). Please clearly demonstrate in the document the rationale/calculation that justifies the % selected as the answer option.

4) All data should be harmonized, meaning they are based on the same rate (e.g. USD per month) and calculated pro rata (e.g. for those working part-time). Data should also be harmonized across locations, though they should remain in the local currency. The data and calculations you share should clearly show how you came to your answer (e.g. spreadsheet formulas should be visible).

Knowledge Base Article link: https://kb.bimpactassessment.net/en/support/solutions/articles/43000671646-answering-living-wage-questions-in-the-b-impact-assessment#5.-External-resources

Reminders
The living wage is not the minimum wage. A living wage usually goes beyond the minimum wage required by law and ensures that workers are able to meet a decent standard of living for them and their family.

Accepted living wage benchmarks can be found in the Knowledge Base Article. B Lab accepts benchmarks that cover most countries in the world, though the data is not always free.

If your company answered this question using prevailing wages calculations, you should be able to demonstrate how you followed the principles and steps prescribed in the Knowledge Base Article.

You may redact employee names on documents.

questions.label: What percentage of individuals working for the company are formally employed on the payroll of the company?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide evidence to show how many individuals currently work for the company and how many of those are formal part-time and/or full-time employees on payroll.

More Details
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. Either should include:

1) Name or other indicator (Employee 1, Employee 2, etc) of all individuals being paid by the company in exchange for their labor.
2) The nature of the employment contract for each individual (e.g. full-time payrolled, contractor etc.).

Reminders
You may redact employee names.

questions.label: Does your company offer any of the following additional financial benefits to non-executive workers?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to verify the financial benefits your company provides to its non-executive employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Documents may include an employee handbook or a formal compensation and benefits policy that clearly describes the financial benefit and who is eligible.

Reminders
Items selected must be available to the majority of non-executive employees. Non-executive employees are responsible for their own workload, but not the overall direction of the company. 

Cost of living adjustment refers to an increase in a person's wages, pension, etc. that is made once a year according to how much the prices of things such as food, transport, and housing have increased. To determine the cost of living adjustment, please use the following resource: https://tradingeconomics.com/country-list/inflation-rate 

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its employees, not a legal obligation.

questions.label: What are your formal company policies regarding employee termination and layoffs?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide policies that reflect the company's procedures regarding employee termination and layoffs. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option include an employee handbook, an exit management policy, and/or other relevant written human resources policies.

Reminders
This question requires formal and written policies to which the company can be held accountable. Description of practices and/or examples of individual cases do not apply for this question.

questions.label: What was the equivalent percentage of profits that were distributed as bonuses to non-executive workers in the last fiscal year?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a document that shows company profits last fiscal year and the total amount of bonuses given to non-executive employees during that period. 

More Details
Spreadsheet (or similar) should include:

1) Total company profits from the last fiscal year.
2) List of non-executive employees who received a bonus (using name or Employee 1, 2, etc.).
3) Employee title (i.e. Marketing Associate).
3) Bonus amount received by non-executive employee last fiscal year.

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided. 

Please note that the focus of this question is rewarding the payment of bonuses for non-executive employees. In general terms, non-executive employees are responsible for their own workload but not the overall direction of the company. 

Also, sales commissions do not count as bonuses for this question.

questions.label: How does your company engage and empower workers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation for mechanisms that you have put in place to engage employees and/or gather and use employee input. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Section of employee handbook that describes options for employee feedback/complaint or employee form to submit feedback/compliant.
Checkbox 2: Description of a proposed change at company and proof of opportunities employees received to provide their input (meetings minutes, surveys, etc).
Checkbox 3: Job description that includes annually reviewing employee compliant/input mechanisms and soliciting feedback from employees or agendas/minutes from annual company meetings in which this topic is discussed.
Checkbox 4: Screen Grab of your company's feedback/complaints tracking system, including resolution rates.
Checkbox 5: Training materials provided to employees about open book management or self-management principles or relevant sections of employee handbook.
Checkbox 6: Employee handbook, governing documents, or distributed description of election procedure. 
Checkbox 7: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company consistently engages and empowers workers (i.e. company policies, photos with detailed captions, contracts with third party providers, etc.)

Reminders
Open book management is about more than just sharing financial information with all employees. It must also include a detailed curriculum that teaches individuals how to understand those numbers in a practical business context.

questions.summary: Healthcare Eligibility for Part Time Workers
questions.label: When do part-time workers become eligible to participate in healthcare plans offered by your company?
questions.guidance: If applicable, please select one answer indicating tenure requirements (answers 1-2), and one answer indicating weekly hour requirements (answers 3-4).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a document that outlines the eligibility critiria of company-sponsored health insurance plans as they apply for part-time employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents for each answer option include an employee handbook, an employee benefits guide, or an offer letter for a part-time position.

Reminders
Items selected must be available to all part-time employees.

questions.label: What percentage of your employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of all employees and indicate who is covered by a collective bargaining agreement. 

More Details
Information can be provided in an edited employee roster or in a spreadsheet. Either should include:

1) Name or other indicator (Employee 1, Employee 2, etc) of all employees.
2) Whether that employee is covered by collective bargaining agreement.

Please also upload a copy of the referenced collective bargaining agreement. 

Reminders
You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What benefits does your company provide to all full-time tenured workers to supplement government programs?
questions.guidance: Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what benefits your company offers to its full-time employees above and beyond what is required by law. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Documents may include relevant sections of the employee handbook, plan summaries from the insurance company, contracts with service providers, and/or a benefits information packet given to employees.

Reminders
Items selected must be made available to all full-time tenured employees, not provided on an ad hoc basis.

Any affirmative answer should reflect a benefit that your company chose to offer its full-time employees, not a legal obligation.

Only select benefits the company pays the majority of costs to all full-time tenured workers. Select Other if the company covers less than 50% of the expenses for the benefits listed or other benefits offered.

questions.label: How does your company create an inclusive recruiting and hiring process?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company intentionally identifies and removes barriers for traditionally underrepresented individuals in its recruiting and hiring. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Job posting for at least two positions at your company.
Checkbox 2: List of questions that are asked to job candidates during interviews.
Checkbox 3: Written policy that explains the company's candidate selection process, a screenshot of the portal that your company uses when reviewing applications.
Checking 4: Screenshot of a job posting on a relevant organization's website, written communication from a service that recruits underrepresented populations. 
Checkbox 5: Written policy that describes the language that should be used in job descriptions or a dated evaluation of job description language.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture actions that go beyond anti-discrimination or open-hiring policies required by law.

questions.label: Does your company provide any of the following training opportunities to workers for professional development?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documents that support each of the selected learning and development opportunities offered to employees. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Overview of the training provided to all new employees (e.g. agenda, slide decks, etc).
Checkbox 2: Training calendar, training material (e.g. presentation slides, videos, links to online trainings, reading materials), or contract with or invoice of third party training provider, if applicable. All materials provided must include a date.
Checkbox 3: Employee handbook, Career Development policy, or other written (HR) policies.
Checkbox 4-5: Training calendar, training material (e.g. presentation slides, videos, links to online trainings, reading materials), or contract with or invoice of third party training provider, if applicable.
Checkbox 6: Company budget with external professional development opportunities as a line item, or examples of invoices for conferences and/or online training, etc. 
Checkbox 7: Employee handbook, Training & Development policy, or examples of invoices for the college degrees/professional licenses that were paid for by the company.

Reminders
Simply engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. If a policy is specified, there must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

Unless specifically stated otherwise, training can be provided internal as well as external.

questions.label: How does your company create an equitable and inclusive workplace for employees?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company supports the success of underrepresented individuals in the workplace through removing barriers and promoting involvement in the workplace. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Job description for a Diversity Manager (or similar), a dated agenda/notes from a Diversity and Inclusion Committee.
Checkbox 2: Training materials (e.g. presentation slides, videos, links to online trainings, reading materials) or contracts with third parties that outline what type of training(s) occurred.
Checkbox 3: Materials from an employee resource group or affinity group event/meeting (e.g. agendas, notes, presentation slides, videos, flyer advertising event).
Checkbox 4: Photos or blueprints of your facility that show how it is accessible to individuals with physical disabilities. 
Checkbox 5: Photos of gender-neutral or gender-inclusion restroom signage.
Checkbox 6: Application for mentorship/apprenticeship/internship programs targeted to underrepresented groups.
Checkbox 7: Policy that describes accommodations for employees with learning or emotional disabilities.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture actions that go beyond anti-discrimination or open-hiring policies required by law.

questions.summary: Management of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
questions.label: How does your company manage and improve your workplace diversity and inclusivity?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company measures and sets goals to create a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Survey or summary of survey results.
Checkbox 2: Meeting minutes that confirm a conversation around quantitative diversity goals (please also provide titles for all attendees).
Checkbox 3: Summary of pay equity analysis, including improvement plans (if applicable).
Checkbox 4: Summary of data from employee surveys broken down by different demographic groups, including improvement plans (if applicable).
Checkbox 5: Summary of analysis of individuals who are part of multiple underrepresented groups.

Reminders
This question is meant to capture actions that go beyond anti-discrimination or open-hiring policies required by law.

questions.label: How has your company worked with its stakeholders (including competitors) to improve behavior or performance on social or environmental issues in the past two years?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to illustrate how your company recently improved its social or environmental performance through collaboration with its stakeholders. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Agenda from a conference or written communication with other industry players to improve social or environmental standards.
Checkbox 2: Research reports or academic literature with reference to company data.
Checkbox 3: Materials that describe the topic of the event and what was discussed (e.g. slides, agendas, videos, minutes).
Checkbox 4: Resources shared with other businesses or stakeholders on improving social or environmental performance (e.g. brochures, reports, videos) and description of where each can be found by the public.
Checkbox 5: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding improving social or environmental performance in conjuction with stakeholders.


Reminders
This question captures the impact of collaborative efforts with other stakeholders to advance social and environmental standards in your industry. Internal efforts are captured in other questions.

Actions taken outside of the two year timeframe do not count toward this question.

questions.label: What attributes of a diverse workforce does your company track, either through anonymous surveys or other methods legal in your jurisdiction?
questions.guidance: If collecting this type of demographic data is not legal in your jurisdiction, select None of the Above.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate what employee demographic information is collected by your company.

More Details
Documentation may include a sample employee survey or a summary of information reported by employees during the job application/onboarding process, etc.

questions.summary: Support for Improved Supply Chain Social or Environmental Performance
questions.label: How does your company encourage improved social and environmental performance among your suppliers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company assists its suppliers in improving their social and environmental impacts.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Supplier contract or information packet for new suppliers that describes incentives for strong social and environmental performance.
Checkbox 2: Action plans shared with suppliers that include goals/expectations regarding social and environmental impacts.
Checkbox 3: Social and environmental performance improvement resources shared with suppliers (e.g. training materials, pamphlets, etc).
Checkbox 4: Please provide evidence of the claim made regarding how your company encourages improved social and environmental performance among your suppliers.

Reminders
Opportunities referenced must be available to a majority of suppliers.

questions.summary: Workers from Ethnic or Racial Minorities
questions.label: What percentage of your workforce identifies as being from a racial or ethnic minority?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that shows the breakdown of your workforce by race and ethnicity. 

More Details
Documentation may include a complete employee roster with a column indicating which employees identify as being from racial or ethnic minorities or, if your company collects demographic information in a management application, a report that summarizes the data.

Reminders
Workforce includes full-time and part-time employees on the company's payroll.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Is your company locally and independently owned?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.

questions.label: What percentage of your workforce is either under the age of twenty four or over the age of fifty?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that shows the breakdown of your workforce by age.

More Details
Documentation may include a complete employee roster with a column indicating employee age or, if your company collects demographic information in a management application, a report that summarizes the data.

Reminders
Workforce includes full-time and part-time employees on the company's payroll.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: Does your company have any explicit written commitments to serving local communities?
questions.guidance: Your answers determine which future questions in the assessment are applicable to your company.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to show how your company supports your local community through its purchases or its preference for local customers. 

More Details
Sample Documents:

Checkbox 1: Purchasing policy or procurement manual that commits to buying from local and independent suppliers for core products.
Checkbox 2: Employee handbook with a section on your commitment to a local and independent customer base.

Reminders
Simply engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. There must be a written component and it must match the numerical criteria for the question. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

Please also keep in mind the definitions for "supplier," “independent” and “local.”

A supplier is any business that your company pays to provide a good or service. However, in the B Impact Assessment, suppliers will always exclude 1) your landlord, 2) your utility company, and 3) the entity to which you pay your taxes. Other questions in the assessment speak to these providers. 

An independent supplier or client cannot be a majority-owned subsidiary of another company or a publicly traded company. It must be independently-owned.

While the size and distance of a community may vary by context, local should generally be defined as a small-scale economically and culturally connected area. Examples include a metropolitan area or, in a less densely populated area, a county or the surrounding vicinity (usually within 50 miles or less).

questions.label: What percentage of your workforce identifies as part of another underrepresented social group other than the demographics featured above (e.g. individuals with disabilities, LGBTQ+ individuals, individuals who have been incarcerated, etc.)?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation that shows a breakdown of your workforce that includes underrepresented social groups.

More Details
Documentation may include a complete employee roster with a column indicating the relevant demographic categorization per person. Or if your company collects demographic information in a management application, a report that summarizes the data.

Reminders
Workforce includes full-time and part-time employees on the company's payroll.

You may redact employee names on any document provided.

questions.label: What percentage of your non-labor expenses are made with local independent suppliers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a list of suppliers that are independently-owned and within the same local area as your company headquarters/main production facility, as well as the amount spent with each supplier. 

More Details
Spreadsheet should include:

1) Supplier name.
2) Total cost of goods/services purchased from that supplier during the last fiscal year.
3) Supplier’s address.
4) Link to the supplier’s website, if available.
5) Description of how the supplier is independent.
6) Your company’s address (either headquarters or main production facility).
7) Total amount spent with all suppliers last fiscal year. 

Reminders
A supplier is any business that your company pays to provide a good or service. However, in the B Impact Assessment, suppliers will always exclude 1) your landlord, 2) your utility company, and 3) the entity to which you pay your taxes. Other questions in the assessment speak to these providers. 

To qualify for this question, a supplier cannot be a majority-owned subsidiary of another company or a publicly traded company. It must be independently-owned.

While the size and distance of a community may vary by context, local should generally be defined as a small-scale economically and culturally connected area. Examples include a metropolitan area or, in a less densely populated area, a county or the surrounding vicinity (usually within 50 miles or less).

questions.summary: Charitable Giving and Community Investment Policies and Practices
questions.label: What are your company’s practices regarding donations or community investments?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate your company’s charitable giving practices. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Webpage, product packaging, or employee handbook that includes a statement on the intended impact of your company’s philanthropy. 
Checkbox 2: Webpage, product packaging, or employee handbook that states your company’s consistent donations commitment.
Checkbox 3: Employee handbook or employee benefits package that includes the details of your employee matching program.
Checkbox 4: Statement in employee handbook or a company survey which shows that workers or customers direct the company’s charitable giving dollars. 
Checkbox 5: List of screening questions for prospective charitable partners or an impact measurement report that includes community investments.

Reminders
Simply engaging in one of the behaviors mentioned above does not count for this question. There must be a written component. Codifying a company’s expectations in writing helps to ensure that your values are consistently practiced within the company.

questions.label: What percentage of your company revenue comes from local and independent clients or customers?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please list the revenues generated from local and independent clients/customers. 

More Details
If your company sells directly to consumers, the spreadsheet should include:

1) List of products sold in the last fiscal year.
2) Revenue received from each product.
3) Amount of that product (by revenue) delivered to or purchased by someone local to your company (i.e. calculated based on addresses on customer invoices).
4) Total revenue from all products in the last fiscal year. 

If your company provides services to other businesses, the spreadsheet should include:

1) List of clients in the last fiscal year.
2) Revenue received from each client.
3) Client address (main headquarters/production facility).
4) Description of how the client is independent.
5) Total revenues in the last fiscal year.

If your company sells B2C and B2B, please provide the requested information for all applicable revenue.

Reminders
Please keep in mind the definitions for local and independent.

While the size and distance of a community may vary by context, local should generally be defined as a small-scale economically and culturally connected area. Examples include a metropolitan area or, in a less densely populated area, a county or the surrounding vicinity (usually within 50 miles or less). 

Independent is defined through the lens of ownership and, therefore, is applicable when your client is a business. An independent client cannot be a majority-owned subsidiary of another company or a publicly traded company. It must be independently-owned.

questions.label: What other ways does your company support the local community?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company either invests money locally, creates community spaces, and/or provides jobs to local residents. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Recent statement from the bank that handles the majority of your company’s financial needs and a link to the bank’s website. If your company has more than one bank, please upload documentation regarding your primary bank relationship, defined by bank deposit size and assets held. The statement should clearly indicates the name of both the bank and your company. The balance amount and other sensitive information can be redacted. 

Checkbox 2: List of tax-deductible donations made to registered charities in the last fiscal year, including 1) Charity name, 2) Charity website, 3) Total amount donated to that charity in the last fiscal year, and 4) Your company profits in the last fiscal year.

Checkbox 3: Photos of a community event/meeting that takes place in your company’s space, including a detailed caption that describes the local group/s and how frequently this activity occurs, or a link to a form on your website that local groups can fill out to book your facility.

Checkbox 4: Link to webpage that describes community investment program or scholarship application. 

Checkbox 5: HR document that includes a desire to increase the number of local job applicants and recommendations for how to do so or a job posting that includes an explicit statement that local candidates are encouraged to apply for positions.

Reminders
Please keep in mind the definitions for local and independent.

While the size and distance of a community may vary by context, local should generally be defined as a small-scale economically and culturally connected area. Examples include a metropolitan area or, in a less densely populated area, a county or the surrounding vicinity (usually within 50 miles or less). 

An independent bank cannot be a majority-owned subsidiary of another company or a publicly traded company.

questions.label: Is the community where you operate, which you support in the ways identified above, an underserved community?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide data to illustrate how the community your serve through your local economic development efforts is underserved.

More Details
Documentation may include government data that categorizes your area as low income or reports from community development organizations that show that the area is comprised of demographic groups that do not traditionally have access to certain positive social or economic outcomes.

Reminders
Underserved communities may vary by context or geography, so please provide data specific to the small-scale economically and culturally connected area in which you operate.

questions.label: How has your company measured outcomes or determined whether your formal giving commitment contributes to positive outcomes for the beneficiaries of your charity partners?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company systematically determines that your charitable giving activities resulted in a positive change over time for your beneficiaries. Evidence must be provided for each answer option.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Survey of beneficiaries.
Checkbox 2: Summary of results from control groups.
Checkbox 3: Summary of results from randomized control groups (include description of methodology for setting up the control groups).
Checkbox 4: Analysis of your company’s outcomes data that includes a comparison to third party research on the topic.
Checkbox 5: Data that shows the connection between your product/service and the positive outcome.
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence to show how you measure positive outcomes.

Reminders
Outcomes are not outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

questions.label: Does your outcome measurement demonstrate that your company is creating long-term or permanent outcomes for your beneficiaries?

questions.label: What percentage of energy use is produced from renewable sources?
questions.guidance: Include electricity and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide a spreadsheet that shows the type and quantity of all renewable energy sources used by your company during the last 12 months and how much energy was used overall during that same period. In addition, please provide proof of the purchase or use of a renewable energy source.

More Details
Spreadsheet should include:
1) Description of the type of renewable energy (wind power purchased from a utility company, electricity from on-site solar panels, biomass, etc)
2) Total kilowatt hours used by each type of renewable energy during the last 12 months
3) Total kilowatt hours used by all energy sources during the last 12 months

Proof of purchase or use could include: an electric bill, pictures of on-site solar panels, etc.

Reminders
Both heating and electric use should be included to answer this question accurately. The energy from your heating fuel source will likely be in a unit that will need to be converted into kilowatt hours. 

Please also note that large-scale hydro energy from dams is not considered low-impact renewable energy due to the dams impact on local biodiversity and displacement of people. Green-e certified hydropower may be included.

questions.label: How does your company minimize the environmental impact of the packaging of your products?
questions.guidance: Select all practices that apply and are verifiable, regardless of the % of product/packaging the practice applies to.
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please upload documentation to verify the measures that your company has taken to understand and mitigate the impact of your product packaging.

More Details 
Sample Documents: 

Checkbox 1: Report on the packaging design and material selection of your products that includes environmental considerations. 
Checkbox 2: Report from the last two years that shows a reduction in the material inputs of product packaging.
Checkbox 3: Copies of third party environmental certifications for packaging materials. 
Checkbox 4: Picture of product packaging and recycling instructions.
Checkbox 5: Picture of non-toxic label on packaging or material analysis reports that include only non-toxic input materials.
Checkbox 6: Internal or external analysis that compares your company's packaging to an industry standard and shows a reduced environmental impact.

questions.label: For which material environmental impacts have you implemented processes that substantially reduce the environmental footprint of your agriculture?

Which of the following are material environmental impacts of concern in the manufacturing process for your industry? (Please exclude environmental impact outside of your manufacturing process, such as input materials used, supply chain impact, or use of product).
For those practices that you’ve selected above, which of the following is the primary method by which you’ve materially reduced the environmental footprint of your agriculture?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the agricultural process that has most significantly reduced the environmental footprint of your agriculture. 

More Details
Sample documents: 

Checkbox 1: Crop rotation schedule or other long-term planning documents that show action taken to minimize soil damage and agricultural run-off.
Checkbox 2: Pictures of water conservation growing techniques (e.g. drip-tech, hydroponics, etc.), including detailed captions.
Checkbox 3: Written pest management strategy or copy of relevant certification.
Checkbox 4: Waste analysis that includes amount of total waste produced, how much of that waste is recycled/re-used, and what practices are in place to recycle/re-use the material.
Checkbox 5: Pictures of carbon sequestration methods, including detailed captions.

Reminders
Only one answer option should be selected for this question -- the primary method through which you have reduced your environmental impact.

questions.label: For which material environmental impacts have you implemented processes that substantially reduce the environmental footprint of your manufacturing?
Beyond your primary method indicated above, which other practices do you also have in place on a majority of the land cultivated for your products?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the processes that reduce the environmental footprint of your agriculture and are applied to the majority of your agricultural land. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents: 

Checkbox 1: Crop rotation schedule or other long-term planning documents that show action taken to minimize soil damage and agricultural run-off.
Checkbox 2: Pictures of water conservation growing techniques (e.g. drip-tech, hydroponics, etc.), including detailed captions.
Checkbox 3: Written pest management strategy or copy of relevant certification.
Checkbox 4: Waste analysis that includes amount of total waste produced, how much of that waste is recycled/re-used, and what practices are in place to recycle/re-use the material.
Checkbox 5: Pictures of carbon sequestration methods, including detailed captions.

Reminders
Please do not include the primary method through which you have reduced the environmental impact of your agriculture, as it has been captured in another question.

questions.label: For those practices that you’ve selected above, which of the following is the primary method by which you’ve materially reduced the environmental footprint of your manufacturing?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the process that has most significantly reduced the environmental footprint of your manufacturing. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Report of how much source material is used in your product as compared to your competitors.
Checkbox 2: Recent report of waste analysis, including the amount produced and the amount re-used.
Checkbox 3: Dated blueprints or bill of sale for a water recycling or closed-loop recycling system, including pictures of it in use and a detailed caption.
Checkbox 4: Description of your original process and your current process to use significantly less water in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and water usage data from before and after the change. 
Checkbox 5: Description of your original process and your current process to use significantly fewer chemicals in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and a list of chemicals used before and after the change.
Checkbox 6: Description of your original process and your current process to use little to no energy in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and energy usage data from before and after the change. 

Reminders
Only one answer option should be selected for this question -- the primary method through which you have reduced your environmental impact.

questions.label: Are any of the following true regarding the results of your environmentally focused agricultural processes?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how you have eliminated the negative environmental impact of one or more aspects of your agricultural footprint.

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Recent report of carbon emissions, including the amount produced and the amount offset.
Checkbox 2: Recent report of waste analysis, including the amount produced and the amount re-used.
Checkbox 3: Recent report of water usage that is cross-referenced with an analysis of your impact on the local watershed, including a detailed explanation of how that impact was calculated. 
Checkbox 4: Certification attesting to the elimination of all harmful chemicals from your agricultural process.

Reminders
This question is only applicable if your company has measured the selected outcome with a structured, consistent, and well-documented methodology.

questions.label: Beyond your primary method indicated above, which other practices do you also have in place?
questions.guidance: Only select practices that apply to the manufacturing process for a majority of your products (on a revenue basis).
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate the processes that reduce the environmental footprint of your manufacturing. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: Report of how much source material is used in your product as compared to your competitors.
Checkbox 2: Recent report of waste analysis, including the amount produced and the amount re-used.
Checkbox 3: Dated blueprints or bill of sale for a water recycling or closed-loop recycling system, including pictures of it in use and a detailed caption.
Checkbox 4: Description of your original process and your current process to use significantly less water in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and water usage data from before and after the change. 
Checkbox 5: Dated blueprints or bill of sale for a wastewater treatment system, including pictures of it in use and recent a water quality report that compares the quality of the water entering your facility to the water leaving it. 
Checkbox 6: Description of your original process and your current process to use significantly fewer chemicals in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and a list of chemicals used before and after the change.
Checkbox 7: Description of your original process and your current process to use little to no energy in an aspect of your manufacturing, including pictures and energy usage data from before and after the change. 
Checkbox 8: Pictures of on-site renewable energy, including a report of how much energy is generated and how much is required for your manufacturing process.

Reminders
Please do not include the primary method through which you have reduced the environmental impact of your manufacturing, as it has been captured in another question.

Checkbox 4: Analysis of your company’s outcomes data that includes a comparison to third party research on the topic.
Checkbox 5: Data that shows the connection between your product/service and the positive outcome.
Checkbox 6: Please provide evidence to show how you measure positive outcomes.

Reminders
Outcomes are not outputs. Outputs are the direct result of your business objective or program goal. An outcome is the difference made by the output. For example, if 20 people completed a computer skills training and 15 of those individuals received a pay increase because of their new skill, the number of people trained would be an output and the pay increase would be an outcome.

questions.label: How many individuals served qualify in the previously selected underserved populations during the last 12 months? Do not duplicate individuals and households. Estimates within +/- 5% are acceptable.
Does your company do any of the following to improve the access or impact of your product for the underserved populations that you serve?
questions.documentationText:
Overview
Please provide documentation to illustrate how your company has made your product/service more accessible to an underserved population. Evidence must be provided for each answer option selected. 

More Details
Sample documents:

Checkbox 1: List of prices for different income brackets, including how the company determines how a customer meets the low income criteria.
Checkbox 2: Application for financing, including interest rate and expected payment amount. 
Checkbox 3: Link to website or other customer-facing materials that show the prices for all of your products/services.
Checkbox 4: Contract with vendor who provide training on use/maintenance of the product or customer-facing materials explaining that benefit.
Checkbox 5: Analysis of competitor pricing that shows that an underserved population would pay more for a similar product/service, if buying from another company.
Checkbox 6: Market research and description of how product information was developed to match the literacy level and needs of prospective underserved customers.
Checkbox 7: Product blueprint that includes a detailed caption of the design element that was intended to make the product more accessible to underserved groups. 

Reminders
All activities indicated must reflect practices designed for or actively benefiting underserved populations. Examples of underserved populations include low income, poor, or very poor individuals, as well as demographic groups that may not traditionally have access to the positive social or economic outcomes delivered by your product or service. This may vary by context and by geography. Take into consideration gender, ethnicity, sexual-orientation, and/or disabilities.

questions.label: Use the field below to describe any innovative technology, distribution, or pricing models selected previously.
If relevant, how many individuals served in the last 12 months qualify as being at the bottom of the pyramid, with incomes below $2.50/day? Estimates within +/- 5% are acceptable.
questions.guidance: Do not double-count (e.g. if you report 5 households, do not also report the number of individuals in those 5 households).

What % of customers/end beneficiaries of your product or service in the last 12 months were from an underserved population identified in the question "Underserved Beneficiary Types"?
