impactAreas.name: Governance
impactAreas.description:
The Governance Impact Area evaluates your company's overall mission, ethics, accountability and transparency through topics such as integration of social and environmental goals in employees’ performance evaluation, impact reporting and transparency, stakeholder engagement, and more.

**Tip:** Information about your company financials and the company's governance structure will help you complete this section.
impactAreas.intro: Learn what your company can do to enhance policies and practices pertaining to its mission, ethics, accountability and transparency.
impactAreas.excerpt: Governance evaluates a company's overall mission, engagement around its social/environmental impact, ethics, and transparency. This section also evaluates the ability of a company to protect their mission and formally consider stakeholders in decision making through their corporate structure (e.g. benefit corporation) or corporate governing documents.

impactAreas.name: Workers
impactAreas.description:
The Workers Impact Area evaluates your company's contribution to its employees’ financial, physical, professional, and social well-being. 

After a few introductory questions that will determine the relevant types of questions for your company, you will see four sections focused on the different dimensions of employee well-being and job quality. If you indicate in the introductory questions that you have a specific impact business model focused on benefiting your workers, you will also see a series of questions specific to your business model. Impact business models, however, are rare and most companies will indicate that they do NOT have a specific Impact Business Model focused on their workers.

**Tip:** If possible, have your employee roster, handbook, and payroll available when completing this section, or ask your HR department for help.
impactAreas.intro: Learn what your company can do to contribute to your employees’ financial, physical, professional, and social well-being.
impactAreas.excerpt: Workers evaluates a company’s contributions to its employees’ financial security, health & safety, wellness, career development, and engagement & satisfaction. In addition, this section recognizes business models designed to benefit workers, such as companies that are at least 40% owned by non-executive employees and those that have workforce development programs to support individuals with barriers to employment.

impactAreas.name: Community
impactAreas.description:
The Community Impact Area evaluates your company's positive impact on the external communities in which your company operates, covering topics like diversity, economic impact, civic engagement, and supply chain impact. After a few introductory questions to determine the relevant questions for your company, you'll see four sections on the different dimensions of community impact. If you indicate in the introductory questions that you have a specific impact business model focused on producing positive outcomes for a specific group of community stakeholders, you will also see a series of questions specific to your business model(s). Impact business models, however, are rare and most companies will indicate that they do NOT have a specific Impact Business Model focused on their community. 

**Tip:** If your company has a vendor list, employee roster, company financials, or any purchasing policies or procedures, have those nearby when completing this Impact Area.
impactAreas.intro: Learn what your company can do to contribute to the economic and social well-being of the communities in which it operates.
impactAreas.excerpt: Community evaluates a company’s engagement with and impact on the communities in which it operates, hires from, and sources from. Topics include diversity, equity & inclusion, economic impact, civic engagement, charitable giving, and supply chain management. In addition, this section recognizes business models that are designed to address specific community-oriented problems, such as poverty alleviation through fair trade sourcing or distribution via microenterprises, producer cooperative models, locally focused economic development, and formal charitable giving commitments.

impactAreas.name: Environment
impactAreas.description:
The Environment Impact Area evaluates the company's overall environmental stewardship, including how the company identifies and manages general environmental impacts, its management of air and climate issues, water sustainability, and impacts on land and life. After a few introductory questions to determine the relevant questions for your company, you'll see four sections on the different dimensions of environmental impact. If you indicate in the introductory questions that you have a specific impact business model focused on producing specific positive environmental impact, you will also see a series of questions specific to your business model(s). Impact business models, however, are rare and most companies will indicate that they do NOT have a specific Impact Business Model focused on the environment.

**Tip:** The questions in this Impact Area could be best completed by a facilities/operations manager. If possible, have environmental policies and procedures, utility information, a vendor list, and facility information available when completing this section.
impactAreas.intro: Learn what your company can do to improve its overall environmental stewardship.
impactAreas.excerpt: Environment evaluates a company’s overall environmental management practices as well as its impact on the air, climate, water, land, and biodiversity. This includes the direct impact of a company’s operations and, when applicable its supply chain and distribution channels. This section also recognizes companies with environmentally innovative production processes and those that sell products or services that have a positive environmental impact. Some examples might include products and services that create renewable energy, reduce consumption or waste, conserve land or wildlife, provide less toxic alternatives to the market, or educate people about environmental problems.

impactAreas.name: Customers
impactAreas.description:
The Customers Impact Area evaluates your company's value to your direct customers and the consumers of your products or services covering topics like ethical and positive marketing, warranty and quality assurance of products and services, data privacy, data security, and more. After a few introductory questions to determine the relevant questions for your company, you'll see one section of questions focused on Customer Stewardship. If you indicate in the introductory questions that you have a specific impact business model focused on delivering a specific positive outcome for your customers, you will also see a series of questions specific to that impact business model. Impact business models, however, are rare and most companies will indicate that they do NOT have a specific Impact Business Model focused on their customers or consumers.

**Tip:** A product/service roster broken down by revenue and/or a client list would be helpful for completing this Impact Area.
impactAreas.intro: Learn what your company can do to improve the value that you create for your direct customers and the consumers of your products or services.
impactAreas.excerpt: Customers evaluates a company’s stewardship of its customers through the quality of its products and services, ethical marketing, data privacy and security, and feedback channels. In addition, this section recognizes products or services that are designed to address a particular social problem for or through its customers, such as health or educational products, arts & media products, serving underserved customers/clients, and services that improve the social impact of other businesses or organizations.

impactAreas.name: Disclosure Questionnaire
impactAreas.description: The Disclosure Questionnaire is an unweighted group of Yes/No questions that allows your company to confidentially disclose any sensitive industries, practices, fines, or sanctions related to your business or your partners. For companies pursuing B Corp Certification, disclosures that are deemed material may, in rare circumstances, result in ineligibility, but more commonly result in no further action, additional transparency on your B Corp Public Profile or required remediation.
impactAreas.intro: Identify any potentially sensitive industries, practices, outcomes or fines/sanctions of your company that are not explicitly called out in the rest of the assessment.
impactAreas.headline: Disclosure Questionnaire
impactAreas.excerpt:
The Disclosure Questionnaire identifies any potentially sensitive industries, practices, outcomes or
fines/sanctions of your company. It does not factor into a company’s B Impact Assessment score, but is reviewed to ​determine ​eligibility ​for ​B ​Corp ​Certification.

impactTopics.name: Governance Metrics
impactTopics.description: This section asks for your company to provide important financial information that will be referenced later in the assessment.

impactTopics.name: Workers Impact Area Introduction
impactTopics.description: This section identifies who should be considered a "worker" in the B Impact Assessment and reports your worker-related metrics. It also identifies whether your company is designed to deliver a specific, material, positive impact for its workers, and if so, opens the Worker Impact Business Model section that is most applicable.

impactTopics.name: Disclosure Outcomes & Penalties
impactTopics.description: Disclosure questions concerning litigation, relocation of communities, accidents, and on-the-job fatality.

impactTopics.name: Disclosure Practices
impactTopics.description: Disclosure questions on sensitive practices.

impactTopics.name: Disclosure Industries
impactTopics.description: Disclosure questions on specific production and trade.

impactTopics.name: Supply Chain Disclosure
impactTopics.description: Disclosure questions concerning the significant suppliers of the company

impactTopics.name: Environment Impact Area Introduction
impactTopics.description: This section asks about your environmental footprint to determine which questions are applicable later on in the assessment. It also identifies whether your company's product/service is designed to deliver a specific, material, positive environmental impact, and if so, opens the Environmental Impact Business Model section that is most applicable.

impactTopics.name: Microfranchise Poverty Alleviation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that provide micro-entrepreneurship opportunities for underserved individuals through branded, owner-operated franchises with less than ten employees.

impactTopics.name: Producer Cooperative
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that use a supplier-owned cooperative structure to empower suppliers by organizing production, decision making, and profit distribution.

impactTopics.name: Designed to Give
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that have a formal standing commitment to donate significant portions of company profits, revenue, equity, or time to charitable causes.

impactTopics.name: Supply Chain Poverty Alleviation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that reduce poverty in their supply chain through trade terms, positive labor conditions, and support for underserved suppliers in low-income, poor, or very poor markets (e.g. fair trade, direct trade).

impactTopics.name: Local Economic Development
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies designed to strengthen their local economy by committing a significant portion of their procurement and/or sales to remain local.

impactTopics.name: Workforce Development
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies with targeted hiring and training programs for chronically underemployed populations.

impactTopics.name: Microdistribution Poverty Alleviation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that provide micro-entrepreneurship opportunities for underserved individuals through a distribution network of independent sales representatives.

impactTopics.name: National Economic Development
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies in underdeveloped markets designed to strengthen national economic development via privatization or import substitution.

impactTopics.name: Education
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services enhance the skills and knowledge of individuals (e.g. primary/secondary schools, textbooks, tutoring services, career training).

impactTopics.name: Community Impact Area Introduction
impactTopics.description: This section identifies whether your company is designed to deliver a specific, material, positive impact for its community, and if so, opens the Community Impact Business Model section that is most applicable.

impactTopics.name: Economic Empowerment for the Underserved
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services provide or assist in the provision of income generating activities for underserved individuals (e.g. financial services, insurance services, or benefits consulting for the underserved)

impactTopics.name: Support for Underserved/Purpose Driven Enterprises
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services enable the financial or operational success of businesses that are purpose driven or underserved (e.g. accounting services for nonprofits, impact investing or fundraising platforms)

impactTopics.name: Customers Impact Area Introduction
impactTopics.description: This section identifies whether your company's product/service is designed to deliver a specific, material, positive impact for its customers (beyond the value normally provided from goods or services), and if so, opens the Customer Impact Business Model section that is most applicable.

impactTopics.name: Basic Services for the Underserved
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services provide or assist in the provision of basic services to individuals without prior access (e.g. electricity, shelter, clean water, basic sanitation).

impactTopics.name: Serving Underserved Populations Direct
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company has qualified for a previous Customer IBM, and you can verify that your positive product/service impact benefits organizations that serve low income or traditionally underserved populations.

impactTopics.name: Arts, Media, & Culture
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services promote or preserve art, cultural heritage, or civic engagement (e.g. independent journalism, artisanal crafts, photography)

impactTopics.name: Health & Wellness Improvement
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services promote the health and wellness of individuals (e.g. healthcare products/services, exercise equipment, BPA-free products).

impactTopics.name: Infrastructure/Market Access Building
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services provide necessary infrastructure to communities that were previously inaccessible (e.g. roads, bridges, railways, ports, building and construction materials, mobile telecommunications)

impactTopics.name: Impact Improvement
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services improve the social or environmental impact of your client organizations (e.g. general sustainability consulting).

impactTopics.name: Health Outcomes (Significant)
impactTopics.description: hidden: This is purely a scoring goal, needed for the Health IBM to score appropriately

impactTopics.name: Health Outcomes (Partial)
impactTopics.description: hidden: This is purely a scoring goal, needed for the Health IBM to score appropriately

impactTopics.name: Improved Impact (Direct)
impactTopics.description: hidden: This is purely a scoring goal, needed for the Improved Impact IBM to score appropriately

impactTopics.name: Improved Impact (Indirect)
impactTopics.description: hidden: This is purely a scoring goal, needed for the Improved Impact IBM to score appropriately

impactTopics.name: Serving in Need Populations
impactTopics.description: Recognizes social product models that are targeted to or benefits traditionally in need and underserved populations

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Reporting
impactTopics.description: Questions on loan portfolio reporting requirements, key social and environmental performance indicators tracked, and your annual impact reporting practice.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Management
impactTopics.description: Questions include measurement process for social and environmental performance and loan origination.

impactTopics.name: Investment Criteria
impactTopics.description: Questions include loan review process, social and environmental performance standards of loan portfolio, underwriting standards and credit scoring methodology.

impactTopics.name: Leadership & Outreach
impactTopics.description: Questions include performance in industry certifications and ratings (e.g. CDFI, CDE, CRA, CARS), and additional services provided to borrowers.

impactTopics.name: Targeted for Investment
impactTopics.description: Questions include loan size, interest rate, products / services, financing, and communication with clients.

impactTopics.name: Business Model and Engagement
impactTopics.description: This section asks introductory questions about the company's products and services and identiies whether the company is serving in need or underrepresented populations.

impactTopics.name: Quality and Continuous Improvement
impactTopics.description: This section focuses on best practices in the development, maintenance, and improvement of company products and services to ensure the highest quality and most impactful products for addressing educational needs.

impactTopics.name: Educational Outcomes
impactTopics.description: This section measures the methods and results of outcomes measurements both for intermediary beneficiaries and or students, with an emphasis on positive outcomes for special interest populations.

impactTopics.name: Educational Transparency
impactTopics.description: This section focuses on the methods in which the company transparently shares information about their product or services impact and its marketing tactics.

impactTopics.name: Privacy and Consumer Protection
impactTopics.description: This section focuses on issues and best practices around the use and collection of private data, ensuring the protection and ethical practice of those companies where individual data is being collected.

impactTopics.name: Serving in Need Populations (Quality and Continuous Improvement)
impactTopics.description: This is a calculated section based on the % of underserved or in need beneficiaries and the Quality and Continuous Improvement section.

impactTopics.name: Serving in Need Populations (Outcomes)
impactTopics.description: This is a calculated section based on the % of underserved or in need beneficiaries and the Outcomes section.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Reporting
impactTopics.description: Questions on investee reporting requirements, key social and environmental performance indicators tracked, and your annual impact reporting practice.

impactTopics.name: Past Performance
impactTopics.description: Questions on your parent firm's impact investment portfolio, target HDI, and participation in industry initiatives.

impactTopics.name: Current Fund
impactTopics.description: Questions relevant to your current impact investment portfolio and target HDI level.

impactTopics.name: Positive Impact
impactTopics.description: Questions on your written policies and practices on due diligence and formal investment criteria in terms of the social and environment performance of your investees and co-investors.

impactTopics.name: Mission Lock
impactTopics.description: Questions include incentive structure, charitable donations, and mission-locked governance structure for investees.

impactTopics.name: Capacity Building
impactTopics.description: Questions on the types, specific topics, timing and resources allocated for capacity-building of investees.

impactTopics.name: Educational Models and Engagement
impactTopics.description: This section assesses the extent to which the company is able to deliver long term sustained educational services  and its engagement with the higher education and broader community to advance higher education and promote well-being

impactTopics.name: Marketing, Recruiting, and Transparency
impactTopics.description: This section measures the policies, practices, and results of the institution’s recruiting practices to ensure accurate information and consumer protection

impactTopics.name: Student Outcomes
impactTopics.description: This section assesses the extent to which the institution delivers positive outcomes for its enrollees, particularly traditionally underrepresented groups, including their ability to progress to completion and achieve economic independence

impactTopics.name: Student Outcomes (Special Interest Students)
impactTopics.description: hidden: The section includes automatic calculations from student outcomes that involve the extent to which the institution is serving special interest populations, including low income individuals, underrepresented minorities, and other groups

impactTopics.name: Student Experience
impactTopics.description: This section measures the extent to which the institution delivers a positive student experience, including quality instruction and faculty and supportive and accessible student services, and external career and service opportunities

impactTopics.name: Disclosure Questionnaire
impactTopics.description: The Disclosure Questionnaire is an unweighted group of Yes/No questions regarding potentially sensitive issues and is used for due diligence.

impactTopics.name: Targeted for Investment
impactTopics.description: Questions include client profile, loan size, product offering, and specific socially and environmentally oriented products.

impactTopics.name: Serving in Need Populations
impactTopics.description: Questions include the underserved communities your product(s) target and customer characteristics.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Reporting
impactTopics.description: Questions on your bank's social rating, data sharing practice, client satisfaction and client base.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Management
impactTopics.description: Metrics on borrower relationships and customer retention.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Reporting
impactTopics.description: Questions on your annual impact reporting practice, and transparency of proxy voting records and shareholder advocacy.

impactTopics.name: Leadership & Outreach
impactTopics.description: Questions on services to facilitate access to the poor, individual borrowers, and small and medium enterprises.

impactTopics.name: Portfolio Management
impactTopics.description: Questions include monitoring, reporting and improving social and environmental performance of your company's investments.

impactTopics.name: Investment Criteria
impactTopics.description: Questions include loan review process, social responsibility practices and key debt limit indicators.

impactTopics.name: Leadership & Outreach
impactTopics.description: Questions include client education and investment policy with clients.

impactTopics.name: Investment Criteria
impactTopics.description: Questions include process, policies and practices on evaluting the social and environmental criteria for investments, allocation of staff time and resources for this purpose, and utilization of third-party ratings.

impactTopics.name: Targeted for Investment
impactTopics.description: Key metrics on asset under management in microfinance, positive impact, ESG-screened investments and advocacy.

impactTopics.name: Environmentally Innovative Agricultural Process
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company utilizes innovative agricultural processes that significantly reduce your environmental footprint based on past performance or industry benchmarks (e.g. regenerative agriculture).

impactTopics.name: Environmentally Innovative Manufacturing Process
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company utilizes innovative manufacturing or distribution processes that significantly reduce your environmental footprint compared to past performance or industry benchmarks.

impactTopics.name: Environmentally Innovative Wholesale Process
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company utilizes innovative manufacturing or distribution processes that significantly reduce your environmental footprint compared to past performance or industry benchmarks.

impactTopics.name: Renewable or Cleaner-burning Energy
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services reduce GHG emissions through the provision of renewable or cleaner burning energy (e.g. solar panel manufacturers/installers, hybrid vehicles, products self-powered by renewable energy).

impactTopics.name: Resource Conservation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services reduce resource use and/or limit waste to landfill (e.g. products made with recycled/reused input materials, recycling services, energy-efficient appliances)

impactTopics.name: Land/wildlife Conservation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services preserve or restore natural environments and/or protect animals (e.g. reforestation, sustainably harvested agriculture, protected parks)

impactTopics.name: Toxin Reduction / Remediation
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services reduce or remediate toxins or pollution (e.g. organic certified products, non-toxic cleaners, non-GMO verified products)

impactTopics.name: Material & Energy Use
impactTopics.description: Key metrics concerning the water and energy use and efficiency of your company's projects.

impactTopics.name: Environmental Education & Information
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company's products/services promote awareness about important environmental issues or facilitates conservation (e.g. environmental resource guides, carbon credit platforms, research labs)

impactTopics.name: Community
impactTopics.description: Questions specific to project type (e.g. low-income housing), client type, relevant tax credits, and your company's participation in advocacy.

impactTopics.name: Certification
impactTopics.description: Metrics on projects with specific industry certifications e.g. LEED, Energy Star, Architecture 2030 Challenge.

impactTopics.name: Training & Collaboration
impactTopics.description: Questions on staff qualification, integrated design process, and public collaboration.

impactTopics.name: Mission Locked
impactTopics.description: Recognizes corporate forms and amendments that preserve mission and/or considers stakeholders regardless of company ownership

impactTopics.name: Safety
impactTopics.description: Questions include formal occupational health & safety policies, safety programs, and the measurement of injury/accident days.

impactTopics.name: Construction Practices
impactTopics.description: Metrics on your company's projects regarding of waste, energy, water, indoor air quality, and site condition policies.

impactTopics.name: Community
impactTopics.description: Questions specific to project type (e.g. low-income housing), client type, relevant tax credits, and your company's participation in advocacy.

impactTopics.name: Training & Collaboration
impactTopics.description: Questions on staff qualification, integrated design process, and hiring process.

impactTopics.name: Worker Owned
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable to companies that empower workers through distributive ownership models (e.g. worker-owned cooperatives, ESOPs).

impactTopics.name: Safety
impactTopics.description: Questions include formal occupational health & safety policies, safety programs, and the measurement of injury/accident days.

impactTopics.description: Key metrics concerning the use of propriety documents, systems, tools, and modeling programs in design process as well as efficiency outcomes of projects

impactTopics.name: Serving Underserved Populations (Direct)
impactTopics.description: This IBM section is applicable if your company has qualified for a previous Customer IBM, and you can verify that your positive product/service impact directly benefits low income or traditionally underserved populations.
